results.description:
At several meet-ups members have brought up David Mitchell's name as someone they'd like to read more of. Several of Mitchell's novels have been short- or long-listed for the Man Booker Prize and he has won numerous literary awards. Mitchell has become such a popular author that in 2007, he was listed among Time Magazine's 100 Most Influential People in The World.

David Mitchell reinvents himself with each book, and it's thrilling to watch. His novels like Ghostwritten and Cloud Atlas spill over with narrators and language, collecting storylines connected more in spirit than in fact. In The Thousand Autumns of Jacob de Zoet, he harnesses that plenitude into a more traditional form, a historical novel set in Japan at the turn into the 19th century, when the island nation was almost entirely cut off from the West except for a tiny, quarantined Dutch outpost. Jacob is a pious but not unappealing prig from Zeeland, whose self-driven duty to blurt the truth in a corrupt and deceitful trading culture, along with his headlong love for a local midwife, provides the early engine for the story, which is confined at first to the Dutch enclave but crosses before long to the mainland. Every page is overfull with language, events, and characters, exuberantly saturated in the details of the time and the place but told from a knowing and undeniably modern perspective. It's a story that seems to contain a thousand worlds in one.

The novel won the 2011 Commonwealth Writers' Prize regional prize (South Asia and Europe); was long listed for the 2010 Man Booker Prize for Fiction, was one of Time Magazine's "Best Books of the Year" (#4 Fiction), and a New York Times Notable Book of the Year. It was shortlisted for the 2011 Walter Scott Prize. It's fairly hefty--512 pages, so don't wait to the last minute to start reading this one!
results.name: David Mitchell's The Thousand Autumns of Jacob de Zoet--Commonwealth Writers'

results.description:
It is all about costuming! 

Maybe you are designing your next costume or maybe you want to start designing one. It could be for comic con, Halloween, the Labyrinth's Masquerade ball or any other event! If you need an event to inspire you I will be hosting a fantasy picnic meetup in the following months. So there is always a reason to be planning your next costume.

The plan: we meet up at Applebee's  in fresh meadows. We bring whatever we need to plan with: pencils, paper, tablet, markers, computer. We share our thoughts and provide feedback for others. Enjoy a fresh beverage, appetizer, or dessert while we collaborate.  

This meetup will be more structured compared to the previous ones, for we will take turns sharing our ideas and allowing other members to give us tips, feed back, inspiration ,etc. 

After we are done sharing we will venture off to Michael's (a block away) for more inspiration and to gather supplies.

results.description:
A loving invitation to all ..

Beloved Friends, We are celebrating Osho's Enlightenment on Sunday March 20th 2:30 -7:30 pm at Osho Sadhana  Astoria , New York. A day of Meditation,  Music, Silence, Dance, Singing, Celebration, Laughter and much more. 

Free to Attend ! No cost.

Osho became enlightened on March 21st, 1953.

"You ask me: What happened when you became enlightened? 

I laughed, a real uproarious laugh, seeing the whole absurdity of trying to be enlightened. The whole thing is ridiculous because we are born enlightened, and to try for something that is already the case is the most absurd thing. If you already have it, you cannot achieve it; only those things can be achieved which you don't have, which are not intrinsic parts of your being. But enlightenment is your very nature." ~Osho (.Continued at the bottom) 

Location: Osho Sadhana Meditation Center. Astoria, NY


All are welcome. No prior experience necessary.

Dress recommendation 


Loose clothing. Meditation robes if available. Maroon color preferred.

"Enlightenment simply means becoming aware of yourself. Ordinarily, a man is awake to everything around him, but is not aware who is awake and aware of all the things around. So we remain on the periphery of life and the center remains in darkness. To bring light to that center, consciousness to that center is what enlightenment is.


It is just being absolutely centered in yourself, focusing all your consciousness upon yourself as if nothing else exists; only you are. " -Osho

Tentative Schedule:

2:30 - 3:00 Dance & Celebration

3:00 - 3:30 Laughter meditation

3:30 - 4:30  Osho Audio discourse &  Silent sitting meditation

4:30 - 5:30 Kundalini meditation/ NadBrahama meditation


5:30 - 6:00  Tea Break

6:00 - 7:30 -  Evening satsang  and celebration with  Video discourse 

When to arrive ?


Please arrive 10-15 minutes earlier for getting necessary instructions on meditations.You can join us from the morning (highly recommended) or join us for some of these sessions as your schedule permits. If you are joining in from in-between please text us or call us so that you don't come when some meditation session is going on.

Location / Walking directions of the Meditation Center :

N or Q train from 42nd Street, Times Square,directed to Ditmars Boulevard ( get off the train on the last stop)Walk north-east on 31st street towards Ditmars Blvd.Turn left at Ditmars Blvd.Walk from 31st street straight to 19th street in Ditmars Blvd.Turn right at 19th street towards 21st Drive.Turn left at 19th street and 21st drive to get to 18-52 block. When you reach to the house. come down through the stairs on the left side and enter through the second door. Please call  Nirupa[masked] if you have difficulty locating us.

There might be no signs posted at the door.

OSHO Talks about his Enlightenment:

"You ask me: What happened when you became enlightened? 
I laughed, a real uproarious laugh, seeing the whole absurdity of trying to be enlightened. The whole thing is ridiculous because we are born enlightened, and to try for something that is already the case is the most absurd thing. If you already have it, you cannot achieve it; only those things can be achieved which you don't have, which are not intrinsic parts of your being. But enlightenment is your very nature. 
I had struggled for it for many lives—it had been the only target for many many lives. And I had done everything that is possible to do to attain it, but I had always failed. It was bound to be so—because it cannot be an attainment. It is your nature, so how can it be your attainment? It cannot be made an ambition. 
Mind is ambitious—ambitious for money, for power, for prestige. And then one day, when it gets fed up with all these extrovert activities, it becomes ambitious for enlightenment, for liberation, for nirvana, for God. But the same ambition has come back; only the object he changed. First the object was outside, now the object is inside. But your attitude, your approach has not changed; you are the same person in the same rut, in the same routine. 
"The day I became enlightened" simply means the day I realized that there is nothing to achieve, there is nowhere to go, there is nothing to be done. We are already divine and we are already perfect—as we are. No improvement is needed, no improvement at all. God never creates anybody imperfect. Even if you come across an imperfect man, you will see that his imperfection is perfect. God never creates any imperfect thing." ~OSHO
results.how_to_find_us: Call Nirupa 201-688-9586 for directions and details
results.name: Osho Enlightenment day Celebration  - March 20th

results.description:
We've talked about it FOREVER - a few of us have done both Brooklyn and Great Neck - so lets go again!  Its reminiscent of my big expense account days & entertaining clients LOL.  I don't care if they were from Nashville, LA or London - they had all heard of Luger's and wanted to go.  Then, a relative worked at the Brooklyn restaurant for 30+ years, so it also reminds me of family & lots of family dinner memories.

The notorious Peter Luger (in Great Neck) for a Sunday dinner at 2:30 p.m.  Many feel its the finest steaks you can get in New York... or anywhere.  I love the place and tend to agree.

IMPORTANT NOTES:

You can’t find prices on their own Web site, and not even on sites like Yelp.

The main reason for this is: prices fluctuate a lot. (But beef prices are expected to go down this year).  So much so that the menu is printed without prices, and prices are actually hand-written.

On my last visit last year, these were the porterhouse prices. A steak for two would run you $93. A steak for three would go $140. Steak for four costs $187. They do sell single steak at $45, but at a very minimum you want to get the steak for two to ensure you have the finest cut. Of course, your mileage may vary, but that should give you a good idea of how much money you need to set aside. A reminder that they don’t take credit cards, so you need to bring a debit card, a Peter Luger card, or a big wad of cash! HAHA

Peter Luger starts with USDA Prime Beef imported from the Midwest - states like Iowa! (Can you tell where I'm FROM?) LOL. This is the best beef you can buy. As the USDA puts it, USDA Prime is the superior grade with amazing tenderness, juiciness, flavor and fine texture. It has the highest degree of fat marbling and is derived from the younger beef. That’s why Prime is generally featured at the most exclusive upscale steakhouse restaurants.  Then, they age the meat in their OWN aging facility here in NY.

The perfect length of dry aging is 4-6 weeks, not months. The beef is hung in giant slabs (a la the movie Rocky) in huge coolers directly underneath the restaurant and kept at a constant humidity and temperature. After they’ve aged, they’ll have a blue cheese-like “shell”. The meat is a gorgeous red color at this point and is cut into porterhouse steaks. The leftover beef that isn’t cut into steaks is ground into Peter Luger burgers. That’s right, the burgers that Luger sells for lunch is made of the very same beef that their steaks are made of–at a fraction of the cost. He implored us to come and try any day of the week before 4. The steak is then put under an 800 degree broiler. As it nears readiness, it’s cut up, put on the plate, and then finished under the broiler (which is why the plate is hot when it comes out). (Note - this is the same/similar process as Ruth Chris, who often tops their steaks off with a tab of butter.)  Then, you can top off your steak with some of the famous Peter Luger steak sauce.  Don't even go there to A-1! LOL

I have to say, I really appreciated this “insider’s look” at why these steaks are so phenomenal. It only makes me reiterate the 5 stars. This is a gem, and the experience is worth every dollar you spend.

http://peterluger.com/great-neck-menu/


Before, some of us might go earlier and go to my old haunt, the Americana Mall at Manhassat, also called the Long Island Miracle Mile.
results.name: PETER LUGER Great Neck - Let's Go!!

Imagine being able to say that you were at the 1st Meet Up that launched a "global moving" to inspire millions of people to get #offthecouch to start creating and living a life they loved, and live it well!" 

We're calling it… "The Little Meet Up That Could... + Will! " 

Well if you're there on Sunday, March 20, 2016 at 3:00 pm you can say that because you'll be causing a "global moving!"

We'll be Meeting Up at 3:00pm at the Central Park Columbus Circle Entrance to say hello, get connected, high five and enjoy a 5.6 mile leisurely walk that will loop around Central Park.


Here's a link for the course we'll be taking...

http://www.mapmyrun.com/us/manhattan-ny/5-6-mi-central-park-loop-course-1459162


We're allowing 2 hours for the event, and obviously you can walk the whole thing or as much as you'd like.

Please RSVP because we're going to have some tasty, heathy freebies for you, and we want to make sure we have enough, and maybe even more than enough.

This is our first event, and not knowing how many people will show we're going to scope out some possible places we could Meet Up for drinks and dinner afterwards for anyone who wants to keep the conversations "moving."

I hope you can make it, and if you can't, but you like what we're up to please become a member, and share with your friends and family as we have plans to create and host a boatload of fun + fit #couchkills events monthly, bi-weekly and then weekly, and when we really have our big boy pants on, daily!

"tag you're it!" become a member NOW :) 

#couchkills backstory

Very quietly a small team of people have been putting together the online bones of an idea to fuel a "global moving" at https://couchkills.com

Cryptoparty at The Whitney Museum: 

secure operating system training as part of Laura Poitras' ASTRONOISE exhibit.

photo credit Damon Winter/The New York Times

Free with Museum admission. No advance registration required. Seating is available on a first-come, first-served basis.

Location: Floor Three, Susan and John Hess Family Theater

The Whitney hosts a CryptoParty, an open forum on surveillance and privacy, featuring David Huerta, co-organizer of CryptoParty NYC, data journalist Matthew Mitchell, and privacy and security researcher Runa Sandvik.

This event is produced in collaboration with Harlo Holmes, Freedom of the Press Foundation, and is part of a series of public events, lectures, and talks organized in tandem with ​Laura Poitras: Astro Noise​.

Free with Museum admission. No advance registration required. Seating is available on a first-come, first-served basis.

We'll be located in their back room/studio space, so just come back whenever you arrive. You're welcome to come late/leave early, but we will be playing from 3:30 - 6:00 PM. They will have a brunch menu available so feel free to come a bit early and order a bite to eat before we play!

For more information about how our sessions work, please check out the Intro Page. For information about tunes we are playing these days, check out the Master Tune List and the comments for recent meet ups. There will be lots of repeats so we gain familiarity, but feel free to bring a song you to share/lead. For harmony players, if there's a song you'd like us to play, send me a note so we can ensure that at least one melody player knows it.

We will also put out a box for folks to donate $5 for each session. This is optional, but we will use this money to pay our fabulous jam leader, who will play the songs completely, loudly and in-tune for all to follow! Come jam with us!

Writers can let me know if they have a piece of writing to submit in advance.  Please send them to me early enough that I can submit them to the group a week in advance to be read and critiqued. These can be full short stories or novel chapters or excerpts. The 'Pages' and 'More' tabs contain guidelines - send writings to [masked]. Pieces submitted the day of the workshop can be up to 1500 words, time permitting.

Venue: The Hudson Eats section of the Brookfield mall is surprisingly spacious and quiet with tables of different sizes against the window wall. Walk across West Street or under it through the tunnel from the Path; A,C to Chambers, E to WTC, 2,3 to Park Place, R to Cortlandt. Walk straight back to the southwest side of the Winter Garden Atrium on the second level. My profile picture shows the round table in the corner of Hudson Eats near the escalator. If someone would like to suggest a better location please let me know. I am still looking for appropriate places.

results.description:
Come play bridge! Anyone who plays bridge or wishes to learn is welcome to attend. If you are new to bridge, please acquaint yourself with the basics before the meetup: www.rpbridge.net.

Minimum of five people need to come or I'll cancel.

Panera Bread, located directly across the parking lot from Wegmans, encourages groups and is happy to host us. Please be gracious to our hosts and order something, even if only a drink.

Be advised, the temperature at Panera can be variable. Consider bringing a sweater.

Whether your response is yes or no, PLEASE RSVP!

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY THE EVENING OF March 19TH -- AND HONOR IT -- as unlike other meetup groups, we require at least four players. If there are fewer than five people signed up as yes by the evening before, I will cancel the event.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for my long hair and decks of cards. I will try to get tables at the front.

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Acclaimed pianist Emir GAMSIZOGLU is performing classical recitals at historic Caffe Vivaldi, known by movies of Woody Allen & Al Pacino.

Every Sunday from February 28 - April 3, 4:00pm

During the month of February and March we have the most favorite works of Frederic Chopin in the concert program.

TICKETS: $20 : www.chattypianist.eventbrite.com

"Every Sunday afternoon, this veteran pianist plays to a crowd at Caffe Vivaldi. Beyond tickling the ivories, he shares fun facts about the music he plays and the composers who created it. Not a classical music connoisseur? Trust me, you don't have to be. It's nearly impossible not to be captivated by the music, let alone his charm and passion. Plus, the performance is truly spectacular, and the level you'd hear in a concert hall for a fraction of the price" Read more about the Chatty Pianist Sundays at "Tracy's New York Life" http://www.tracysnewyorklife.com/2016/02/new-york-chatty-pianist-caffe-vivaldi.html


Caffe Vivaldi offers a great brunch/lunch menu, coffee/tea selections, desserts & full bar; www.caffevivaldi.com

CONCERT PROGRAM:


Frederic CHOPIN [masked])

results.description:
The live jazz club with great food , drinks, and music.  There is no cover charge on Sunday afternoon with Keith  Ingham's band playing mostly jazz standards for a mix of young singers and seasoned professionals  open mic. performances.   This is no karaoke.  The singers come on stage with their music and get a chance to sing two songs.  And we, the audience get a chance to be entertained. 

The food and the drinks  are very good.  we will sit near the windows (not up near the stage) so we can talk and socialize with each other.  Sunday afternoons are very relaxing with mostly an older crowd of people.   We can plan a meetup on another evening  if we desire to listen to more intense jazz preformances.

Knit+Wine Night is purely a social gathering of knitters and crocheters who each bring their own projects to work on, enjoy one another's company -- and drink wine! We are a diverse group and welcome all who want to join us. We help each another when necessary, but there is no formal instruction. 

Each month's MeetUp is capped at 20 attendees, as that is the absolute most the restaurant can accommodate. 

Advance RSVP *for each attendee* is required in order to attend. Please note: The MeetUp system will not allow you to RSVP unless you have paid the $2 fee via Paypal.

venue.name: George Murphy Parish Center ( Under Church )

results.description:
Since 1997, the CRC has been planning activities at Holy Trinity.  The group originally was meant for "Young Adults" ages 20's and 30's but as the years passed we realized that we could not exclude or kick out our friends who were still important members of our community once they turned 40!  Today the CRC is an all inclusive group for those who are Young Adults in their hearts and minds.  You will find plenty of people in your peer groups and beyond.

On Sunday , February 21st we are going to invite all who want to find out more about the group and how to get involved for a short and informal gathering prior to the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity.  Current and past CRC Council members will be on hand to share experiences and take you ideas on things that the group can do.

Following the meeting the group will go to mass together (we'll have reserved seating) Following mass we have a party in the Murphy Center


Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to participate?  No, our members come from all over the tri state area.

What is the age limit?  There really is none (do you think Jesus would be that exclusive!) You will find most people are 20's - 40's and some 50's.  It is more about being Young at Heart.

What does the group focus on?  Mainly social activities and community service events.  We will also have spiritual activities from time to time.

If I can't make the meeting how can I get involved?  Try to come for the party afterwards or to any Sunday evening gathering.
results.name: New & Existing Members Welcome Meeting

group.name: Holy Trinity Church - Contemporary Roman Catholics  NYC

results.description:
Join us for a laid back Sunday at Harlem's best kept secret. Let's being in 2016 with a Bang. This little unknown location is known for impromptu performance by talented artist. The record covers decorating the ceiling and walls are imprints from the 50s, 60s, and 70s. With this small location you feel as though the universe has taken a little bit of every corner of the US and placed them in the soulful hand of Harlem. 

I love this place there is are no frills or nothing remotely pretentious about it. I feel like I am in a college dorm of an amazing DJ. It is an easy laid back place and I guarantee, you will be back!


We can fill this location to the brim.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=25ALPiHGdXM

• The bar is cash only

• No Cover Charge


• The drinks are awesome

• There is no cover charge

•Very laid back location and awesome staff

group.name: Evenings & Weekends in New York City

results.description:
All you love is gone. The Stilt-Sands, a floating city you have called home since birth, was torn to pieces before your eyes. Ensorcelled before the disaster, you could do nothing to save anyone but yourself, watching the horror as if it were nothing but a bad dream.

Your refuge is the Salty Cormorant, an odd amalgamation of pirate and Navy vessel. There, you came fully back to your senses, and are filled with nothing but rage and pain. And you aren’t the only one. You, and the other 300 survivors, have been robbed of home and health, and there are others who would see it righted, or avenged. You are told that you sail for Precipice Port. A fortnight cannot pass soon enough. Until then, you will find out everything the crew of this strange ship knows, to find some clue about the terrible beast He. However, you are not alone in this pursuit. The evil that trapped your minds has followed you, and it is not done with you yet. 

Stilt-Sand Survivors is the first chapter in the new WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Vengeance at Sea" by Noah Anderson, set in the “Ten Isles” setting developed by Noah Anderson in association with the WildPig community. All players are welcome. Characters are 1st level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.
results.name: D&D 5E: Vengeance at Sea Chapter 1 - Stilt-Sand Survivors

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour that includes an ice breaker and prizes, light appetizers, and is topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates."

SEE THE VENUE:

http://www.boccaeast.com

HOW IT WILL WORK:

5-5:45pm - Happy Hour complete with light appetizers (flat bread, meat & cheeses - $7 select red & white wine and prosecco) , a fun ice breaker, and  prizes awarded to the two people who get the most matches.

5:45pm - You'll be seated for your first speeddating round.

5:45-6:45 - You'll have approximately* 7-10  three to four minute "mini-dates"

6:45 - Turn in your dating cards to the host and mingle. Matches will be emailed to you within 48 hours.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$32  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Ice Breaker Speeddating- Ages 24-37

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)

results.description:
This is a talk I'm co-hosting with my friend and fellow coach Mike, see the info below!

=======

Have you EVER wanted to CREATE an OPEN RELATIONSHIP with a partner, but weren't EXACTLY sure how to do it? 

Did you think they might get upset? ~~~ Or break up with you? ~~~ Or think that you didn't love them? ~~~

Creating an OPEN RELATIONSHIP can be super simple! If it's done in the right way. 

Although having these types of conversations with your partner can seem SCARY and even completely INTIMIDATING at first, once you get past your fears -- and have the KEY CONVERSATIONS we will discuss during this seminar -- you'll be blown away at how ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE an OPEN RELATIONSHIP can be!

This lecture will be held over the summer for $295. You can attend this lecture for FREE this Sunday! (With a $20 minimum donation to cover room costs.)

Spaces are extremely limited so RSVP Now! There's only 10 spots available!

We will also be going over the THREE FUNDAMENTALS of what makes any relationship incredibly amazing! Concepts that will be the FOUNDATION of your OPEN RELATIONSHIPS and that carry over to your EXCLUSIVE RELATIONSHIPS as well! To maximize your relationships all across the board!!!

This is an incredibly interesting topic that will have a massive positive impact on you if you're someone that wants to have absolutely AMAZING, INCREDIBLE and HONEST relationships!! And ESPECIALLY if you're someone that's wants to KNOW how to create a MIND-BLOWING OPEN RELATIONSHIP -- 100% Guilt Free!!! ; )

It's a lecture that you WON'T WANT TO MISS and that will CHANGE the way you see RELATIONSHIPS and WHAT'S POSSIBLE, forever!

====

Justin

http://JustinAttraction.com

http://NaturalAttractionNYC.com
results.how_to_find_us: Room 17F
results.name: Successful Polyamory : A Guide to Creating Open Relationships That Work!

results.description:
Meet at the wooden gazebo located at the 48th St. side of the park at the lower level by the water. It's located not too far from the bathrooms near the street ramp. You can also click the location link near the meetup date & time for a Google Earth GPS view of the meetup location.

The walk will take approximately 45-60 minutes depending on how much we walk. We can walk more if the group decides to. I'll wait around 5 minutes before walking. If you're running late, post a notification and we'll wait. 

Please update your RSVP if you can't make it. We will not walk if it rains. Also, I recommend wearing sneakers to the walks. If you have any questions/comments/concerns, you can post a notification or email me through the meetup site.

results.description:
West Side Steakhouse
597 10th Avenue (44th and 43rd)
Sunday, March 20th
5:15 optional drinks, 6:00pm dinner
$82 4-course dinner, glass of wine, coffee t &t 

Please note: RSVP does not count unless you prepay at our website, http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/west-side-steak-house/ all of our events average 20+ and it is important for seating and to guarantee to the restaurant a proper actual headcount.
This is part of my dinner group, The Single Gourmet. Ignore the RSVP list on here as our events average 20+ members.

This unpretentious steakhouse in Hells Kitchen has been wowing the neighborhood for years. We ate here years ago (discovered by Art Fischer) and I am still getting requests to return. West Side Steakhouse features classic steakhouse dishes combined with the old world charm of a traditional steakhouse and a modern look. With its unique "Old New York City" motif, the West Side Steakhouse will have you dinning in comfort and style. Our last dinner featured so much food, that when the desserts came, everyone was full. Our menu starts with shared appetizers (slab bacon, shrimp cocktail) then a salad course, then entrée choices of: 12 oz New York strip steak, 8 oz filet mignon, grilled salmon fillet, roasted chicken or braised pork shank with rissoto all complimented with sides of garlic roasted mash potatoes, sautéed broccoli and sautéed mushrooms for the table, and finally dessert. Rated 5 stars on tripadvisor as one of the top 4% of all restaurants in NYC with a Certificate of Excellence award, rated 4 stars on Yelp, 4.5 stars on Open Table and 4.5 stars on Menu Pages, the only reason this restaurant is mostly unknown is their owner, Nick concentrates on a great product rather than hiring top PR!

results.description:
Introduction to Italian Workshop for Beginners

This is a series of 3 workshops designed to introduce the complete beginner to the Italian language. This series is intended to give new speakers the basic skills necessary to participate in the intermediate level conversation classes.

Beginners Level 2 Workshop (2 hours):
Possessive adjectives, verbo "avere" presente indicativo (verb "to have" present tense), how to introduce yourself

Please contact me if you have questions.

I hope to see you there!

Ciao,

results.description:
TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center  members only). For full information on the team, please go to 

www.tnya.org

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues. 

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: 

http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out and watch for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). The first and third Sundays are geared towards scrimmaging and the second and fourth are more focused on skills and/or conditioning. Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.

results.description:
This time we'll be going to Sombrero, a great Mexican restaurant west of Times Square.  The pork burrito is absolutely first rate.  Most dishes are about $21 and over.  A menu is here.

A $5 deposit is required to RSVP, which will be refunded in cash at the event 10 minutes after it begins.  Latecomers and no-shows will forfeit their deposit.  Please don't show up without RSVP'ing.

Note that the best way to get there from the East Side is to take the E train to 50th St.  Then you'll be two blocks away.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

The FBI is suing Apple, demanding that Apple create tools to unlock a dead terrorist's cellphone.  The FBI asserts the case is about just one phone, while Apple asserts that such a tool could be used on hundreds of millions of phones.  The FBI is very probably capable of breaking into the phone without Apple's help, but rather its whole motive in the court case is just to set a legal precedent.


-----------------------------------------------------------------

Insurgents in wars have learned that IED's are an effective means of combating an occupying force, while American occupiers have learned to equip their convoys with jamming devices to prevent cellphones from triggering the IED's.  The occupying forces have another tool at their disposal -- software that can discern the enemy's patterns of behavior and predict where they're hiding and where they'll strike next.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Children in the fifties and sixties were raised on the advice of Dr. Benjamin Spock, to be let free to run wild and explore the world, expanding their minds.


Then came the "missing child" milk cartons of the 1980's.  Nearly all of those "missing" children had been abducted by their own non-custodial biological parents, but the milk cartons didn't tell you that.  Seeing the ubiquitous faces of those "missing" children terrified parents, leading everybody to believe that society was crawling with murderous pedophiles.


It was all a lie, and now it's come back to bite us.


"Free-range" children became a thing of the past.  The next generations of children were raised by "helicopter" parents, not allowed to roam freely, and completely coddled.  Raised in a culture where a child's self-esteem was to be fed whether earned or not, they got trophies for just showing up, and came to believe they have a right not to be offended.  Most of today's millenials are vehemently opposed to freedom for "offensive" speech.  A Fox News correspondent on the campus of Yale University was able to gather 50 signatures in an hour for a petition to repeal the first amendment of the bill of rights.


Universities have changed completely from intellectual spaces where dogmas are to be challenged and cross-examined, into "safe-spaces" where no one's feelings are to be hurt.

results.description:
Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other (doesn't have to be alcohol) and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE (Space is limited).

*GET TICKET HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-21-2016_at_0630PM

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

*Get Tickets At This Link (no door sales) -  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-21-2016_at_0630PM

*These events sell out quickly so don't wait to get your ticket!

This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, there's no experience necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-21-2016_at_0630PM

We'll be painting this picture -

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Spring flowers are welcomed on the altar and on the ground around and within the circle.

”We will gather to celebrate The festival of Ostara, the Spring Equinox, the third spoke on the ever-turning wheel of the year.  Honoring the God and Goddess as natures balance returns to the world.  For Witches, it is an enchanted time outside of time, where a magical seam joins dark with light.  As the chains of winter are broken, Spring will arrive, this is the time when all of life burst forth in joyous celebration. The Spring Goddess rises from the Depths of the Underworld and brings forth new life.  New born animals begin to emerge and explore the world, eggs are decorated sending the exquisite message to all here on Earth that this is the season of rebirth.  As the melting snow and ice gives way to green petals and delicate blooms of early Spring flowers, we, too will feel a sense of renewal and joy."

Hail Great Goddess, the chains of your wintry prison have fallen away.
Now is the greening, when the delicate scent of flowers drifts on the breeze.
The cycle begins anew and life rekindles itself by Your magic, Earth Goddess.
The God stretches and arises, fervent in His youth, and bursting with the promise of summer.

I walk the earth in friendship, not in dominance.
Mother Goddess and Father God, instill within me
through your fertile plants a warmth for all living things.
Teach me to revere the Earth and all its treasures.
May I never forget.

Meditate upon the changing of the seasons. Feel the rousing of energies around you in the Earth.

You may wear flowers or wreaths to adorn your hair

Many paint their faces drawing a spiral on their foreheads or cheeks or draw a flower on cheek or Triangles for the triple Goddess

Instruments of all types are welcomed (drums, rattles, etc.)

$15 in person $16.00 via paypal to attend Please watch here for details.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the signs
results.name: Ostara Sabbat Ritual

group.name: Charmed By Starr Witches of New York Meetup Group

results.description:
This year our New Member Dinner event has coincided with the Persian New Year, Norouz.

As the tradition goes, many of us celebrate Norouz with our families and at home. We thought that celebrating it with our meetup family would be as delightful. 

Whether or not you have already celebrated this year's Norouz, we would like to invite you to join us to meet, chat, and have a hearty meal as we begin a new spring and a new day, Norouz. 

Unfortunately, the restaurant doesn't accept adding attendees after Friday. So we have set our RSVP deadline to Friday at 7 pm. If you wish to attend and the RSVP is closed please send me an email and I will put you on a waiting list in case someone cancels.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!
results.name: Norouz Celebration and New Member Dinner

group.name: Persian art and culture lovers in NYC

Register for daily inspiration in the week before Easter

Mar-20 morning: The passage

Mar-20 evening: The last entry into Jerusalem (chapter 67)

Mar-21 morning: Passing though the gate

Mar-21 evening: The Christ within the soul (chapter 69)

Mar-22 morning: The mystery of life and death

Mar-22 evening: The cleansing of the temple (chapter 71)

Mar-23 morning: The cleansing of the inner temple

Mar-23 evening:The last Paschal supper and washing of the feet (chapters 75 + 76)

Mar-24 morning: Surrendering to your inner master

Mar-24 evening: The garden of Gethsemane and the betrayal of Judas (chapters 77 + 78)

Mar-25 morning: Showing new inner strength

Mar-25 evening: The Roman trial, the crucifixion and the burial (chapters 81 + 82 + 83)

Mar-26 morning: The crucial victory over yourself

Mar-26 evening: The resurrection and the appearance to two of Emmaus (chapters 84 + 85)

Mar-27 morning: Liberation of the inner being

Mar-27 evening: Jesus appearance in the temple and to the twelve (chapters 86 + 87)

results.description:
The Vegans are coming! 

The Vegans are coming!

The vegans are taking over everything! They're replacing hamburgers with Veggie Burgers.. Fries with Kale, Ice Cream with VEGAN Ice CREAM!! 
They even took your favorite bar and turned it into a vegan restaurant.. NOOO!!!

But like the old adage goes, when you can't beat them... DO A COMEDY SHOW in their RESTAURANT, and we've chosen the best vegan restaurant in town to do it, The VSPOT on ST MARKS!!

This FREE COMEDY SHOW features some of the best up comedic talent in NYC, but also a full Latin-Vegan food menu and drink specials!

Drink Specials include: 
- $3 Brooklyn Beers 
- $3 Lemon Drop Soku Shots 
- Half-off bottles of wine

PLUS!! 
** A special Sunday RAMEN MENU w. Scallion Pancakes by Chef Junie Ishimori

Every Show is FREE w. a 1 item minimum purchase!

Come end the weekend with some laughs!!
results.name: Raw Comedy @ The VSPOT ST MARKS!! FREE SHOW! Drink and Food Specials!!

results.description:
Marches full moon is some times called  sap moon or worm moon signifying the coming of spring Its also known among the Lanape tribe as the (rainbow) crow full moon. Traditional fokelore recants that the most beautiful bird , the brightly colored and beautiful singer rainbow crow is sent to the heavens to request that fire and warmth be given to melt the freeze winter away to save the frozen earth and animals. Crow sings to the deities and is granted a stick of fire. On crow's decent back to save the earth her beautiful plums are charred black and her voice becomes a caw. Today you can see the shimmering rainbow of colors reflected in the dense black feathers of crows everywhere. Crow is also known as the guardian of ceremonial magic and healing. In any healing circle, Crow is present. Crow guides the magic of healing and the change in consciousness that will bring about a new reality and dispel "dis-ease" or illness If we align with  Crow medicine, we are instilled with the wisdom to know ourselves beyond the limitations of one-dimensional thinking and laws. We are taught to appreciate the many dimensions of both reality and ourselves, and to learn to trust our intuition and personal integrity;t we must watch what we believe, to test our habitual ideas about reality against a more universal standard. 


$30 energy exchange
results.how_to_find_us: between Washington Park & Carlton close to D,Q,B and all atlantic terminal stops G & A/C
results.name: Shamanic Breath Work Healing Quest with Rainbow Crow * Moon

results.description: A Confederacy of Dunces is a picaresque novel by American novelist John Kennedy Toole which appeared in 1980, eleven years after Toole's suicide. Published through the efforts of writer Walker Percy (who also contributed a foreword) and Toole's mother, the book became first a cult classic, then a mainstream success; it earned Toole a posthumous Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 1981, and is now considered a canonical work of modern literature of the Southern United States.[2]
results.name: "Confederacy of Dunces" by John Kennedy Toole

results.description:
UPDATE:  We had a great start last week!!  You can still join us this week.  Saying yes to this meet up page, however, doesn't guarantee your entry to the class!  Please visit QED website http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa  and register to guarantee your spot!!   Looking forward to dancing with you! 


*********************************

Please join us for the basics of swing dancing and lindy hop! No partner or experience necessary, just bring your comfortable shoes and happy feet! This month, we will be learning 8 count footwork using triple steps!


We will meet every Monday from 7:10pm to 8:00pm (March 14, 21, 28, April 4) so that you will be comfortable with the basic steps of swing dancing. 

If you already have some experience with swing dancing, please check out the Advanced Beginner class starting at 6:30. 

We will rotate partners frequently during the lesson so you will instantly make lots of new friends!! You will have a chance to mingle and dance with each other and try out all the new moves to authentic 30's and 40's jazz music. 

Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes to learn various steps of swing dancing so that you will be comfortable on the social dance floor. Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it! 

Classes are taught by Akemi Kinukawa and Andrew Kontola, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.Facebook.com/swingdanceastoria). 

Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot! Register here: http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa
Looking forward to dancing with you!

6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

For the first time ever, we're going to have a Sunday night meeting, and here's why: one of our regular members has access to a beautiful office space from 7 - 11pm, so I want to take advantage. He says there are "comfortable leather chairs, classic Tribeca style, a fireplace (the faux electric kind, but still) and an art gallery. Literally. It's the largest single collection of paintings by one of the world's most acclaimed artists."

Unfortunately this office is not wheelchair accessible, and food is not allowed, but I'm told that "coffee, tea, and water will be served." And there's WiFi.

The day before the meeting, I'll send more info including the address to members who RSVP.

venue.name: George Murphy Parish Center ( Under Church )

results.description:
Join us for the 5:30 Mass at Holy Trinity for Palm Sunday and the Passion.  Following the service we will go downstairs to The Parish Center for a reception, socializing, Pizza and a screening of the film Godspell!  This is a tradition that we used to do many years ago and it was always fun and meaningful.

Godspell was a Broadway musical and film based on the gospel according to St. Matthew.  It is a clever way of retelling the stories from the gospel.  The film is fun to watch especially since it all takes place in NYC in the early 70's with many scenes on the Upper West Side.  A young Victor Garber (Titanic/Alias) stars as Jesus will have about a half hour of socializing .

How does this work? Come to mass or come for the party.  We will be in the parish center under the church.

We  will have a bout a half hour of socializing then start the film.  You can sit and watch on one end of the parish center or you can continue socializing near the back.

Dress code: Casual

Cost: $10 to cover the cost of food and drink. 


Can I come alone?  Yes, many people come alone.  We have council members ready to greet you and introduce you to others.

Do I need to be a member of the parish?  No, 80% of those who come to the CRC events are from all over the tri state area.

Is there an age limit?  Although the CRC started many years ago as a Young Adult Group, several of those people are still active in the group and there are always new people both young and older coming out.  There are people of all ages that are young at heart!  You will find that most attendees are in their 20's, 30's 40's and even a few 50's!
results.name: After Mass Gathering: Palm Sunday Pizza Party & Film Godspell

group.name: Holy Trinity Church - Contemporary Roman Catholics  NYC

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: Next to the Chase Bank; next to the sound garden. One flight walk up to 2nd Floor. Parking on street or in parking lot behing the buiding. No meters on Sunday.
results.name: Sunday Night Meditation

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session :Mar 13, 2016-Apr 17, 2016
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:  Feb 7th No class!
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452733&_ga=1.167298430.1141896589.1397581416</a>

Level 103:http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452749&_ga=1.201402577.1141896589.1397581416<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358">

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408"></a>

Practice and polish your original song or cover at home...then bring your guitar (or ukulele, violin, harmonica etc.) and meet at American Beauty to perform in a warm and encouraging environment. Meet your friendly fellow performers.  This is a beginner's open mic, especially for people relatively new to live performance. Bands are welcome, too--just make sure you bring a snare drum, kick pedal and cymbals if you need those.

To partially offset the cost of running the open mic there is a $5 fee for each performer (bands, please note each member needs to sign up).

When my man Cory put me on to this last year. I couldn't imagine the night I was in for. As a lover of Japanese culture and music this was an amazing maki-combo of both those things in one. Flash forward to the much awaited 2016 rendition of Japan Nite.

The Knitting Factory will be hosting this extravaganza once again with the following bands all on tour from Japan.

Tempalay

• And Solo Band Music Maker - REATMO

There may be additional performances added to this venue before March but I am excited for this lineup alone. It is a unique treat and one I am sure you will all enjoy. If you are down you know what to do.


See you there!

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Chloe Hilliard (Last Comic Standing) Hosts:, Gregory From Russia, Mark Normand (Conan, Comedy Central), Kurt Metzger (Comedy Central), Al D, Nick Vatterott, and Of Course Dante NERO! and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.


I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up New York Free admission 2 drnk min

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Ok folks, it's the third Sunday of the month, again- the day you all get to have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we decided it was best to give you monthly recurring opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.

PLEASE NOTE OUR LOCATION CHANGE FOR THIS WEEK!

10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization that meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless.

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

THIS EVENT IS FOR MEAL DISTRIBUTION: 

Volunteers gather on East 11th street for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers distributing food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT: 

10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday night and would be thrilled to extend up to 8 distribution spots to NYC Volunteer Opportunities members each week. 

TO JOIN: RSVP here or feel free to check out 10,000 PB&Js group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs

CAN'T ATTEND BUT WANT TO HELP?

Here's the link to 10,000's Wish List: https://goo.gl/qwXAY7

results.description:
Come join us for a free trial of Tinkergarten's outdoor learning classes. If you are excited to sign up for a season of Tinkergarten, our trial class will give you the chance to see, first hand, what a class feels like and how we inspire authentic, play-based learning for children (and a great time for all)! This free trial class is designed to be the first class in the Spring season of Tinkergarten. This class is designed for children 18 months through five years old and a treasured adult.

Tinkergarten classes are based on a progressive curriculum comprised of our blueprint activities. The curriculum for each class is tailored to the ages and prior knowledge of kids, and are appropriate for the geographic region and season of the class. Leaders further tailor classes to meet the needs of the individuals and artfully facilitate the activity to maximize the fun and the learning for all involved. Below is a sampling of the types of activities to expect in this class.


SAMPLE ACTIVITY - MAGIC PETAL POTIONS
Skills: Creativity, Imagination, Behavioral Schema, Sensory
For petal potions, kids put water and anything from nature into a jar and mix it up, just like we did when we were kids. Making potions never gets old, and if done with some finesse, it helps kids develop creativity, imagination, sensory skills and several universal ways to encourage brain development known as behavioral schema. Although we call it magic “petal potion,” you can make magic potion anytime of year with any natural ingredients.

SAMPLE ACTIVITY - KINGS AND QUEENS OF WILD THINGS
Skills: Creativity, Imagination, Behavioral Schema, Fine Motor, Self Esteem
Combine the magic of Maurice Sendak's "Wild Things" with the power of double-sided tape to turn a day outdoors into a brain-boosting, unforgettable, wild rumpus!

SPACE IS LIMITED. RSVP at http://tkgtn.com/m9xwm TO CLAIM A SPOT.

results.description:
Hi Ladies, We have ten free tickets to a lunchtime premiere tomorrow if you can attend. You can bring a plus one but please include their name in the question area below. There will be no host for this meeting. It's an attend on your own event. 

WATCH THIS

Whit Stillman, expert chronicler of privileged youth, adapts the Jane Austen novella Lady Susan for his first period film, Love & Friendship. The material is a perfect fit for the film-maker behind the elegant comedies Metropolitan, Barcelona and most recently, Damsels in Distress. His pantheon of highly literate heroines would be at home in Austen’s world of manners and unrequited passions.

<a href="http://www.theguardian.com/film/2016/jan/23/wiener-dog-review-todd-solondz-sundance-greta-gerwig"></a> Kate Beckinsale, who he previously directed in The Last Days of Disco, effortlessly leads the film as Lady Susan Vernon, a beautiful and conniving widow: her sister-in-law, Mrs Catherine Vernon (Emma Greenwall), refers to her as a “genius of the evil kind” and “a serpent in Eden’s garden”.

At the outset of the story, Lady Susan takes up temporary residence at her in-laws’ grand countryside estate in Churchill, with the intention of securing her financial future by marring Catherine’s handsome younger brother, Reginald De Courcy (Xavier Samuel). Her plans are thwarted, however, by the surprise arrival of her daughter, Frederica (Morfydd Clark), a timid girl who’s just run away from school. Sensing that Frederica’s presence might pose a threat to her wooing of Reginald, the ever-scheming Lady Susan arranges for her daughter to be courted by Sir James Martin (a scene-stealing Tom Bennett), an older man who can’t appear to keep his mouth shut (he’s described as “a bit of a rattle” by Catherine).
results.name: Lunchtime Advance Screening of LOVE & FRIENDSHIP

results.description:
Streaming big data analytics is a hot topic lately and applicable in many use cases in Fintech and Adtech. We have some great speakers lined up from Thomson Reuters, Lightbend, Mezzobit and IBM to share specific use cases and open source technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka, Akka Streams and others used to solve high performance real-time streaming analytics challenges. Join us for this exciting event hosted at Thomson Reuters! 


To expedite check-in at the lobby, you MUST register using Eventbrite.


AGENDA

Check-in and networking:    5:30pm  - 5:50pm

Introductions by IBM:            5:50pm - 6:00pm

Talk 1: ThomsonReuters        6:00pm - 6:30pm

Talk 2: Lightbend                     6:30pm - 7:00pm


Talk 3: Mezzobit                      7:00pm - 7:30pm


Networking /food&drinks:   7:30pm - 8:00pm

TOPICS AND PRESENTERS

Introductions by IBM - The state of Open Source Analytics - market dynamics

Host:  Nick Dimtchev -  Open Source Analytics Program Office Worldwide Leader, IBM Analytics 

Talk 1. Metadata: The foundation for big data analytics

Presenter: Daniel Meisner, Head of Open Data, Thomson Reuters

Thomson Reuters will discuss the value of metadata in connecting datasets to each other and real-world objects, empowering big data analytics to drive insights for decisive action.


Talk 2. Reactive Streams: The Glue of the Real-time Organization 


Presenter: Kevin Webber -  Enterprise Advocate,  Lightbend 

ABSTRACT:   The "real-time organization" reacts to information now rather than basing critical decisions on stale data. This requires re-imagining how data flows through your organization, moving away from data at rest and moving towards a completely event-based streaming architecture. Events become the lifeblood of the organization, while analytics becomes the brain. Organizations that successfully harness the power of real-time event streaming can transform analytical latencies from hours to seconds.

This session will describe a reference architecture using the Lightbend Reactive Platform and other tools that can be used to build out the real-time organization, leveraging real-time data to produce analytics that result in immediate, actionable insights.

Talk 3.  Using Apache Spark to create the Internet's first audience data firewall: How Mezzobit empowers digital enterprises to regain control of online data and increase customer value

Speaker: Joseph Galarneau, CEO and co-founder, Mezzobit, New York


ABSTRACT:  Every website exposes visitors to data collection and tracking by scores of third parties, which site owners can’t adequately monitor or control. The resulting data leakage siphons away revenue, slows site performance and increases compliance risk.Taming this problem requires gathering and processing billions of monthly data events per website. Mezzobit's founder talks about their Audience Value Platform and some of the insights it's gathered about the Wild West of online data.

To reserve your seat and RSVP, register by clicking here using EVENTBRITE. Only 100 seats available!
results.name: Streaming Analytics Use Cases by ThomsonReuters, Mezzobit, Lightbend, IBM

Register early & save, http://nyspin201603.eventbrite.com/?aff=nyspinmeetup

In this presentation we will discuss a process for making rational choices in the selection of strategic objectives as a quantitative roadmap for an organization. The significant benefit of the process is that it helps bring about stakeholder alignment.

The traditional project success parameters, known as the triple-constraint, are still credible objectives:

 - On time

 - On budget

 - With adequate scope and quality.


However, there is another dimension which is often overlooked which may be a larger cause of perceived project failure:

 - Lack of project alignment with organizational strategy.

The methodology in this presentation can be used in an organization whenever there are competing objectives which require alignment among diverse stakeholders.

Biography: Dr. Peter J. Morales is the Global Director for Platform Innovation at New York University (NYU), where he is responsible for a broad range of technologies and platforms including: Cloud; Teaching and Learning; Analytics; Process Automation and Performance. He has also held roles at NYU as CTO of the Law School and CIO at the Engineering School. Prior to NYU, Peter held technology leadership roles at the New York Stock Exchange as well as the American Stock Exchange (now part of NYSE). He has a BSEE, an MS in Management Science, and a Doctorate in Computer and Information Sciences. Peter currently teaches Project Management, Operations Management, Python, and Web Development. Peter was also a member of the former NYC SPIN steering committee for many years.
