"To practice Zen means to realize one’s existence moment after moment, rather than letting life unravel in regret of the past or daydreaming of the future.

To “rest in the present” is a state of magical simplicity, although attainment of this state is not as simple as it sounds. At the very least, sitting Zen practice, called zazen, will bring about a strong sense of well-being, as the clutter of ideas & emotions falls away and body & mind return to natural harmony with all creation.  Out of this emptiness can come a true insight into the nature of existence, which is no different from one’s Buddha nature." —Peter Mattheissen

A weekly Meditation Group in the Zen Tradition.

Open to All!

Every Monday

5:30 — Beginning Instruction
(If You are new to Meditation/Zen style or want a refresher, please arrive a few minutes early)

6:00 — Zazen/Seated Meditation (*)

6:25 — Walking Meditation (*)

6:35 — Zazen/Seated Meditation (*)

7:00 — Talk / Discussion (*)

(*) — Possible to join the evening at any time.

Donations accepted

1 Train to 125th Street @ Broadway (2 blocks away)
A, B, C & D Trains to 125th Street @ St. Nicholas (3 blocks away)
M100, M101, M104 & Bx15 Bus to 125th & Amsterdam (1 block away)
M11 & M60-SBS Bus to 125th & Amsterdam (1 block away)


10 blocks from Columbia University & Teacher's College
7 blocks from Union Theological Seminary
9 blocks from City College

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.
results.name: ADULT BALLET CLASS Level: Elementary

results.description:
Charles Bernard has spent the last 16 years transforming sales systems and increasing sales performance by at least 25% for the organizations he helps. He recognized early on that busy sales executive easily forget that new customers and clients are right under their nose. He has identified Social Selling as key to getting to these buyers and accelerating sales growth. And he is now supported by data: according to a Forbes report, 78.6% of salespeople that used social media to sell out performed those who didn't use social media.


Join us to learn how you can combine standard tools, such as LinkedIn and Salesforce, with a simple process to create a winning Social Selling PlayBook.

Attendees of this workshop will learn:

• How to target qualified suspects and prospects

• Generate more business opportunities using inbound and outbound applications, such as Hubspot and LinkedIn

• Learn how to turn suspects into paying customers and partners

Takeaways:

• A Social Selling PlayBook, customized at the event

• Tips and know-how to identify, connect with, and sell new contacts

• An efficient process to generate a larger volume of workable leads

Who should attend:

• Business owners

• Key sales & marketing executives

• Any stakeholder involved in growing their business

--------------------------------------------------------------------

This workshop is first in a 3-part series focused on tips and tools to bridge the gap between marketing and sales and generate more sales.

Part 2: Social Selling Platforms (Date TBA)

This workshop addresses platforms that provide powerful access to buyer behaviors that result in generation of large quantities of quantified leads.

Part 3: Converting Leads & Closing the Sale (Date TBA)

This workshop focuses on specific techniques to qualify leads and convert them into opportunities.

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

results.description:
We will power up the Major Welch, take in the sunset & socialize briefly at Perkins Tower, then descend on the AT.

We will meet in the main parking lot. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun.

This is not a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. While it is only four miles, there is significant elevation gain on the Major Welch.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together. The amount of time we spend at Perkins will depend upon the weather. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: First Monday Bear MT SUNSET Hike of 2016  Take II

results.description:
JC Writers writing marathons are about setting loose your inner writer-athlete and really getting some words down. You’ll be amazed at how much you can get done when you leave the distractions of home and spend a few hours in the company of other writers pounding away at their novels, short stories, screenplays and other works. The ensuring endorphins of accomplishment and sense of community with other writers will make you feel like you just ran a marathon, minus the jello-legs and carb cravings!!

Note: There is free parking for Zeppelin Hall!!

results.description: For this round of the Book Club, we're doing something a little different, with a crime thriller written by a Greek-American about a Greek-American protagonist! Spero Lucas is a recently returned Iraq war veteran who is currently working as a private investigator, with a few clients who are less than virtuous. The story is set in the DC area, and it should be interesting to see how Spero's Greekness and his family affect his choices when he takes on a case for a big crime boss.
results.name: Greek Book Club: The Cut by George Pelecanos

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

group.name: Free and Affordable Yoga, Meditation, African Dance Classes

results.description:
Clearing Karmic Imprints

In this workshop we will learn how to access The Soul (Akashic) Records through understanding and researching the subconscious mind and soul records to quickly find and release discordant, limiting beliefs and ideas. The system does not only clear, but replaces these sabotaging blocks with loving, supportive ideas and beliefs. Spiritual Response Technique is a painless and accurate way of changing the internal as well as external landscape of our lives. The system involves the use of a pendulum, a set of charts, and a specific series of questions to complete the research and clear discordant programming which was formed in past lives.


Student/healers will be taught how to use a pendulum and charts to direct them in finding answers about karmic patterns and how to clear sabotaging karmic imprints.

Workshop schedule 

1. What is the Mind Net and the Nature of the Subconscious Mind
2. The Higher Self - The Divinity Inside

3.The Pendulum and Establishing Yes and No Response

4. Using Spiritual Clearing Charts

4. Spiritual Blocks/ Programs and when they are Established

5. Discorded Energies/ Hooks, Entities, and other Dark forces.

6. The Clearing Process


The price for this workshop is 20.00 in advance and 25.00 at the door. If you would like to attend without paying on line please text or call me to reserve your spot in advance[masked]-0588. I look forward to meeting you in this karmic Clearing Workshop.

Love and Light,

Laura Schwalm-Anthony
results.name: Clearing Karma Imprints

www.nyeek.com

Facebook Page : Twitter

Nyeek Drinks are our game nights at Amity Hall. They're pretty regular, but always check the listings before coming in case we have to cancel or change dates.

Most of the places we play at don't charge us a rental fee. So please keep in mind not to bring outside food or drink, to purchase something from the establishment and to be respectful of the space in general.

There is a game night special that runs from 5 PM to 11 PM for people playing games. In addition to $5.00 drafts on select beers it is also $10.00 for sliders, wings, chicken strips, nachos or traditional pizza. Please note that it $10.00 for the individual items, not for all five.

results.description:
In this Meetup we will explain how to leverage Spot Instances for Production workloads using actual customers use cases running both Stateless and State-full environments and how it can deliver a resilient production grade service. 

We’ll demonstrate how to deploy, scale and manage highly complex environments while using underlying AWS features, such as: EC2, ELB, AutoScaling, Elastic Beanstalk, CloudFormation, AWS Lambda and Docker containers with ECS.
results.how_to_find_us: 25th Floor, Western Union Telegraph Building
results.name: Saving Thousands by Running Mission Critical and Production Workloads on Spot

results.description:
If someone asked you to name the most vegan/vegetarian-friendly places in Hoboken and Jersey City, The Cheesecake Factory probably wouldn't top your list. Exactly. That is why this establishment is ideal for some subtle vegan activism! Right now, the only thing clearly marked as vegan on their menu is a salad. Because we all know vegans only eat salad! Sigh...


A thought that may cross your mind is, "What in the world can I order?" Don't worry, we've got ya covered. And no, you don't have to just order a salad! We have spoken with a manager and have deciphered all that is vegan. Some examples include the following (information gathered from PETA's website):

Salads

• Vegan Cobb Salad

• Super Antioxidant Salad

• California Guacamole Salad (Hold the feta cheese, avocado cream drizzle, and try it with any of the vegan dressings listed below instead of the cilantro dressing.)

• Kale and Quinoa Salad (Hold the Parmesan cheese.)

• Falafel Salad (Order it without feta cheese, and with any of the vegan dressings listed below.)


• Fresh Vegetable Salad (Hold the white cheddar.)

• French Country Salad (Hold the goat cheese.)

• Tossed Green Salad (Hold the croutons.)

• Endive Salad (Hold the blue cheese.)

Salad Dressing


• Special Chinese Plum Dressing

• Lemon-Blueberry Vinaigrette

• House Vinaigrette

• Lemon Vinaigrette

• Pomegranate Vinaigrette

• Shallot Vinaigrette



Appetizers and Sides


• Plain or Soy-Glazed Edamame (steamed, salted soybeans)

• French Fries

• Green Beans (Hold the butter.)

• Sweet Potato Fries (Order without the chipotle mayo.)

• Corn Succotash (Hold the butter.)

• Sautéed Spinach (Hold the butter.)

• Fresh Broccoli 

• Fresh Asparagus 

• SkinnyLicious® Grilled Artichoke (Hold the aioli.)

• Fire-Roasted Fresh Artichoke (Ask for oil instead of butter, and hold the garlic dip.)

• Guacamole (Hold the sour cream.)

• Beets with Goat Cheese (Hold the goat cheese.)


Burgers


• Veggie Burger (Simply hold the cheese and mayo. For the bun, ask for sourdough or wheat bread, or opt for a bed of lettuce.)


Pasta Dishes


• Evelyn’s Favorite Pasta (Order this with the rigatoni pasta, which is vegan. Be sure to specify that you want the pasta tossed with olive oil instead of butter, and hold the Parmesan.)

See full menu here. Also, we will make our own veganized menu and provide copies for everyone so that you don't have to spend a long time sifting through the menu to decipher what is vegan. 


Another thing you may be thinking is, "We're going to The Cheesecake Factory and we can't even get cheesecake?" Not to worry! We will be providing some vegan cheesecakes! :D

Until relatively recently, there hasn't been anything explicitly listed as vegan on The Cheesecake Factory's menu, so the fact that they have a salad listed as vegan really shows that the tides are turning. Also, the manager mentioned that several items such as their beans used to be cooked with lard, but about a year ago they stopped doing that. This is happening because veganism/vegetarianism is becoming more and more mainstream. It is up to us to continue this trend and show places like The Cheesecake Factory that they are on the right path and need to continue adding plant-based items to make their restaurants more accommodating to vegans/vegetarians. Come out and help us do this and socialize with other like-minded, friendly people!


Directions: If you are coming from Hoboken or north of Jersey CIty, you can take the West Side Ave or 8th Street Light Rail and get off at Newport. If you are coming from Jersey City, you can take the Light Rail towards Hoboken (again, get off at Newport). The Cheesecake Factory is directly west of the  Newport Light Rail stop (you can't miss it!). The mall is also conveniently located by the Newport PATH Station.  If you get off at PATH, cross the street going west and follow the signs to the Light Rail. You will have to cross the tracks to get to the restaurant. It is very easy to find!

We look forward to seeing you!

results.name: Vegan Dinner at The Cheesecake Factory (Newport Centre in Jersey City)

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

results.description:
Join us for a FREE screening of After the Last River with the Minister of the Environment and Climate Change, Glen Murray and the film director, Victoria Lean. In the shadow of a De Beers diamond mine, a remote indigenous community lurches from crisis to crisis, as their homeland transforms into a modern frontier. Rosie Koostachin delivers donations to families who live in uninsulated sheds, overgrown with toxic mold. She is determined to raise awareness, believing that if only Canadians knew, her hometown's dire situation would improve. Over five years, filmmaker Victoria Lean follows Attawapiskat's journey from obscurity and into the international spotlight twice - first when the Red Cross intervenes and again during the protest movement, Idle No More. Weaving together great distances, intimate scenes and archive images, the documentary chronicles the First Nation's fight for justice in the face of hardened indifference.

Join us for a viewing of this thought-provoking and enlightening documentary that connects personal stories from the First Nation to entwined mining industry agendas and government policies, painting a complex portrait of a territory that is an imperiled homeland to some and a profitable new frontier for others.

A link to the trailer : http://afterthelastriver.com/trailer/

Hosted by the Ontario Water Works Association (OWWA)- University of Toronto Student Chapter in association with Ecologos as a part of Water Docs 2016 - a documentary film festival about all things water 

Here is the link : http://ecologos.ca/water-docs-2016/

This is an accessible venue.
results.name: After the Last River (Film & Discussion about Attawapiskat)

A brisk stroll is a terrific way to de-stress from a busy work day, before going home to the night job.  You can come straight from work with a comfortable pair of walking shoes.  Suits and dresses permitted, if you dare!!

For those of you who are joining us for the first time, the entrance to the promenade is a little further up from 80th Street by the flagpoles (see photo below).  I'll wait only 5 minutes for latecomers.  Heavy winds or rain cancels the walk.

results.description:
Our Next General Meeting is Monday, March 21, 2016 

6:30 pm.  Registration; Pre-meetings; Members offering deals 

7:30 pm Featured Speaker: Dan Howell, Bogota Building Department

Rehabbing Properties: Permits

Have you ever invested in a single or (multi-family) building? Before you made your offer, did you estimate how many $$$ would be needed to fix up the property. How much of the work were you going to do and how much would be given to contractors?

One of the considerations of costs and time is electrical, plumbing, building, fire and oil tank removal permits. Do you know what you are allowed to renovate if you do not have various licenses? Are you planning to live in the house while renovating?

We have invited a construction official to be our guest speaker..

Ample time will be allotted to having all your questions answered.

§  Do you know what renovations you can do without a permit?

§  Where are GFI's required?

§  Is there a difference in the Building Code requirements between new construction and existing housing?

§  Is a permit needed to replace a vanity, siding, a roof?

§  When is a survey, architect or variance required?

§  What happens if I do some work and then discover that a permit was required? Any other questions come to mind?
results.name: Rehabbing Properties; What Permits are Required?

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be around the corner from the bar!
results.name: Game Night!

results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full and we are not accepting new players.

INTRODUCTION:

The truth about the Keys of Power has long since been discarded as just so much myth and legend. But one of those Keys has just resurfaced and numerous factions are dead-set on possessing it. This means certain doom for the poor souls who've stumbled upon it.

Are these unfortunate souls mere pawns in a greater game? Do they even know of that which fate has cast their way?

If they are truly unaware of the significance of that which they now possess, it would be to their benefit to become aware of it. Fate and destiny have converged upon them and, before long, many will vie to possess the item they hold. Many will seek to become the Keeper of the Keys and our intrepid adventurers stand in their way.

BACKGROUND:

"The Keeper of the Keys" is a home-brewed, Dungeons and Dragons campaign. I am looking to run this campaign as part of the Edison MeetUp group. However, I cannot run/attend a weekly game. My schedule simply does not allow for it.

So I'm setting this group up as a bi-weekly game; sort-of. Specifically, I will schedule a recurring MeetUp for the first and third Monday of each month beginning with February 15th, 2016. I will also schedule a bonus MeetUp for the fifth Monday of those months that have five Mondays. This means our first four meetings will be February 15th & 29th and March 7th & 21st.

I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game.

Each time I've run "The Keeper of the Keys", it's encompassed almost the entirety of the PC's lifespan as adventurers. In other words, if you join and stay in my game, you can be fairly certain it won't end until your character has reached the maximum level of experience.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at the top of the "up" escalator inside the Barnes & Noble store.
results.name: The Keeper of the Keys

results.description:
Spring has sprung, and it's a perfect time to get out of the house! So come on over to the Westside Range and join WSSL for our monthly .22 Rifle Shoot on March 21st! 

Have you always wanted to learn how to handle a firearm but didn't know where to start? Or do you have some (or a lot) of experience with guns but don't know where to shoot in the city? Then come join us for WSSL's monthly .22 rifle shoot!  Learn safe and responsible shooting skills with a group of fun and friendly ladies at the Westside Rifle and Pistol Range on March 21st. 


If you want to shoot with WSSL and you've never joined us before, please read the entire event description and start your registration process with Westside ASAP! 


Feel free to bring friends! (Remind them to register in advance!) All levels are welcome (never shot, beginners, intermediate, advanced). We will have some fun shooting drills, too! This meetup is limited to women, but we do have  co-ed shoots sporadically throughout the year, so keep posted!

Register here at least five days in advance: here: http://www.westsidepistolrange.com/registration.php?referral=WSSL&glemail=rsvp@nycwssl.org 

You will receive a "transaction ID" by e-mail from the Range. Please bring this with you and a photo ID.

Price: $35 (plus tax) to the range. You can pay the range after the event: cash, check or charge. This fee includes classroom safety instruction, private instruction on the firing line, rental of a .22 rifle, one box of ammo (additional ammo is available from WSSL while supplies last; please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo) and eye/ear protection. We also ask that you please donate $5 (or whatever you feel like donating) to WSSL directly to help cover our operating costs like our website fees, locker rental at the range, etc.

Come at 6:15 PM for the club business meeting and help us plan activities -- we have some great excursions in mind -- or join us from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM for the shooting.

FIRST TIME SHOOTERS (First time shooting with us/Westside):

When you arrive at the Range on WSSL night pick up your brown ID card at the office. (Bring your transaction ID in case your brown ID card has not been prepared.) You will sign in using the Range ID number on your brown ID card every time you attend WSSL. 
You will also need to bring other ID with you to check in on WSSL night. 

RETURNING SHOOTERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
Use the Range ID number on your brown card to sign in when you arrive on WSSL night. 


WESTSIDE RANGE MEMBERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
On WSSL night sign in using your Range membership number. Range members do not pay the $35 WSSL fee, and WSSL will provide ammo while supplies last (please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo). 

ALL SHOOTERS:

If you've registered, but find that you can't attend, please e-mail Lauren at [masked] As soon as poosible so we have an accurate headcount for the Range. 
If you have to cancel at the last minute please call the Range directly at [masked] or [masked]-9448.
results.how_to_find_us: The range is downstairs. Just walk right in and ask for WSSL! See you there!
results.name: March .22 Rifle Shoot at Westside Range

Reality TV becomes Deadly TV when FANGORIA hosts a special free NYC screaming of the bloody terrific horror comedy THEY’RE WATCHING! It stars David (THE VAMPIRE DIARIES) Alpay, Brigid (ANGEL) Brannagh, Dimitri (CHERNOBYL DIARIES) Diatchenko, Mia Faith, Carrie (JENNIFER’S BODY) Genzel and Kris (GINGER SNAPS) Lemche. With THEY’RE WATCHING, noted graphic novelists, video game creators and animators Micah Wright and Jay Lender (ROBOCALYPSE, CALL OF DUTY: BLACK OPS II, SKULLGIRLS) turn a classic horror premise upside down to fashion a fresh, funny, eye-popping twist on the genre.


<a href="http://www.fangoria.com/new/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/Camino-Poster.jpg"></a>

Here's the skinny on THEY’RE WATCHING…

“When an American home improvement TV show visits a remote Eastern European village, the young crew thinks the lack of mocha lattés and free Wi-Fi will be the worst of their problems. But after their filming interrupts the superstitious villagers’ private religious ritual, the situation takes a turn for the homicidal… and when the blood starts flowing, that’s when things get really weird.”


www.Fangoria.com/new/nyc-free-screening-of-horror-comedy-theyre-watching-hits-march-21st

The Fango screaming of THEY’RE WATCHING is FREE! To get tickets send an email to [masked]. You must list “Watching” as your subject line and send us your full name. Your tickets is good for you and one guest. Names will be checked at the door. Seats are first come first served and not guaranteed. This exclusive event is presented by our pals at Amplify Releasing, who releases THEY’RE WATCHING to theaters and On Demand on March 25th.

Our friend Fango editor emeritus Tony Timpone will be hosting the show.

https://youtu.be/pGsrpiyu2Ts
results.name: Free screaming of the upcoming horror comedy 'THEY’RE WATCHING'!

results.description:
Visit us at Metis in New York City on Monday, March 21st at 6:30pm to see a Data Science Cycle presentation by Sergey Fogelson, Director of Data Science at airisData. 


During the demo, Sergey will go through a small dataset and show how he would use it to perform a complete “data science cycle."

What does that mean? You'll see how to...

1) load the data into a workable state in Python
2) plot some distributions of the data
3) create a really basic model (logistic regression) using train/test split
4) plot the outputs on the test set as a function of whether they were correct/incorrect
5) do a simple examination of the misclassifications on the test set

This will demonstrate a single “cycle” of the data science approach to tackling a given problem. A data scientist's day-to-day workflow is based on iterations of this cycle. 

Come hear from Sergey, see the live demo, and find out more about his upcoming Metis evening course, Intro to Data Science, which starts in New York City on April 19th. Enrollments are open now!  

Pizza and drinks will be served.

6:30 - 7:00 Register, Mingle, Eat & Drink 
7:00 - 7:30 Instructor Sergey Fogelson presents 
7:30 - 8:00 Chat with Sergey, attendees, Metis staff and enjoy more food & drink 

Sergey Fogelson 
Metis Intro to Data Science Instructor 
Director of Data Science, airisData

Sergey Fogelson is a data science consultant currently working in the financial industry. He began his career as an academic at Dartmouth College in Hanover, New Hampshire, where he researched the neural bases of visual category learning and obtained his Ph.D. in Cognitive Neuroscience. After leaving academia, Sergey got into the rapidly growing startup scene in the NYC metro area, where he has worked as a data scientist in alternative energy analytics, digital advertising, and cybersecurity. He is heavily involved in the NYC-area teaching community and has taught courses at various bootcamps, as well as been a volunteer teacher in computer science through TEALSK12. When Sergey is not working or teaching, he is probably hiking. (He thru-hiked the Appalachian trail before graduate school).

Connect with us before the event! @thisismetis
results.name: 'Data Science Cycle' Demo with Intro to Data Science Instructor Sergey Fogelson

results.description:
Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other (doesn't have to be alcohol) and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE (Space is limited).

*GET TICKET HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-21-2016_at_0630PM

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

*Get Tickets At This Link (no door sales) -  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-21-2016_at_0630PM

*These events sell out quickly so don't wait to get your ticket!

This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, there's no experience necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Mar-21-2016_at_0630PM

We'll be painting this picture -
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd Fl.

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.
results.name: FIRST-1.5Hrs-MONDAY NIGHT CO-ED INDOOR FUTSAL Game

results.description:
Breh! It's a React-tastic variation of our LEARN YOU nights!

Postlight is generous enough to host us, and give us access to the team that built their GIF BATTLE app! The app was built with React, and this is your chance to talk to the engineers that built it, and peer inside a team software project!

MAIN GIF-BATTLE EVENT: William Chin vs. David Ashe!

We'll get started with a gif battle or two, and then hear from the devs who built the app! Full Q & A access afterwards.

results.description:
A gentle introduction to the changes that Angular 2 brings, how they compare to Angular 1, and provides an understanding of the architecture and how the core concepts work together to build applications. You will learn how your Angular 1 skills translate and prepare you to build Angular 2 applications. Code samples focus on specific features including Angular 2 components, templates directives, data binding syntax, modules, dependency injection, routing, Http, pipes, and services. All samples are written in TypeScript and run live on the web where you can see and edit them with a click of a button; no setup required.

About The Author: John Papa is a Google Developer Expert, Microsoft Regional Director and MVP, author of 100+ articles and 10 books, and a former technology Evangelist for Microsoft client teams. He specializes in professional application development with technologies including HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Angular, Gulp, Knockout, C#, and ASP.NET. He can often be found speaking around the world at keynotes and sessions for conferences such as ngConf, Build, MIX, PDC, TechEd, VSLive and AngleBrackets. John is a co-host of the popular Adventures in Angular podcast and formerly was the host of the show Silverlight TV on Channel 9 and hosted many events including the MIXer and Open Source Fest at major conferences. He currently enjoys authoring courses for Pluralsight. You can always find John at johnpapa.net or on twitter at @john_papa.

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Monday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets at the dining tables directly in front of the bowling lanes. There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  


Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
FREE event - event space kindly sponsored by Level39 - fintech accelerator - http://www.level39.co/ and the Thalesians will be sponsoring drinks!

The talk will start promptly at 7.30pm. Please come early (from 7.00pm onwards) to get your pass on the ground floor of One Canada Square, as it will take time to get processed. Security will only let registered attendees into the building.

Full title: The Age of Em: Work, Love and Life when Robots Rule the Earth (Amazon pre-order book here)

Abstract: Robots may one day rule the world, but what is a robot-ruled Earth like?

Many think the first truly smart robots will be brain emulations or ems. Scan a human brain, then run a model with the same connections on a fast computer, and you have a robot brain, but recognizably human.

Train an em to do some job and copy it a million times: an army of workers is at your disposal. When they can be made cheaply, within perhaps a century, ems will displace humans in most jobs. In this new economic era, the world economy may double in size every few weeks.

Some say we can't know the future, especially following such a disruptive new technology, but Professor Robin Hanson sets out to prove them wrong. Applying decades of expertise in physics, computer science, and economics, he uses standard theories to paint a detailed picture of a world dominated by ems.

While human lives don't change greatly in the em era, em lives are as different from ours as our lives are from those of our farmer and forager ancestors. Ems make us question common assumptions of moral progress, because they reject many of the values we hold dear.

Read about em mind speeds, body sizes, job training and career paths, energy use and cooling infrastructure, virtual reality, aging and retirement, death and immortality, security, wealth inequality, religion, teleportation, identity, cities, politics, law, war, status, friendship and love.

This book shows you just how strange your descendants may be, though ems are no stranger than we would appear to our ancestors. To most ems, it seems good to be an em.

Speaker: Robin Hanson is associate professor of economics at George Mason University, and research associate at the Future of Humanity Institute of Oxford University. He has a doctorate in social science from California Institute of Technology, master's degrees in physics and philosophy from the University of Chicago, and nine years experience as a research programmer, at Lockheed and NASA. He has 2800 citations, 60 publications, 420 media mentions, and he blogs at OvercomingBias.
results.name: Seminar (London) - Robin Hanson - Economics when robots rule the Earth

Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

results.description:
Some of us hackers and friends are reading through a Shakespeare play the third Monday evening of every month. We started with Lear on November 28th, 2013, and, in what has become a tradition, sent out for pizza between Acts III and IV. So arrive with a copy of the play of the month (or some device that will allow you to access it online), your stentorian voice, some spare change for a slice, a couple of bucks for beer, and join the culture wars.

Our schedule includes a list of the plays we have not yet read and when we expect to read them. Thanks to Jesse Lansner for suggesting the remaining schedule.

Coming up over the next few months:

April 2016           Taming of the Shrew  
May 2016            Othello 
June 2016           The Merry Wives of Windsor
July 2016             Much Ado about Nothing

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

Event Host: Sergio, http://www.meetup.com/Mere-Christianity-by-C-S-Lewis-Meetup/events/229369582/

Trinity Grace Church East Village is starting a 4 week book study on Mere Christianity by C.S. Lewis. The thought behind the book study is that we have a healthy discussion. The hope is that the discussion won't be a debate, but more of a safe space for people to say their point of view and raise questions. We will talk about big life questions, such as: "how do we define our moral laws?", "how can God be good if He allows suffering or how can we say that God exists because there is suffering?" and other topics. ***You do not have to have read the whole book to come. We will focus on a couple pages/topic per week, and there will be printouts available. However, if you fill out the form below, you will receive the reading/topic over email before each Monday.*** |When: Mondays (Feb 29, March 7, March 14, and March 21) |Time: 7-8:30pm |Where: First Ukrainian Assembly of God New York City (59 Cooper Sq, New York, NY 10003) |*Wine and cheese will be provided each week! |Form to fill out: http://bit.do/merechristianitystudy

About the Event Host:  Sergio is a members of Trinity Grace Church East Village, and he loves having philosophical discussions about topics we all think about - morality, the existence of God, the meaning of life, etc. He loves hearing others thoughts about these things.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members: I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. results.description:
Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

results.description:
Contemporary Fusion is a contemporary dance class which also includes elements from street styles, lyrical, jazz etc. Creative movement doesn't only focus on the technique but also on expressing emotions and different mindsets through dance. The class consists of a warm up, dance combination and a few improvisation exercises to help the dancers get better understanding of their unique way of movement and musicality.

Instructor: Diina Tamm
Diina is a professional dancer and choreographer originally from Tallinn, Estonia. She has completed dancer education at Estonian Dance Agency and graduated from International Student Program at Broadway Dance Center in New York. She has performed in many different shows on cruise ships, independent plays, tv shows and music videos in the USA, Canada, Estonia, Sweden, Finland etc. Alongside technique she values story behind every dance that she creates or performs.
results.name: Contemporary Fusion Dance Class

results.description:
Those Who Do Good Find Good

Sura 16, Verse 30

 And when it is said to those who are conscious of God, “What is it that your Lord has revealed? They say,” what is good”.

For those who do good there is good in this world, but the reward in the hereafter is better still; for how excellent is the abode of the God-conscious!

 This aya points out that those who are conscious of God find goodness that is in revelation, in contrast to those who interpret words of revelation in ways that cause personal unhappiness and social injustice.

The second part of the verse says that those who do good find goodness in this life, thus overturning the widespread belief that pious people are miserable here but find rewards in the next world.

The implications of these insights for our daily lives will be discussed in our meeting.

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-Those Who Do Good Find Good

results.description:
https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/DDFjyOpETU86ZTkKlKg1ZPnox4YxVvGGqBTrF-uyWHJ4-6M_nGgK0hDyzjVHVd2Dds0_TuYUrqmq-_1k-g_92jbTrx7s425sFXQkr0ncSF635tgc6oaUcmvRqfrdHIuDYhBijdVw

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/_Ct6MazHQPuu_au-iA86cc16V-QzZSWJOoxjCtM9LOmwJPJ6YmfQ84duJQ4M2cZeo_bYa09E3RJaC9Xd3NB-K-opB-ii8uKPHZHo6IxpLS9PX15DJoRxscUNUCeZD4t4MykoxbAB Join Be Social Change & Kristina Drury, founder of TYTHEdesign, on Monday, March 21st from 7-9PM for Design Thinking - Understanding Clients and Communities with Human-Centered Research.

Are you looking to develop a deeper understanding of the behavior, thoughts, needs, and desires of the community you serve? Do you want to strengthen your impact and problem solving skills? With human-centered research, you can increase empathy and engagement while gathering value feedback to innovate and scale.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCdtMar21

===========================================

Whether you’re a professional, an entrepreneur, or a creative, human-centered research will help you better understand your clients, consumer base or community and gather valuable information. Based in the methodology of Design Thinking - a problem-solving, idea-generation, decision-making mindset that is applicable and useful in all disciplines (not just the design field!) - this crash course will teach you strategic tools and qualitative research techniques to collect insights on your clients and community.

After years of integrating the design thinking process into their daily work, TYTHEdesign is teaching how this research methodology can translate across fields and sectors into real world, real work experience. With Understanding Clients and Communities with Human-Centered Research, you will walk away with the skills and techniques to design a plan to increase engagement and grow your impact.

* Doors open at 6:45, class starts at 7:00 sharp *

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN:

• Real world applications for human-centered research (such as interviews, surveying and observations techniques) through hands-on class work

• Tools, tips and tricks for community engagement and feedback

• Techniques to integrate empathy into your design process from the start

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR:

• Professionals and educators from all backgrounds, interested in adding creative thinking methodology to their work

• Individuals looking to build engagement and create modes for direct feedback among their communities

• Early-stage entrepreneurs or those considering starting a socially-minded venture

INSTRUCTOR BIO:

Kristina Drury (@TYTHEdesign) founder of TYTHEdesign, is a social entrepreneur, designer and educator. TYTHE, a social impact firm, uses the lens of design and strategy to support organizations build their capacity in the social good community. Under her leadership TYTHE has increased the community impact of over 75 local and global social good organizations including the NYC Dept. of Education, Citi Community Development, Public Policy Lab and California State Library System. Recently, Kristina has been named a UNDP Innovation Expert. Prior to starting TYTHE, Kristina co-led the nonprofit Project H and worked in corporate social responsibility consulting. As an educator she has taught classes, workshops and training to build the capacity of over 600 change-makers, leaders, and entrepreneurs. Her teaching and speaking experience includes engagements at the Clinton Global Initiative University, Cooper-Hewitt Museum and New Museum’s Ideas City Festival.

Join us on Monday, March 21st from 7:00PM to 9:00PM for <a href="http://bit.ly/BSCmeditationMar21">Meditation Fundamentals: Learn How to Increase Presence, Focus, and Creativity, with meditation trainer and nonprofit professional Jenn Lishansky.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCmeditationMar21

===========================================

Meditation has become extremely popular among the most successful people in the world and rightly so: more and more scientific research shows that meditation can greatly improve the health of our mind and body. Regular meditation can help us let go of distracting thoughts that cloud our minds, expand awareness of ourselves, others, and the world as well as reduce stress, increase focus, and improve our abilities to be creative.

With just a few minutes a day, you can begin experiencing the benefits of meditation including:

• Improved mental clarity and focus

• A greater feeling of presence, positivity, and compassion

• Higher energy levels and better sleep

• Increased creativity and ability to manage change

• Greater sense of balance in life and work

In Meditation Fundamentals: Learn How to Increase Presence, Focus, and Creativity, you will learn a diverse set of meditation techniques that will allow you to access a state of stillness, self-awareness, and sense of calm. You will learn how to prepare your body for meditation and be guided through a series of techniques that will build a foundation for establishing your own regular meditation practice. After each technique, there will be time to reflect about your experience in order to gain a personal awareness about methods that can be applied on an on-going basis to reduce stress, increase tranquility, and inspire rejuvenation.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN

A diverse set of meditation techniques for creating stillness in the mind

How to use meditation to increase focus, self-awareness, and creativity

Strategies for developing a space of calm to allow ideas hiding in the depths of your mind to bubble to the surface

Tips for carrying forward a regular meditation practice

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR  

Professionals, entrepreneurs, and anyone looking to reduce stress, increase focus and creativity, and experience more tranquility in their lives.

INSTRUCTOR BIO

Jenn was lucky enough to be introduced to meditation as a child and has been practicing for over 17 years. As an early adolescent, Jenn began teaching monthly meditation courses for young children in Boston, and for the past 6 years has led meditation retreats for children, teens, families, and adults throughout the East Coast and Midwest. Jenn’s regular meditation practice allows her to manage and enjoy her busy travel and work schedule as well as the rush of New York City living. By day, Jenn manages East Coast and Midwest Chapters at buildOn, an education and service-based nonprofit that runs after school community service programs in low-resource communities and builds schools in remote communities around the globe. Previously, she worked at Seeds of Peace as their External Relations Manager where she managed online fundraising and communications, led a vast volunteer network of young professionals in New York City, and organized an international walkathon call Bridges to Peace. She also managed the Peace Market, a 1500+ event that raised over $300,000 annually. Throughout her nonprofit career and volunteer work, she has also developed curricula and lesson plans for teaching meditation, human rights, women’s empowerment, civic engagement, literacy, and leadership.


You can learn more about BuildOn here and Jenn’s background here.

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description: ARCsquared  stands for American Red Cross Amateur Radio Club. We are located at the Northern New Jersey headquarters of the New Jersey Chapter of the American Red Cross, and our "Base station", Call sign NJ2RC, is located in the Disaster Operations Center ("DOC"). It is a project that was started in 2005 by ARC volunteers to improve the ARC's ability to communicate during disaster and emergency operations. It is not a corporation or other legal entity.  It is a group of hams interested in assisting The American Red Cross.  Hams are urged to become official Red Cross volunteers. Members are interested in emergency communications using amateur (Ham) radio, and are (or aspire to be) licensed by the FCC as Ham radio operators. More information can be found on our website www.arcsquared.org.

Stressed? Overwhelmed? Always Worrying? Stuck in Negative Thought Patterns?

Come Experience the Benefits of Meditation & Mindfulness with us!

Just like we use exercise to maximize the health and fitness of our bodies, we also need to train our mind and emotions.

Current science supports the benefit of mindfulness for a variety of physical and mental health conditions, and for the general challenges of life in the 21st century. Research shows mindfulness can impact life positively in the following ways:

Reduce stress
Reduce chronic physical pain
Boost the immune system
Reduce emotional reactivity
Increase self-awareness
Improve attention and concentration
Enhance positive emotions
Cultivate well-being and happiness
Positively impact the brain

If you're new to meditation, don't get caught up in the "how". Join us to discuss many different ways to relax your body and mind to create more mindfulness in your everyday life! Meditation & Mindfulness Class

$10 donation per class

We say we're not looking for anything serious.


We say we KNOW what we want. We say we're ready for love..or not.


We say we're waiting for Mr. Right, or that We're taking a break.

We say...a lot.


But what do we actually DO?

and, Are we, to others, what we say we want, from others...?

Let's build.

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm and is for Experienced Circlers Only.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7:30 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Circling Lab will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

March 28 - Community Circling Night
April Schedule Coming Soon!

What’s it like to experience Circling?

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

Next Dates:

March 28 - Community Circling Night
April schedule coming soon!

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 5 and 6:

• Chapter 5: 

The Intelligence of Human Physiology:

“Human beings are not natural carnivores. When we kill animals to eat them, they end up killing us because their flesh, which contains choles- terol and saturated fat, was never intended for human beings, who are natural herbivores.” —William C. Roberts, M.D., Editor-in-Chief, The American Journal of Cardiology. When we examine our behavior and our physiology, what do we see about the was we were made to eat..

• Chapter 6: Hunting and Herding Sea Life

“Earth provides enough to satisfy every man’s need, but not every man’s greed.” —Mahatma Gandhi. When the realities of the fishing industry are exposed to the light, what is our reaction. Are we being told the truth about the production of our food.

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural, economic, ethical and spiritual well-being too.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, changed the way you perceive the world or the way you interact with the world,

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.
results.how_to_find_us: I will meet you outside at 7:20. We'll go in at 7:25. My Cell is 917 721 4876.
results.name: Let's discuss The World Peace Diet - Chapters 5 & 6

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
HackerNest Tech Socials are informal monthly meetups where the NYC tech community gets together at a local venue to hang out, make new friends, and take a break from coding.

All you have to do is show up, grab a nametag, find a beer/wine/water, and hang out - that's it, there's literally nothing formal planned. Plan on meeting new friends in the tech industry, and getting into heated debates about Emacs & Vim.

Best of all, it's free (as in beer).

Still confused? That's OK, you'll figure it out. For more info: 
HackerNest FAQ | HackerNest Twitter | HackerNest Facebook

Attendees:

That's you! Thanks for coming. Attendance is free, so all you need to do is be friendly and welcoming. We expect everyone to respect the HackerNest "No Douchebag" policy, which includes everything on the JSConf Code of Conduct, but also includes other forms of harassment like soliciting business or aggressively recruiting. Events like ours rely on everyone being great, so if you see someone being less than awesome, let us know, and they can take it elsewhere :)

Sponsors:

Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. If you are the real deal and want to connect with the NYC tech community, let us know.

Become a HackerNestNYC Sponsor


Venue:

Rise New York is part of a global community of the world’s brightest thinkers and doers creating the future of financial technology. We listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise spaces, and connect, co-create, and scale innovation, in partnership with Barclays. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars.

Wanna show off your office? We're always looking for big open spaces with 200+ (standing room) capacity that are easily accessible. Email us! 

Host a HackerNestNYC Event

Volunteers: 

Every city has a small team of volunteers that makes HackerNest possible. Usually, this just involves moving furniture, putting beer on ice, serving drinks, etc., and we will never let it take over your whole night. So if you can spare some time to pitch in and help out, please do!

Become a HackerNestNYC Volunteer

<a href="mailto:[masked]"></a>

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
What if accessing your desire is the thing that can truly give you fulfillment? What if real health and deep intimate relationships only comes from a life lived in accordance with what your body wants? Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.


It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

***When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.
