results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki & Chris Pelham

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!
results.why: It's a concrete and energizing way to develop the ability to meditate and to come to know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation more clearly. You can also learn to communicate with your Inner Teacher and find peace!

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE.  Technically the sunrise will be around 7 am so this is more of a pre dawn hike until daylight adjusts.   This hike is  a fast pace and we will be at the summit a while before sunrise.  So those who wish to move a little slower have the opportunity to hang out on top.  Expect to possibly be hiking alone if you are slow.  Know the route.

 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.  From there we continue to the Firetower.  


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 5:45 AM.  Don't be late we will not wait.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Sinigual Restaurant
41st and 3rd Ave
(640 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

RSVP: http://www.findspark.com/event/your-name-on-the-small-screen-build-a-website-in-just-2-hours-3/

At a Glance:
A website is a must-have for any young pro to showcase their work; we’ll show you a demo of the Wix.com platform and help you build your site in just 2 hours.

Why Attend:
You might think that you don’t have the skills required to build your own website – but actually, creating your site is easier than ever. In this workshop, we’ll cover:
- How to use the Wix.com editor in a live demo
- The many free features of the Wix platform
- How to map out your website
- What should and shouldn’t go on your site
- Examples of websites built by real FindSpark community members

This workshop is for you if:
- You’re not sure where to start when it comes to building your site
- You think building your website will take forever (spoiler alert: it won’t), so you’ve been putting it off
- You don’t know why you need a website and want to learn more
- You want to see a straightforward demo of the Wix platform
- You want to see someone else create a website easily in real time
- You want to launch your new site right away
- You want to share your work and personality with employers easily
- You want to showcase your talents to the world

How It Works:
- We’ll help you build your new site in just 2 hours.
- This workshop includes a demo of the Wix.com platform, a brainstorming session to map out your site, and time to start your website with hands-on help and feedback from Team FindSpark and Wix pros.

You’ll leave with:
- A free new website
- All the tools you need to manage and promote it
- 50% off an upgraded Wix site for when you’re ready to claim yourname.com

Bring your lunch and a laptop!

results.description:
We will do cold readings of plays in progress and short pieces from 1 to 2pm and then from 2 to 3pm -- if you are an actor pressed for time that day, please let me know if 1pm or 2pm works better for you, and I will try to accommodate your needs! I want you to be able to participate with ease. 

At 3pm, we write til 4pm with a prompt. If you are only coming to write, please come by 3pm so we can start on time without interruptions. If you have paid in advance for the workshop, and you can't attend a writing session, the prompt will be sent to your email, so make sure I have your email. If you have a piece to be read, please try to send it to me via email in advance with a character breakdown to help me with casting. 

You are also free to cast your own piece -- you may not cast yourself in your piece. Give yourself the chance to honor your writing by listening to it as a writer. You may know exactly how you want it done, but that doesn't necessarily help you as a writer. Trust me on this, or ask me about it -- I am happy to discuss it with you. You can also bring in a piece and ask to have it read, and we'll read it cold. 

Please check your piece for time! Each writer gets up to ten minutes of material. This usually means ten pages if you write in accepted format with 12 point Courier font and your pages are not full of monologues. Monologues read longer than a minute a page. So time your work. 

Write Now Workshop is free for actors, but writers pay a fee that I am trying to reduce by 1) opening the workshop up to the community for free as a model for creating community and involvement and offering content to seniors who live nearby and 2) using a space that doesn't cost me a fortune (most of the fees are space fees) and 3) applying for funding as we grow and documenting the way the concept works and 4) having the workshop subsidized by patrons of the arts (already happening so that I can offer it at the current rate). 

The writers fees are currently $35 per session or $30 in advance for 9 workshops at $270 payable by cash or check or paypal to [masked]


Thank you!
Emma
results.name: Read Plays, Respond, and Write!

results.description:
Every event photographer knows about the struggle after an event. Photographing is fun but at the end of the night you have to edit, capture, name, organize and send your photos. 

This is our first meeting for all Event Photographers in New York. We will have free beer and pizza. We will meet in the East Village in a nice backyard.


Topics:

What tools do you use to edit your photos? This meeting is about sharing your experiences with software like Photo Mechanics, Lightroom, Bridge, Photoshop and the in-house tools major photo agencies use. 

And we are happy to announce that Amber De Vos will join us and talk about the low paying rates of major photo agencies and more.


In the second part of this meetup, Steve Eichner will show how he uses the naming tool NameFace.com to name the people in his photos with facial recognition. With NameFace, it is now possible to upload photos straight from Photo Mechanic or Lightroom, then name your photos and send the photos from NameFace to your photo agency.

Amber De Vos will talk about the low rates major photo agencies are paying and what can be done about it. She currently wrote about this in her blog:


"This is the first Fashion Week I will not be shooting in 8 years. Why? Simple, because I can't afford it! Major wire service and imaging companies are paying rates which are unsustainable!!" 

Speaker

Steve Eichner is a professional event photographer working for over 25 years in New York City. His work has appeared in The New York Times, Rolling Stone and many other A-list publications. Most recently he has been a staff photographer for WWD. Steve is the co-founder of NameFace.com.

Amber De Vos  photographs for People Magazine, Women's Wear Daily, Vanity Fair, Vogue, Patrick McMullan Agency and a host of A-list clients in New York City. She also has a portrait studio in Midtown Manhattan. Her website is http://www.adevosphoto.com

Let us know if you have any questions! Let us also know if there is any topic you would like us to cover in the next meetup!

Happy to see you all on Tuesday!

We will meet here:

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
We're back with another opportunity to make a difference for animals and the planet! Last Sunday's event was met with such enthusiasm, that we decided to do it again, this time in Jersey City!


The #veganchalkchallenge presents a great opportunity to speak out. It's simple, can be done almost anywhere, and it's fun. I like thinking of creative, positive, and sometimes witty things to say with chalk.

That said, creativity and artistic skills are not a requirement! We'll have a list of messages prepared, and there's plenty of simple work to do filling out or outlining letters, and handing out leaflets.


While you can write or draw whatever you're inspired to, the general formula I like to use is:

• Short and sweet

• Keep it positive!


• Include a clear vegan message ("go vegan" or "choose vegan") and a url for where people can learn more.

• Animal rights, environmental, or health focus

We'll meet at the Grove Street PATH station in the heart of Jersey City. To clarify since there are three PATH entrances, we're meeting at the busiest one which is on the NE corner of Cristopher Columbus Dr and Grove St. It looks like this:

We'll supply the chalk and leaflets, so you don't need to bring anything.

Because we want a good couple of hours before dusk, our official start time is 5:30pm. I realize that might be early for many folks, so it's OK to come whenever you can. I'll post a phone number to the meetup on the day of the event, so you can text me to find us wherever we are.

We'll chalk until it gets dark, which is around 7:30. Then we can optionally grab a vegan bite at a nearby establishment and discuss how awesome our chalk messages were.

If you are not sure you are ready to leaflet and/or chalk, please feel free to still join and just hang out with us and learn. Maybe you'll be ready the next time!


Note: While we welcome all veg types, this event is about promoting veganism, so please remember to advocate for veganism when chalking or and/or speaking to others, even if you are not vegan.


Let's get out there and be voices for animals!
results.how_to_find_us: The Grove Street PATH station has three exits. We'll meet in the triangular area at the intersection of Newark Ave, Grove Street, and Christopher Columbus Drive. Look for people chalking and/or leafleting!
results.name: Vegan Activism - #veganchalkchallenge JC plus leafleting

results.description:
From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.


The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension: The Isle of Dread

results.description:
This week I am going to see 10 Cloverfield Lane I will arrive at 7:45 for the 8:10 pm showing. I  have seat C6 If you are coming post your seat #  I also plan to go to The Broad Street Diner for the $10 dinner special at 6pm. Please indicate if you are going to dinner with us so that I can make the reservations.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it. 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

If you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. These are loads of fun at the movies they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.description:
** This game is currently closed to new players.  We have a full house.**

Part I: Servants of the Elder Eye

Following the fall of the Temple of Elemental Evil, peace was restored to the lands of Central Flanaess... for a time. Now, in the wake of the kidnapping of Prince Thrommel of Furyondy, rumors abound of cultists making their way back into the blighted lands surrounding the ruins of The Temple. With these rumors comes a growing sense of paranoia among the people of nearby settlements, and mysterious disappearances and deaths threaten to throw the lands back into chaos.

This 5th Edition D&D game is great for new or experienced players, and will take characters from level 1 to level 10.

The game will be hosted at Barnes & Noble in Edison NJ.  Sessions should run from 6pm until 9:45pm.


Additional resources: 


Guide to Greyhawk - This pdf gives a brief overview of the campaign world, including new subraces and an expanded list of gods and their domains. 

World of Greyhawk - My website for this classic campaign setting. 


Greyhawk Game - My site for the game, once it starts.

Character Generation Guidelines - This explains some of the basics of character creation for the game.
results.name: The World of Greyhawk - Servants of the Elder Eye

results.description:
OVERVIEW

Join us as we dive into the world of makers and learn how to build our own hack and gadgets using the Raspberry Pi. It doesn't matter if you're completely new to electronics or if you've been an Arduino wizard for years, this is a conversation on the Internet of Things you won't want to miss.

See the full session abstract below.

EVENING DETAILS

6:00PM - Doors open, head to the Radio City room on the 6th floor. BYOF (bring your own food) or grab a bit before you come.

6:30PM - Introduction, housekeeping + Show & Tell. 3 developers get to talk about recent apps they published (5 minutes each, contact Nick Landry if you want to present).

6:45PM - Main presentation begins (see abstract below).

After the talk - Prize raffle courtesy of Microsoft, and other sponsors.

Your RSVP is required to add your name to the building security guest list. Please keep your RSVP up-to-date should you find yourself unable to come.

MAIN PRESENTATION

Hacking with the Raspberry Pi and Windows 10 IoT Core

Did you know that Windows 10 can run on a $35 Raspberry Pi 2 (or 3) single-board computer? Makers have taken the world by storm, creating countless gadgets and automated systems, connecting everything around them. This session is for makers – neophytes and veterans alike – who want to explore the capabilities of Windows 10 IoT Core to build hacks based on the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), basically attaching electronic sensors and outputs to their Windows 10 apps.

We’ll learn about the tools, how to get started, what hardware you’ll need, and how to build your first Windows hardware project on the Raspberry Pi. Take your maker projects to the next level, and come learn valuable skills to prepare and extend your developer skills for the Internet of Things (IoT).

ABOUT THE PRESENTER

Nick Landry – Senior Technical Evangelist, Microsoft

Nick Landry (@ActiveNick) is a mobility pioneer and former entrepreneur specializing in cross-platform mobile app development for Windows, iOS and Android devices. Nick works at Microsoft as a Senior Technical Evangelist in the New York Metro area. He spent most his career in IT consulting, software and services companies across various technical and business roles, designing, building, managing and selling innovative software products and solutions for the world’s top brands and Fortune 500 companies.

Known for his dynamic and engaging style, he is a frequent speaker at major software development conferences worldwide, was a 10-year Microsoft MVP awarded on Windows Phone Development, and a Nokia Developer Ambassador & Champion. With over 24 years of professional experience, Nick is a certified developer and software architect by trade and specializes in Cross-Platform Mobility, IoT, Cloud, GIS, Computer Speech and Mobile Game Development. He is an active blogger, occasional author, avid gamer, loving husband and proud father.

Blog: www.AgeofMobility.com

GitHub: https://github.com/activenick

LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/activenick
results.how_to_find_us: Room: Radio City (6th floor) - 11 Times Square is at the corner of 41st St. & 8th Ave in Manhattan. RSVP is required to get on the building security list.
results.name: Hacking with the Raspberry Pi and Windows 10 IoT Core

results.description:
So this is the third dosa event for VegOut in five years. I loathe repeats but somehow the dosa is always worthwhile! Sigh/Swoon. I love how New York the dosa has become, too. Check out that yellow cab in the window - doesn't get much more New York than that. (Not true, the green boro cabs actually win for most New York.)

Enough! These rice and lentil flour crepes leave us swooning every time. They come in all different shapes and sizes and are filled with everything from air - yes, really, air - to the south Indian kitchen sink (potatoes, onions, cashews, chilis, chili paste, spinach, etc.)! The bulk of the menu here is vegan, gluten-free and kosher! Can I get a Namaste? Yes!

Triangle Dosa

Cylindrical crepe dosa

Ok, my photo from VegOut event past. Huge stuffed cylindrical dosa cut into 1/4s.

No matter the dosa, you're always guaranteed coconut chutney and sambar, a lentil-based vegetable stew. At Dosai additional chutneys are offered.

Oh, just image search dosa and you'll get the shape gamut quickly.

Our Plan:

EAT DOSA!!!

6:00pm we meet at Dosai, order food and enjoy the very best of south Indian cuisine. We'll also try different appetizers such as iddly and vada.

Accessibility:

The restaurant is all on one level with easy access from the street.
results.name: Dosa at Dosai!

This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. 

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience!...Face to Face....Better than Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin!

What: Interesting After Hour Networking
Event Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember to bring plenty of business cards..

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me.  

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group


Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

============================== 
This event is organized by Roger Kuperways

results.description:
600+ RSVPs through Eventbrite so far - http://www.eventbrite.com/e/alleyboost-career-fair-tickets-21127206042


Our Spring Expo allows a select group of Startups and a whole lot of Startup Enthusiasts to mix and mingle.  For Jobs - For Business Development - For New Users: An opportunity to create some great matchups!

Value for Exhibitors:

Obtain and Test with Early Adopters

Business Partnership Opportunities

Generate Leads

Hire Business and Tech Talent

Value for Attendees:

Exposure to Emerging Startups and Technology

Job Opportunities

Investment Opportunities

Business Partnership Opportunities

Networking

Discounted Product

4pm - 6pm Career and Business Development Expo

24 High Growth Startups will be looking for part/ full-time employees and to create business leads and deals. Learn about the opportunities as you interact with employees & founders of the coolest companies in NYC. Positions in Sales, Development, Design, Operations, Development, etc.

6pm - 7pm Finding Great Employees/Careers Panel

Stay for our panel of experts who will discuss both sides of the the hiring process. Get innovative tips on FINDING impactful employees as well as learn what it takes to BE FOUND. Whether you are a startup or looking to work for one - this is our Only Annual event specifically geared to creating great matchups!


7pm - 8pm Business Development Networking

End the evening putting your contacts to good use, finding a new employee or executing a Business Development deal.

The Panel

M. Wazihullah, Moderator  

Born in a corrugated iron hut in Bangladesh with no running water, Wazi came to America to study Electrical Engineering (Univ of Pennsylvania), Finance (Wharton), and an MBA (Stanford University). Working as an Investment Banker, Venture Capitalist and Management Consultant (The Boston Consulting Group) gave Wazi the tools to become an Entrepreneur – starting companies he has sold, run or folded.  

Ilana Brown, Director of Client Management and Operations at SEVENROOMS

As Director of Client Management and Operations at SevenRooms, a CRM and Reservation Management System for the hospitality industry, Ilana oversees the company's global client base, including restaurants, nightclubs, and hotel groups, and is responsible for the process of on-boarding, training, support, and retention strategies. Ilana also spearheads other strategic partnerships with regards to integrations, and third party tools to expand product offerings to the existing client base.

Karim Belhadj, Senior Recruitment Consultant at Michael Page 

Karim is a Senior Recruiter for the Sales Practice at Michael Page based in New York City. Michael Page is recognized nationally and internationally as a leading provider of quality recruitment services. Karim specifically focuses on the placement of Sales Professionals from Junior to CRO level candidates within multiple industries including but not limited to SaaS, Business Services, Digital Technology and Technical Sales. The majority of clients that Karim works with are emerging startups that are based in New York City.


Rebecca Davidson, Head of Business Development at BuiltIn 

Rebecca Davidson is the Head of Business Development at Built In, a network of online communities for tech companies and startups. The Built In platforms connect talent to startups, promotes local tech company culture, news and growth, and host events...all on a local level. As the head of Business Development, Rebecca oversees the launch, growth and management of Built In's newest market to, Built in NYC.

Josh Goldstein, Co-Founder at UnderDog  Josh is a Co-Founder of Underdog.io. Underdog.io is a talent marketplace working with tens of thousands of candidates and hundreds of top technology companies in New York and San Francisco. Underdog.io has been called "the best-kept secret in hiring." Before Underdog.io, Josh was the first employee and Director of Operations at Bondsy, an app to trade things with friends. Bondsy was a Spring 2012 TechStars NYC graduate and Thrive Capital-backed startup. Josh has also held stints as an intern at a VC-firm, as an equity research analyst, and most interestingly, as a professional poker player, where he traveled and competed in some of the most prestigious and expensive tournaments in the world. Josh has an MBA from UNC-Kenan Flagler (Go Heels!) and a BA from Emory University. Josh loves dogs, even though he doesn't have one (yet). He eats at Chipotle at least twice a week. And he sometimes wishes he was a screenwriter.


Thank you to our sponsors!


Michael Page is one of the world's leading professional recruitment consultancies, specializing in the placement of candidates in permanent, contract, temporary and interim positions with clients around the world. 

BuiltInNYC - We are an online community for NYC startups and tech companies. Join us for the latest NYC tech news, events, jobs and to make new connections in the startup community.

For March's Code Driven event, we're thrilled to welcome: 


• James Turnbull, CTO at Kickstarter: From Rails for Reasons?

• Evan Whalen, Engineering Manager at Blue Apron: 8 Habits for Productive Teams

• Dustin Lucien, CTO at Betterment: Fluid Teams: How Betterment Builds Product

Code Driven NYC features fascinating technical and organizational talks from experienced engineers and leaders.  

This is a developer-only audience and it is completely free to join and attend. Join us for an evening where all attendees are active software developers, with food/drink/networking before and after great speakers, and excellent conversations about development and engineering. 

Schedule: doors open & networking begins at 5:45pm; talks begin at 6:15pm; networking continues at about 7:30pm.

A special thanks to our Code Driven sponsor, Bamboo Talent. Bamboo Talent is the premier recruiting firm representing engineers and engineering leadership.

Code Driven NYC is organized by FirstMark, an early stage venture capital firm based in New York City. Our mission is to partner with exceptional entrepreneurs who are changing the world by solving meaningful problems. We are privileged to work alongside the founders of remarkable businesses like Pinterest, InVision, NewsCred, Tapad, Shopify, Riot Games, and more.
results.name: Code Driven #8 (A FirstMark Event)

>>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

THE WOMEN OF OP.LYNX WELCOME MEMBERS AND FRIENDS OF OUT PROFESSIONALS TO CELEBRATE AT THE BIRTHPLACE OF LGBT LIBERATION.

On Tuesday, March 22, Out Professionals’ dynamic women’s network, OP.LYNX, settles in at Stonewall Inn for an evening of cocktail networking.

Awarded official landmark status by the NYC Landmarks Preservation Commission in 2015, Stonewall Inn became the first New York City landmark recognized for its status in LGBT history.

Tonight some of the city’s most fascinating women professionals take over Stonewall’s private upstairs lounge. Come prepared with business cards and enjoy attitude-free networking. Happy Hour — 2-4-1 wine, beer and well — has been specially extended to 9 p.m.

WHERE
Stonewall Inn, a National Historic Landmark since 2000, is located at 53 Christopher Street, between Seventh Avenue South and Waverly Place. Subway: 1 to Christopher Street/Sheridan Square; A/B/C/D/E/F/M to West Fourth Street.

WHAT'S UP
Cocktail networking and socializing from 6 p.m. Happy Hour — 2-4-1 wine, beer and well — specially extended to 9 p.m. 

ADMISSION
Pre-registered nonmember, $10; at the door, $15. Pre-registered, dues-paying OP Member, $5; at the door, $10. Online registration closes at noon on Monday, March 21. Print and pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!
OP.LYNX was founded to enhance and diversify Out Professionals membership and to create programming of special interest to lesbian, bisexual and transgender women. A 12-month individual Out Professionals Membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to tonight’s event is yours for just $65. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Network With The Women of OP!

results.description:
Napa is a great way to get started building basic add-ins using a supported Internet browser. You can develop, build, package, and publish your add-in all from within a browser. Using the Napa tools you can share your project for other users to review and even download the solution to add more advanced features using Visual Studio. These add-ins can be published to the Office store or a corporate add-in catalog.

About the Speaker


Erik Noren is a Solutions Architect and Team Lead with Ropes & Gray LLP with over 20 years of software development experience. He has worked with a variety of languages and technologies but has spent most of his career specializing on the Microsoft stack. His past experience as a contractor taught him how to find creative solutions for customers that work in a variety of challenging environments. Erik spends most of his time designing solutions to fit customer requests that take advantage of existing team skills and mentoring other developers.

Come practice your swing in the golf simulators and get some tips from the Golf Manhattan pro staff and your fellow golfers from the NYC chapter.

Learn about our upcoming events, such as the Tee-Off and our newly published Golf Outing Schedule, which has a terrific lineup of courses for the upcoming season!

Price: $35 Members | $40 Non-Members

Cash bar is available on the premises. Please click HERE to register.

All skill levels welcome!  Bring your friends and colleagues to this fun evening!
results.name: March Spring Golf Practice & Social Event @ Golf Manhattan

results.description:
Class Tuesday night 6:30-8:30pm.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

group.name: El Centro, volunteer led language classes in Midtown

PREPAY REQUIRED- http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6000

Singles Bingo with Scorecard Matching to keep in touch with those you are interested in! 


How does it work? 

This will be a casual event. We will be playing Bingo for prizes. It's more of a mingle with some fun ice breakers! 

2-3 men and 2-3 women will be sitting together at each station. Approximately every ten minutes, the men will shift over to the next station and continue playing. This ensures that you will get to meet everyone at the event.

What if I'm interested in someone? 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

Where do I get tickets?

Tickets are $20-$30 depending upon how early you purchase at 

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30? This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+.

PREPAY REQUIRED- http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6000

results.description:
There's lots of money to be made in the markets in the next two or three months. Commodities are turning around and stocks are rallying as well. 

Since our February meeting a lot has happened. Gold has definitely entered a new bull market, but silver hasn't as of yet. Some natural gas stocks have had huge rallies, but natural gas has hit new lows (the indictment and sudden death of former Chesapeake Energy CEO before he could appear in court had something to with this). Oil has perked up somewhat. Iron ore had a massive rally going up 19% in one day. Stocks have been rallying nicely, and the ECB lowering interests may lead to more upside. We will sort it all out at the Tuesday March 22nd meeting. 

Until then, you can read some of my articles on these subjects published by Seeking Alpha since the February meeting (the are many more, follow me there to get updates as articles appear):

This weeks Seeking Alpha articles (they may only be available for a week)

03/15/16: “Broken BRICs: How Their Bear Markets Are Affected By Commodities” http://ow.ly/Zxgfi

03/16/16: “Why The U.S. Dollar May Not Rally Further”  http://ow.ly/Zz2dq


03/17/16: “Euro More Likely To Rally Than The U.S. Dollar” http://ow.ly/ZDJVO

03/18/16: “Healthcare Sector: How To Invest To Make Yourself Feel Good” http://ow.ly/ZFYnK

For intraday updates on the markets, follow me on Twitter: @nyinvesting

The articles are free, but admission to the meeting is $10.

AGENDA:

David Harris, PhD - What is the market topping/bottoming model telling us now?


Ryan Nocera - Enhancing Returns With Options


Daryl Montgomery- Update on the Economy and the Markets

results.description:
You spoke, we listened!


This month, our meetup will be focusing on scaling a killer Customer Success team.

How do you find the best talent? What are some best practices when interviewing potential candidates? Who do you hire first? What skills and traits should you look for? How can you take advantage of this meetup group to help you scale?...

Our panelist include: 

Jean Walters, Director of Customer Success at Greenhouse. Jean is a client services / customer success leader with 10+ years of experience helping customers find value in innovative, positive-impact technologies.  As an early member of the team at Greenhouse, Jean developed the customer-centric approach to service and support that has been instrumental in building an enthusiastic customer (fan) base.

Stephanie Manning focuses on talent acquisition and community growth at Work-Bench. Prior to Work-Bench, she was a University Recruiter at AppNexus and helped the company grow from 300 to 1100 people in 2.5 years. She has experience in recruiting for sales, customer success, engineering, finance, and more. 


Bryan Tereza, Recruiter at Greenhouse, a recruiting software company. Bryan spent multiple lifetimes in retail management, where he hired and mentored hundreds of people. By collaborating with engaged hiring managers and connecting with brilliant candidates to build awesome teams, he's learned at Greenhouse that he'd been thinking about the hiring process all wrong. Creating a memorable, challenging, and transparent process for candidates and hiring managers alike is what vitalizes him daily.

The panel will be moderated by Brian Thompson. Brian has worked in Customer Success over the past two years and currently leads a growing CS team at CB Insights. He previously worked in Business Transformation at AIG, hails from Boston and loves finding restaurants in NYC.
results.name: Customer Success Meetup

Get tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/paint-and-drink-nyc.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

WHEN: TUESDAY, MARCH 22nd, 6:30 to 8:30 PM
WHERE: THE DAISY - BACK ROOM[masked]nd AVENUE (@ E 85TH STREET)

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/paint-and-drink-nyc.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

You don't need a mat!

Start Up Yoga is a pop-up yoga experience, providing mobile yoga sessions throughout New York City. We invite you to breathe, meditate and flow with us. Our novice to advanced classes can be conveniently found in spaces in your neighborhood including parks, office spaces, rooftops and art galleries.


60 Minute Revitalize


Carve out the time to unite your breath to your body. Synergize through dynamic movements and conscious breathing. This experience is enhanced with aromatherapy oils and hands on assistance to support postural alignment.

results.description:
It's been quite a ride. As many of you know by now, the Northeast Conference on Science and Skepticism got itself in a rather unenviable position over the last few weeks.

To recap:

First Richard Dawkins posted a pretty nasty video. 

NECSS made a very quick decision to dis-invite him to this year's conference.

After a lot of conversation and pressure they re-invited him.

Richard Dawkins had a stroke and will not be attending but thanked them "joyfully"

After the first NECSS action I posted a hearty thank-you. You can read it here and get a little more of the information as well.

Subsequently I read extensively and communicated with one scheduled feminist speaker who is boycotting the conference because they dis-invited him. This gave me pause. 

I believe this is not only a mess...but a very nuanced one at that. NECSS now plans to hold a panel discussion about what happened and about the problems afflicting the secular community both from a feminist and dare I say political viewpoint.

I think this is a good time for us to get together and discuss not only the Dawkins /NECSS debacle, but practical ways we can improve the misogynistic environment of the secular community.

I hope you will join me!

Some links to ponder:

http://theness.com/neurologicablog/index.php/necss-and-richard-dawkins/


http://www.patheos.com/blogs/friendlyatheist/2016/01/28/richard-dawkins-responds-after-being-booted-from-necss-conference-2/


https://richarddawkins.net/2016/02/necss-executive-committee-statement-richards-response/


http://www.wehuntedthemammoth.com/2016/01/28/richard-dawkins-lindy-west-and-the-cartoon-video-of-great-hatefulness/

UPDATE: Reminder that at 8:00pm we will be having a short meeting to plan the next few months. Please come with ideas, books, films and topics you might like to discuss. If you are interested in hosting a meeting let me know.
results.how_to_find_us: Adler Study
results.name: Dawkins, NECSS, Feminism, What?

Qi, Ka, Chi, Prana, Divine essence, spirit fire, the Light: the stuff of dreams, the energy that powers the body, emanations of the spirit and soul.  With proper mastery of Qi, humans heal themselves and others, commune and communicate on many planes, nature and the universe.


The Chakra, 12 to 14 by Indian and Sfirot, 10 to 12 by Hebrew/Kabbalah doctrines:  the personal communication and energy ports across our bodies: enabling us to give and receive qi, commune with our environment or the universe itself.   Each Sfirot/Chakra one is a gateway to another dimension and realm, each attuned to specific sounds and colors. Bound together they’re the body’s Tree of Life and the energetic Meridian superconductor network that powers our bodies.

Control, balance and syncopation of the body’s Qi or Light, Sfirot/Chakra and Meridians is a Lightworker’s, Shaman’s, Healer’s bread and butter and what the cosmic hokey pokey is all about.

Join this important Alchemy Moderne workshop by B, Surfing the Light: Qi, Chakra/Sfirot connection and control for an in-depth how to of basic and advanced qi/Light movement, recognition, connection and control of the sfirot/chakra, alignment of the Tree of Life, syncopation of Sfirot/Chakra.  All basics for excellence in application of all Metaphysical, Alchemic and Mystic communion and execution. 

Touch stones for the evening are Kyanite and Quartz points of all configurations: these are the go to crystals for energy amplification, directed thought and will, easily programmed for opening, closing and attenuating the flow of Light Qi energy.   Participants are welcome to bring 1 larger quartz point, a dozen smaller quartz pieces/points AND Kyanite of all colors. As always, you're welcome to bring any stone in for identification plus there will be plenty of quartz and kyanite for play, use and purchase.  

 Berzbeez honey sweetened herbal tea is always served, gratis! 

This workshop is a must for any Lightworker, Healer, Caster and Energy worker: no matter your path or spirituality, this is the basic groundwork for excellence in energy mastery......

results.description:
BEGINNER TANGO: Absolute Beginning

Beginner Tango course is meant for people who either never ever danced Argentine Tango, took few classes long time ago or took few lessons quite recently but are not sure what they know or if they are ready for next level.

You will learn basics necessary to progress further. The material is presented in very organized manner allowing smooth progress from class to class. 

Please note that even if you dance other dances like salsa, swing, zouk or any of Ballroom or American Style dances, even if for years you took ballet, jazz, hip hop or any other of solo dances, you need to take the Beginner level class. The axis, the basis for the dance, musicality and partnership is completely different. Taking those 4 classes might be the life changing experience for you. It is obvious that having dance background helps, but it shall also give you enough experience to know that the basic classes are THE MOST IMPORTANT ONES, as they create a base for all your learning experience. What you don’t know will always and always chase you.

 It’s good to take this course to put all your information in order. You gain the necessary vocabulary and learn all the basic movements to be able to easily follow the explanations in higher level courses. Please respect our commitment to excellence. And make it your own.

No partner necessary. Join at any time – though we do recommend starting at the beginning of the cycle (see above for dates). You can take this course as many times as you find necessary for you.

The full course consists of 4 60-minutes classes.
SIGN UP NOW
results.name: Dive into Argentine Tango: BEGINNER TANGO: Absolute Beginning

This workshop will consist of a brief overview on functional programming followed by hands-on exercises to learn the fundamentals of functional programming with JavaScript.  Mentors will be available to help you if you get stuck or have any questions.

Here are the exercises we'll be working through: http://reactivex.io/learnrx/

LEVEL:

Some previous JavaScript experience is required. This workshop is not suitable for entry level engineers.

BRING:

• An ID to show security


• Your laptop 

PREPARE:

No preparation necessary.  

Feel free to talk a look at the exercises ahead of time to decide if this workshop is right for you: http://reactivex.io/learnrx/

AGENDA:

6:30 - 7:00: Mingle, drinks (including beer!), and food


7:00 - 8:30: Get cracking on the workshops 

8:30 - 9:00: Wrap-up

FACILITATOR:

WHEN: TUESDAY, MARCH 22nd, 6:30 to 8:30 PM
WHERE: THE DAISY - BACK ROOM[masked]nd AVENUE (@ E 85TH STREET)

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

TICKET PRICE: $39

TICKETS

Join us on Tuesday, March 22nd at 6:30 pm, at the Offices of SUM Innovation for a brief presentation and fire-side style chat with business leaders actively practicing Conscious Capitalism.

Together, they will tackle the question "Conscious Capitalism: What is it & how does it work in your organization?" and provide you with an opportunity to ask questions of our expert panelists and chapter leaders.

This event is presented by the Conscious Capitalism Chapter of New York City (CCNYC) in partnership with our hosts, SUM Innovation & The Greenwich Village Chelsea Chamber of Commerce.  

The introduction to Conscious Capitalism will be provided by Noel Boyland, President of Boyland Associates, and the Chair of the 'Four Pillars' Committee for CCNYC.  Following this 10 minute presentation, VP of Content for Investopedia Caleb Silver will moderate a panel discussion with Susan Salgado, PhD, Managing Partner of Hospitality Quotient, and Mathew Heggem, CEO of SUM Innovation, on how they practice Conscious Capitalism within their organizations.

There will be time for a Q&A, as well as plenty of networking opportunities to connect with fellow attendees, so bring your curiosity and your business cards!

Wine, beer and light snacks will be provided by our event hosts. Limited seating is available!

Tickets
results.name: Conscious Capitalism: What is it & how does it work in your organization?

Join New York Adventure Club for happy hour drinks at White Horse Tavern as we officially kick off the Adventure Club Book Club (ACBC), and brainstorm New York centric books and literary events to read and attend!

Built in 1880, White Horse Tavern is best known for being a major gathering place for the literary community in the 1950's and 1960's. 

Famous patrons include Dylan Thomas, James Baldwin, The Clancy Brothers (who also performed at the establishment), Bob Dylan, Richard Farina, Michael Harrington, Jane Jacobs, Seymour Krim, Norman Mailer, Jim Morrison, Delmore Schwartz, Hunter S. Thompson, and Mary Travers.

results.description:
From Chairman Alton:

The next BLP meeting will be held on Tuesday, March 22, in Room 7 at the Shelby White and Leon Levy Info Commons, which is on the 1st floor of the Central Branch Library of the Brooklyn People's Free Library (aka, "Brooklyn Public Library"), located at Grand Army Plaza. The closest subway stop is Eastern Parkway/Brooklyn Museum of the 2/3 line. The meeting will start at 6:30 PM.

The agenda will include announcements attendees could make, some business, followed by my "briefing" about my attendance at the International Students for Liberty Conference, which was held in Washington DC, from Feb 26 to 28.

Some highlights I'll talk about are "Breakout Sessions" I attended which will include (from the booklet's description):

Who’s Driving? Honing Your Message to Advance Liberty Carla Howell  |  Sponsored by Libertarian National Committee (LNC)  |  VIRGINIA A


Today’s political campaigns and media coverage are dominated by Big Government. Carla Howell will explain the principles behind, and invite attendees to play, the libertarian game Who’s Driving? — demonstrating how to put liberty in the driver’s seat in media interviews, speeches, written material, and general conversation. It’s a game-changer for activists who want to go beyond mere talk about liberty to actually moving government policy in a libertarian direction.

Politics: What They Don’t Want You to Know Dan Johnson  |  Sponsored by Tax Revolution Institute  | THURGOOD MARSHALL 3 (3RD FLOOR)


Dan Johnson started People Against the NDAA (PANDA) out of his dorm room as a college freshman in 2012. Within two years, PANDA forced the Capitol of New York and six other jurisdictions to ban indefinite detention without trial. Now, taking on the IRS with the Tax Revolution Institute, Dan Johnson wants to teach you how to beat politicians at their own game. Learn how politics really works... and how, no matter what your issue, how you can win for liberty.

(See the booklet here: <a>http://isflc.org/files/2016/02/ISFLC-booklet-2016-1.compressed.pdf</a>;)

Everyone is invited. Free admission. No library card required.

results.description:
The Easter Festival – Aries Full Moon

The great western festival and spiritual high point of the Christian year has the keynote of love and is always fixed by the date of the full moon of Aries, the first full moon after the vernal equinox.

KEYNOTE:

"I COME FORTH AND FROM THE PLANE OF MIND, I RULE."

Aries transmits the energy of the first Ray of Will or Power, a power that can be destructive or creative and purifying depending upon the vehicle which it contacts. It is a fire sign and the purveyor to our solar system of pure, electric fire which fosters and nourishes heat as well as burning and destroying all limitations both individual and within the world at large. In Aries it is said that the “jungles of experience are set on fire and dissolve in flames and…the Path stands clear and unobstructed vision is achieved.” Fire is the great liberator, clearing away obstacles and bringing forth the truth. And through the agency of fire, Aries is said to “fuse the beginning and the end, to blend the opposites and dispel both time and space”.

Each year at this festival there arises the restoration and renewal of all life in all human hearts. “I come forth and from the plane of mind, I rule.” Let us reflect on the application of this keynote to daily life and in so doing allow the thoughts which our souls create to reach and encourage all humanity.
results.name: Aries Full Moon - Easter Festival

results.description:
Join us for an evening of intense usability testing with fellow startup companies. 

Think 'Speed Dating' for Product Feedback. Over the course of an hour and a half you'll meet with 5-6 other startups and take turns to give and get feedback on each other's ideas.

THE FORMAT: 

Bring your wireframes, sketches, or freshly-baked code - and arrive with one clear task you want the user to achieve.

For example, it could be navigating through your onboarding, posting an event, listing an item on your site, or taking and sharing a photo.

You'll then have 7 minutes to watch (and listen!) to another startup interact with your product, before the tables turn and you get to test their product out too.

Become the best damn hypnotist you can – Tuesday night* Practice Group

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues March 8th and 22nd for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Each meeting will focus on something new or in need of practice so we can improve our skills and expand our range. We’ll watch videos of Milton Erickson in action and take the time to dissect them and really learn from them. You’ll learn and share new techniques. We’ll swap scripts. We’ll swap books and other media. Above all, we’ll PRACTICE and get GOOD.

One benefit you get from attending is the group support of learning. Last time we met we watched a couple of hours of a newly available DVD set called “In the Room with Milton Erickson.” It’s how Erickson taught Ericksonian Hypnosis. Up to maybe a dozen people would squeeze into his office and listen to him speak and watch him do demos. Now YOU can be in that room too. It’s pretty amazing, really, and SO instructive. I love it.

AND – it’s only $20 a night! (Amazing deal.)

Open to graduates of Doug’s NLP or Hypnosis trainings or students who have received similar training from other reputable training centers.

TUESDAY evening, March 22nd

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

Learn JavaScript Fundamentals w/ In-Person Instruction!

Fullstack's JavaScript Jumpstart is a three-night course over two-weeks that teaches the "ABCs" of programming and JavaScript.

WHO IS THIS COURSE FOR? 

It's designed for students with little programming experience who want to get a "jumpstart" on their journey toward becoming a Fullstack developer. This course is also a great way to prepare for Fullstack Academy's admissions interviews. 

HOW IS THE COURSE STRUCTURED? WHAT IS THE SCHEDULE? 

The course will run over 3 nights -- covering JavaScript fundamentals. Each concept will be covered by a practical hands-on workshop. You'll develop core programming skills and use them to build a cool final project, which will be created remotely.  

HOW SHOULD I PREPARE FOR JUMPSTART?

All students will need to complete the first 5 units of codecademy.com's JavaScript track (approximately 4-5 hours) before the class.  Students are also required to bring their own laptop - either Mac or Windows is fine.

IS JAVASCRIPT JUMPSTART AN IN-PERSON OR REMOTE CLASS?

Live/In-Person - Jumpstart is taught at Grace Hopper Academy's campus in downtown NYC. Attend all 3 evenings in-person, get in-person instruction and TA assistance, and see the Grace Hopper campus.

HOW MUCH DOES THE COURSE COST?

Tuition for this course is $295

results.description:
The Unwanted Houseguest
A Magrevian campaign for 3rd level characters.

The snows have settled heavy in the north of Magrevia, sweeping down from the Buchen Mountains, and blanketing the open hills and treetops with a deadly field of white. The cold eats at the fingers of men tending their animals in barns, and searching for firewood stockpiled against the winter. It came early this year, and Mother help us all.

The hall sits alone in a clearing, trees approach on all sides but a high stone wall holds them back, cutting a walled garden from the wilds. At shuttered windows a glow speaks of warmth and shelter. From one, the sounds of merriment can even be heard, but there is a tension to that laughter, a strain in the cheer… are the participants forcing this celebration to keep the cold at bay, or is it the cold itself doing the forcing?

The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. The Unwanted Houseguest is a storyline for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, for characters of 2-4th level. The focus is on solving mysteries, and the challenge of surviving the horror surrounding you.
results.name: D&D 5E: The Unwanted Houseguest - Session 4

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
