results.description:
Cinétévé, Résistance Films and France télévisions nouvelles écritures

It was supposed to be a quiet weekend away from the rest of the world. But when a French business school’s hazing weekend goes too far, it’s up to the police to investigate the death of a young student. But when the testimony doesn’t add up, the authorities quickly realize that this tragedy was no accident.

For our March Forum, StoryCode NYC is thrilled to screen the interactive feature film WEI or DIE, created by French filmmaker Simon Bouisson, written with Olivier Demangel. WEI or DIE was initially released in France in October of 2015. It has received numerous awards to date, and realized a huge audience in France after its launch.

This screening is a unique opportunity for those in the USA to view the piece (it's currently geo-blocked). WEI or DIE allows the user to choose what footage they wish to watch and switch from one camera to the other in real time as the story unfolds. 

The result is one narrative with a beginning, middle and end, but a seemingly endless number of ways for the user to progress the arc of the story.

WEI or Die was produced in partnership with Cinétévé, Résistance Films and France télévisions nouvelles écritures.
results.name: WEI or DIE - a Live Interactive Screening

results.description:
Benny Pollak will lead a discussion on the scope of inquiry by the skeptics movement. In the early days of the skeptic movement the issues in which it got involved were topics such as UFOs, claims of the paranormal, and spoon bending. Contrary to what some believe, these were not "no brainers" which could be dismissed out of hand. Instead, skeptics, such as James Randi and Joe Nickell, developed unique expertise in studying and developing explanations as to why things were not what their practitioners claimed. 

Now we have expanded into other areas, such as climate change, nurture versus nature issues, and.even economics and psychology. All of these are areas in which we have no specific expertise. There are a number of problems with this. The first one is the obvious one: we really don't have the expertise. Another one, and one I personally find more troubling, is that many of them are very ideologically loaded and we all bring strong biases to them. 

As a skeptic organization we stay away from discussions of things like politics and ethics for, at least to most of us, obvious reasons. So, what other topics should we get involved in and how should these be treated? We should not shy away from controversial ones just because they are controversial, the issue is whether we are qualified or not. And when we are not, what type of experts should we bring to the discussion and what form should that discussion take?

Benny Pollak is a founding member of NYC Skeptics. His area of expertise is computer science.

NOTE: We ask that, as a courtesy, members who RSVP and decide later not to attend please change their RSVPs to no at least 48 hours before the event.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the room in the back.
results.name: March Discussion Dinner - On the scope of inquiry by the skeptics movement

A friendly Fireside Chat with LeRon Shults, philosopher and theologian. LeRon was for many years a Christian, publishing 12 theology books during that period. Now as an atheist his work continues.

LeRon is Professor of Theology and Philosophy at the University of Agder, Norway, the author of Theology After the Birth of God: Atheist Conceptions in Cognition and Culture, and a Senior Research Fellow at the Institute for the Bio-Cultural Study of Religion. Visit LeRon's website, <a>www.leronshults.com,</a> for more information about his work, links to his books for sale, and several papers which he has written, available for free under "Free Downloads." Read LeRon's paper, "How to Survive the Anthropocene: Adaptive Atheism and the Evolution of Homo deiparensis," here: http://www.mdpi.com/2077-1444/6/2/724


We'll enjoy some food and drink (let's be sure to order to make it worthwhile for the pub) as Adam Gonnerman asks LeRon about his life and work. After this we'll open the floor to Q&A. Should be a fun, informative evening.

Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.

results.description:
Please make sure to RSVP to this event by Tuesday March 22nd at 1pm EST. We need to provide all names to the security desk of this financial institution at that time. RSVPs therefore close officially at 1pm Tuesday. If you're not able to RSVP, come join us at the next NYPT meeting in April. 


------------------------

As many of you know, Neuro-linguistic programming (NLP) is a goal-achieving approach used by many practitioners worldwide using communication, personal development, and psychotherapy techniques.  

Getting Things Done is a productivity and time-management method, described in a book of the same title by productivity consultant David Allen. It is often referred to as GTD.


We've teamed up with Ray Sidney Smith of GTDNYC to provide you a unique evening combining the best of both worlds so you can kick butt and take names. 

I. Agenda, Introductions & Challenges Forum (7:00 PM) 

A. Mix & Mingle - Time to get coffee or a snack, settle in and complete the Challenges Forum signup form before the GTDNYC Meetup begins. Please arrive in enough time so we can secure the appropriate seating!

B. Introductions - (7:15 PM) Each member will introduce yourself briefly, tell us what you do professionally, your GTD experience, and a recent success with your productivity implementation and/or life.

C. Challenges Forum - (7:30 PM) We'll give a few minutes to have the group help each member with solutions to challenges we may be facing currently with life or work circumstances with our productivity system. These are specific productivity challenges and only one challenge per member for time's sake.RSVP with your challenge and arrive early as we only have slots for the first-come-first-served 15 participants in the Challenges Forum!

II. Presentation: "Double Your Productivity With Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP)" by Joseph Varghese (~8:15 - 8:45 PM) & John G. Johnson

About Joseph: 
Joseph Varghese is Co-Organizer of the New York Power Team. Began in 1993 it is New York's largest monthly personal development and leadership meetup.  Since 2005, Joseph has been Chief Accountability Officer at Success Circles, a Peer-to-Peer coaching program pairing members up as accountability partners to reach their dreams by course-correcting daily. 

About John:
John G. Johnson is a Licensed NLP Trainer with the Society of NLP, a Creativity Enhancement Trainer and a Personal Success Coach. He’s conducted workshops in the United States, Jamaica and Europe. He uses a multi-disciplinary approach as well as cutting-edge teaching strategies to firmly ground his students in the time-tested principles, techniques and strategies of NLP. In addition, John is a screenwriting instructor and story-analyst as well as an accomplished martial-artist. http://www.nlpsuccessbydesign.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lASCyM-_-80

• State Management

• minimize resistance and take inspired action toward your goals and dreams

• Belief transformation & Reframing

• The power of affirmations

• Visioning & Using Sub-Modalities to create vivid goals

• The sub-modalities you habitually use to represent your goals directly affect the intensity you feel about the goal.

• The Circle of Excellence

• Creating powerful triggers to raise your energy

• Modeling effective strategies of yourself and others

• The Kaizen approach / Course correct your way to reach each and every goal.

• The Power of Anchoring

• Building positive reference points

• Learn how to easily anchor wins & celebrate the journey toward success

Please feel free to bring your copy of GTD for reference, your questions and thoughts on NLP as well!

III. GTD Resource Sharing (8:45 PM) -- CATEGORY: Journaling / Personal History Writing

This is where everyone can offer a book title, recent blog or magazine article, tip/trick/hack, tool, smartphone app, service or item that has helped them in their life productively either with GTD or otherwise. The above category is a recommended focus for sharing, but you may share any productivity resource that has helped you on your GTD journey. 

We encourage everyone to bring some kind of GTD or personal productivity resource you know about or use to offer to the group!

IV. Announcements / Closing Remarks (8:50 PM)

Directions to 55 Water Street
results.name: NYPT March Meeting - Reach your goals faster! Getting Things Done (GTD) with NLP

results.description:
Neuro-linguistic programming (NLP) is a goal-achieving approach used by many practitioners worldwide using communication, personal development, and psychotherapy techniques. In this GTD NYC Meetup, we have a member-presentation by Joseph Varghese (with help from John Johnson) who will be showing us a bit about getting things done with NLP!


I. Agenda, Introductions & Challenges Forum (7:00 PM) 


A. Mix & Mingle - Time to get coffee or a snack, settle in and complete the Challenges Forum signup form before the GTDNYC Meetup begins. Please arrive in enough time so we can secure the appropriate seating!

B. Introductions - (7:15 PM) Each member will introduce yourself briefly, tell us what you do professionally, your GTD experience, and a recent success with your productivity implementation and/or life.

C. Challenges Forum - (7:30 PM) We'll give a few minutes to have the group help each member with solutions to challenges we may be facing currently with life or work circumstances with our productivity system. These are specific productivity challenges and only one challenge per member for time's sake. RSVP with your challenge and arrive early as we only have slots for the first-come-first-served 15 participants in the Challenges Forum!

II. Member-Presentation: "Double Your Productivity With Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP)" by Joseph Varghese (~8:15 - 8:45 PM)

About Joseph:
Joseph Varghese is Co-Organizer of the New York Power Team. Began in 1993 it is New York's largest monthly personal development and leadership meetup.  Since 2005, Joseph has been Chief Accountability Officer at Success Circles, a Peer-to-Peer coaching program pairing members up as accountability partners to reach their dreams by course-correcting daily. 

About John:
John G. Johnson is a Licensed NLP Trainer with the Society of NLP, a Creativity Enhancement Trainer and a Personal Success Coach. He’s conducted workshops in the United States, Jamaica and Europe. He uses a multi-disciplinary approach as well as cutting-edge teaching strategies to firmly ground his students in the time-tested principles, techniques and strategies of NLP. In addition, John is a screenwriting instructor and story-analyst as well as an accomplished martial-artist.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lASCyM-_-80

• State Management

• minimize resistance and take inspired action toward your goals and dreams

• Belief transformation

• The power of affirmations

• Visioning & Using Sub-Modalities to create vivid goals

• The sub-modalities you habitually use to represent your goals directly affect the intensity you feel about the goal.

• The Circle of Excellence

• Creating powerful triggers to raise your energy

• The power of modeling

• Modeling effective strategies of yourself and others

• The Kaizen approach / Course correct your way to reach each and every goal.

• The Power of Anchoring

• Building positive reference points

•  Learn how to easily anchor wins & celebrate the journey toward success

Please feel free to bring your copy of GTD for reference, your questions and thoughts on NLP as well!

III. GTD Resource Sharing (8:45 PM) -- CATEGORY: Journaling / Personal History Writing

This is where everyone can offer a book title, recent blog or magazine article, tip/trick/hack, tool, smartphone app, service or item that has helped them in their life productively either with GTD or otherwise. The above category is a recommended focus for sharing, but you may share any productivity resource that has helped you on your GTD journey. (We compile resources discussed and post them to our Resources Page in the GTDNYC Google Group. Join us there!)

I encourage everyone to bring some kind of GTD or personal productivity resource they know about or use to offer to the group!

IV. Announcements / Closing Remarks (8:50 PM)

Upcoming Meetup events, and additional programs, announcements will be given. If you are not receiving the Meetup notifications about Meetups and our other productivity activities (e.g., Productivity Book Group, #ProdChat, the weekly Twitter chat, and Productivity Café), please sign up directly here for email notifications. All announcements must be sent to the Meetup Organizer via a Meetup message to announce to the group, at his/her sole discretion. Thank you!

Do you mind helping support this Meetup? This free Meetup can now receive small contributions to help it grow. Chip in here: https://secure.meetup.com/gtdnyc/contribute/
results.name: Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) and Getting Things Done (GTD) | GTD NYC

The New York City KTC was established in 1976 by His Holiness the Sixteenth Gyalwa Karmapa. We provide weekend seminars, weekday classes, and practice sessions in the evenings at various locations in Manhattan. In addition, we have established a series of introductory classes and special events celebrating the Buddhist holidays. Individual meditation instruction is provided by appointment.

For complete details on teachings by visiting lamas or to receive our monthly calendar of events, please contact us via e-mail or phone.

244 West 54th Street, 12th Floor
Between Broadway and Eighth Avenue
New York NY
Take the elevator to the 12th floor and walk up one short flight to the Penthouse. Look for our sign on Room PH#4.

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
***Note: Different location than normal this week***

Welcome to Week 4 of the Urban Farming challenge!

Over the last few weeks, we've explored many facets of the urban agriculture industry, from the challenges it can solve to the technology involved.

Last week we honed in on a short list of viable business ideas that would solve this month's challenge of creating a plant-based solution that makes urban farming fun, accessible, and financially feasible for the average NYC resident while supporting the city's impoverished.

To finish off the challenge this week, we'll be joined by Teryl Chapel of City Planet Farms, as well as many of our guests from previous weeks. The goal of this meetup is to identify the most actionable business opportunity from our short-list, which everyone will receive during the event.

Since there are 5 Tuesdays in March, this will count as the final meetup in which we'll be discussing our business ideas, and we'll be joined by Gray Scott in Week 5 to learn about Urban Farming trends and cutting-edge technology.

See you Tuesday!

-Dan & the Think Tank Team (Mike, Mikayla, Kevin, and Brendan)
results.how_to_find_us: Show your ID to the doorman. Take the elevator to the 7th floor. Make a left to arrive at Suite 700A.

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 3 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 3 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 3 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place: A new East Village Chinese restaurant specializing in dry pot cooking.

http://malaproject.nyc/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
The de Blasio administration initiated a program to license operators of 385 neighborhood domain names - Astoria.nyc, Bensonhurst.nyc, Corona.nyc, DUMBO, Elmhurst.nyc, Flatbush.nyc, GreenwichVillage.nyc, Harlem.nyc...

On Tuesday, March 22 at 7 PM we're going to review that licensing program and explore ways to connect the (potentially) 385 independent operators of those domain names, enabling them to share ideas and best practices.

Agenda:

o Update on the city’s licensing program for the neighborhood domain names.

o Hear the experiences and expectations of applicants for neighborhood names.

o Discussion: What organizational structure will enable operators of these “dotNeighborhoods” to share best practices and be represented before city and other regulatory entities? How can these operations collaborate to create open-source modules like bulletin boards, neighborhood calendars, etc.?

Sponsors: Connecting.nyc Inc., The New York Internet Society.

What: Empowering Neighborhoods
Where: The Neighborhood Preservation Center, 232 East 11th Street
When: Tuesday, March 22, 7:00 - 8:30 PM

The facility has 20 seats. Reserve one here or email [masked]. Light refreshments will be provided.


Can't make it? The meeting will be recorded by the New York Internet Society. Keep an eye on the Connecting.nyc blog for updates.

Interested in operating a neighborhood name? Begin your exploration on our Adding Internet Mojo To Neighborhoods pages.

Best,

Tom Lowenhaupt, Director
Connecting.nyc Inc.

The on-going classes will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means. While it focuses on Astrology as it refers to Tarot, there will be some Qabalah which includes a brief study of the Tree of Life.  

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table.

Payment can be made in class.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

Opened in 2003 by Texas-born owner Sean Patterson, LOBO was created to satisfy the hankering that most displaced Texans have for chili con queso, rich & spicy con carne sauce, and the basic yet flavorful cheese enchiladas.

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the nuance and richness of connection, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, authentic relationships Ive seen become possible for them.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more I've seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, and grow in their natural presence and love for others.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $20

To ensure a full experience for everyone, the meetup will start promptly at 7:00. Please arrive no later then 6:55 to set up and be ready to begin.
results.name: Tuesday Night Circling: Connecting Through Presence

results.description:
We are blessed to have soo many varieties of food here in NYC. With hundreds if not thousands of Mexican restaurants/taquerias in NYC we as Tacoholics just can't lose. Otto's and Taqueria Diana are both imports from the West Coast. They have both been in NYC for around the same amount of time (2-3 years) and have brought that So-Cal variety of Mexican cuisine to us Yankees here in NYC.


Being just a few blocks away from each other I think it's the perfect opportunity to compare apples to apples to see which one is the best.


Otto's like Diana makes their own tortilla's from their own masa blend. It's one of the things that makes any taqueria stand out from others. Their masa fries are top notch and their brand of taco is definitely something I can count on in a pinch when I am looking for a quick pickup and go taco. This will be our fist stop on this double header.

Taqueria Diana, a mere two blocks away has been on my radar for a few years. I have been hearing more and more about it lately so the time is finally here. The have tacos, burritos, nachos and even roast chicken. You can go any way you want with that but I am there for the tacos.


Join us for what will be another magic night of decadent meats, veggies and condiments on a corn platform going down ever soo heavenly. I will be looking for your opinions as to which is the best so be prepared to render ultimate decisions.


And Now... More TacoPorn:
results.how_to_find_us: Otto's is very small you will see me, Same with Diana..
results.name: Taqueria Diana Vs. Otto's Tacos (Taco Tuesday Double Header)

results.description:
You write short stories, and you want to see them published. Of course you do! But where do you start? The publishing side of writing is complex enough to make the writing part look easy. We’ve got the guy who can answer your questions, such as:
• are there too many markets or not enough readers?
• the business of short fiction and why so many struggle with it
• is the current state of things good for writers
• the numbers behind the slush pile
• the numbers behind the publishers
• new golden age or not?
• where is this all headed?

What it all comes down to is being informed. The more informed you are about the marketplace, the better prepared you are to work within in (or against) it.

Tickets: $5, all of which goes to Neil. Available on Eventbrite.com – search The State of Short Fiction
When: Tuesday, March 22 at 7:00, doors open at 6:300
Where: Singularity & Co, 18 Bridge Street, DUMBO, Brooklyn, NY

Ask questions and enjoy a lively discussion. We hope to see you there!

Neil Clarke is the editor of Clarkesworld Magazine, Forever Magazine, and The SFWA Bulletin; owner of Wyrm Publishing; and a three-time Hugo Award Nominee for Best Editor (short form). The inaugural edition of his Best Science Fiction of the Year anthology series will be published by Night Shade Books this June. He currently lives in NJ with his wife and two children.

Find out more online at clarkesworldmagazine.com
results.name: Expert Meetup: The State of Short Fiction with Neil Clarke

There will be a talk at this event starting at 7:30PM:

Intro to Data Science - Bard Fetler

What tools are available for Data Analysis in Python? We'll do a brief walk-through with an example dataset, including the basic steps for data cleaning, analysis and prediction. Rather than an inclusive list of all the options available, it will be a gentle introduction to the basic ideas and libraries.


---


Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Chartbeat


Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

results.description:
Tuesday, March 22nd, 7:00pm, Library Auditorium. 

"Spy Search" Lecture and and discussion 

"He's Watching You:  "Nazi Spys in Glen Rock"

In May 1940, at the same time German tanks were rolling through the green fields of France, the FBI was engaged in a war at home against potential "Fifth Column" threats, Nazi spies and saboteurs. A main target of the FBI was an "American" organization called the Amerikadeutscher Volksbund, or the German-American Bund. Ideologically an extension of the Nazi Party in the United States, under investigation was  Capt Johannes S. Pritch and Dr. Loos Russo. The Bund was active throughout the U.S. in various forms from 1924 through America's entry into World War II and was often thought to be under the control of Berlin.

One of the many FBI investigations into the Bund focused on a man named Carl Schiphorst. Schiphorst was the leader of the Bund's Bergen County Unit, a trustee in the largest Bund camp in New Jersey, an ardent National Socialist and suspected of being a Nazi contact man or agent. In other words: a Nazi spy.! 

Plus, Schiphorst lived on a small dead end street in a quiet town named after a giant boulder in a valley … a town called Glen Rock.

This presentation will examine the 148-page FBI investigation into Schiphorst and his family. At the same time, it will explore the German American Bund, "Fifth Column" mania, the internment of Germans during WWII and other topics. 

The presentation will include period video footage as well as original artifacts obtained by Calaski, during one of his many explorations of the ruins of a nearby Bund camp. Following the presentation, Calaski will welcome questions from the audience.

Calaski has been a detective with the Glen Rock Police Department for 14 years. He earned a master's degree in history in 2013 and wrote his thesis on the German American Bund. He discovered the investigation of a possible Nazi spy in Glen Rock while researching his thesis and continued this research after earning his degree.

All welcome,


Enjoy Robert
results.name: " Spy Search "

Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
Guest Teacher

Dr. Rob Parker

Dr. Rob Parker is a psychologist who has been studying and practicing Focusing for 15 years, most of that time as a student and friend of Eugene Gendlin, the originator of Focusing. Rob has published several articles on Gendlin's Philosophy of the Implicit, and on how Focusing is used in psychotherapy, particularly with psychological trauma.

Zen training encourages us to be with the reality of who we are, not the illusion of who we ought to be.

Focusing shows how to pause the on-going situation and create a space for new possibilities for carrying forward. They both teach ThePractice of Presence to what is… Reality. 

Zen brings to Focusing techniques that deepen Presence and skill sets that awaken body-mind consciousness and non-dual perspectives.

Focusing brings to Zen a meditative way of awakening to, reintegrating and healing wounded and split-off parts of us that most spiritual practices do not address.

The integration of Focusing and Zen can broaden our spiritual path by bringing together two very complementary techniques.


Please Join Us!

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

This is an introductory workshop on the Universal Rays of consciousness, which are the creation energies of the universe. Each soul incarnates to learn, master, experience and explore different creation energies for the evolution and ascension of each soul.

In this workshop we will explore three of the seven Universal Rays of consciousness that your soul has incarnated with in this lifetime.

What is your souls purpose and mission? What are the cosmic energies held in your ego/personality? Are you aligned with the universal wisdom and support that is available to you?

When we are not in alignment with our souls purpose we can experience depression, lack of abundance, anger, fear, rejection, relationship challenges as well as physical and mental illness and disease. 

Join us for an evening of discovery, connection and realignment to our soul's purpose. Reconnect to the wisdom and energies that fully support our path. Gain insight and understanding to the energies that influence your soul, ego and soul group. 

A Universal Ray Soul Reading offers you the cosmic wisdom and support so you may align to the truth of who you are and experience your life with more joy, ease and grace.

This work is based on the principles of the Universal Rays Healing, which is channeled by an embodied Ascended Master channel, Ishtar. 

To learn more about the Universal Rays Healing visit : Universal Rays Healing

PLEASE NOTE:

This event requires a pre-payment to attend and is limited to 8 attendees.

results.description:
http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/6/b/b/event_7042203.jpegCome join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) in a lively, friendly, facilitated discussion group for men, women, genderqueer, transgender, and not-quite-sure people, as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension, as long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual, bi-curious, questioning, queer, “I don’t label myself,” bi-friendly or some other non-monosexual identity).

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave.

The group meets at The LOFT, the LGBTQ safe space in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month.

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat


WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ.  

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)


Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.


Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
West Caldwell, N.J. – Men of all ages are invited to participate in free singing lessons provided through the Dapper Dans of Harmony, Essex County’s premiere men’s chorus.
Ready, Set, Sing! Will be taught by the members of Gimme Four; an Internationally Competitive quartet; ranked in the top twenty in the world and members of the Dapper Dans of Harmony.
Give us six Tuesday evenings, and we’ll give you the skills you need to experience all the fun of solo or group singing.
Classes run Tuesdays at 7:30 p.m. for one hour each from March 1, 2016 until April 5, 2016 at the West Caldwell Civic Center, 5 Fairfield Ave, West Caldwell, NJ 07006. Singers of all skill levels and experience are invi...ted and all learning materials are free.
You don’t even need to be able to read music, we will teach you everything you need to know to sing richly and with resonance to produce ear-pleasing harmony. Our participants will quickly be producing beautiful harmony without the aid of a piano and in the company of a great bunch of fellow singers.
Everyone sings; whether it is in church, in the car, or in the shower, people have a natural desire to express themselves in song. However, many of us are unsure about singing in front of others. Through this program, the Dans want to help men get the most beautiful sound possible from their voice.
Advance registrations are appreciated, while walk-ins will be welcome. Contact the group at[masked] or [masked] to register or for more information.
The Dapper Dans of Harmony are part of the 24,000-member Barbershop Harmony Society and meet Tuesdays at the West Caldwell Civic Center and new singers are always welcome. Go to dapperdans.org to learn more about the group.
Ready, Set, Sing!
What: Free singing lessons courtesy of the Dapper Dans of Harmony
Where: West Caldwell Civic Center, 5 Fairfield Ave., West Caldwell NJ. Just look for the big clock!
When: Tuesdays at 7:30 p.m. from 3/1/16 until 4/5/16
To register please contact us at[masked] or [masked].

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.


We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try.

And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!


Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*


There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me when you arrive.
results.name: Trivia Quiz Night @ The Garth Road Inn in Scarsdale

results.description:
Here is a unique opportunity to join a healing group that meets regularly to support your needs using the amazing potential of Tapping.

There will NOT be a lot of discussion or socializing because we will be too busy Tapping on specific and general issues of our Emtional and Physical concerns using EFT and something called Tong Ren.

EFT is well known for eliminating the causes of emotional distress. Many people are also aware of using EFT for physical well being. Sometimes we need to look at the emotional aspects that may be behind the issues of concern, and sometimes we just tap directly on the symptoms and notice if we get relief just from that. Its very nice when this happens and it happens a lot.

Tong Ren is another form of healing using tapping but unlike EFT it doesnt involve any dialog to describe the issues of concern. We just tap on a surragate model (Tong Ren) as if we were doing acupunture on a real body with intention of healing and it works!!!!

We'll meet at Jain's home in Scarsdale every 2nd and 4th Tuesday evening and whoever is interested in joining us is welcome. The only stipulation is that whatever issue you bring to our attention you let us tap on it.
results.name: Tapping Meetup for Emotional and Physical Healing with EFT and Tong Ren

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Hi Guys!


On Tuesday (3/22) we're taking over Edi & The Wolf, the East Village Austrian hot spot run by Michelin-Starred Chefs Eduard "Edi" Frauneder and Wolfgang "The Wolf" Ban. The restaurant is both a NY Times and NY Mag Critics' Pick, and the chefs will be serving us 9 of their favorite Austrian dishes! ALSO,  Chef Eduard will be coming out throughout the meal to introduce the dishes and share the stories behind them.

RSVP at: https://tastingcollective.com/events/18

Please note, you MUST buy tickets via the link below to grab seats. We will not be able to accommodate RSVPs on meetup.com who haven't purchased tickets via the link below.


The price is $45 plus tax and tip, which covers the full lineup of 9 dishes.

When was the last time you got to enjoy a feast with a Michelin-Starred chef? Join us! 

-Nat

results.description:
RSVP: http://www.findspark.com/event/networking-bootcamp-make-connections-online-offline/

At a Glance
Free, live virtual workshop focused on helping you make connections in person and online to fill your network with the right people, plus a live Q&A with our Founder & CEO, Emily Miethner.

Why Attend?
They say it’s all about who you know…but what if you don’t know the right people? There are so many ways to network both online and in-person, there are no excuses anymore for not having the “right” connections. In this workshop, you’ll learn to:
- Use platforms like Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn to connect with like-minded young pros
- Reach out to people you admire, even if you’ve never met
- Start and end conversations at events
- Feel more confident when networking
- Turn an acquaintance into a powerful connection
- Create a network that will support you throughout your career

This free virtual workshop will be held by none other than our fabulous and fearless leader, Emily Miethner.

The presentation will last about 45 minutes, followed by a 15 minute Q&A.
results.name: Networking Bootcamp: Make Connections Online & Offline

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!

http://laluznyc.com

Drop-in Class- $12

results.description:
Hey Everyone!

The group is once again invited to a great night of comedy on Tues March 22nd at 9:30pm at Gotham Comedy Club!

EVERYONE IN THE GROUP CAN GET FREE TICKETS!!!
Bring anyone you'd like, the more the merrier! This is one of the BEST comedy clubs & voted one of the BEST comedy shows in NYC!!

Tickets are normally priced at $15 each! If anyone wants to go, just make sure to RSVP through the online link below to get your tickets.

FREE TICKET LINK: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tuesday-march-22nd-930pm-tickets-22668772910

The show is called "Comedy Juice" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, Saturday Night Live, Chelsea Lately, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Conan, etc), HBO, Showtime, & More! This show definitely features some of the BEST comedians in comedy!

**HEADLINING THIS SHOW: CAST MEMBERS FROM SNL, THE DAILY SHOW & MORE!!**

In the past few months, this show has had HUGE special guests including: Kevin Hart, Louis CK, Jerry Seinfeld, Dave Attell, Jim Gaffigan, Colin Jost, & Judah Friedlander!!

The show starts at 9:30pm but they request you all arrive inside the club by 9:15pm. There's a great bar next door called Jake's Saloon that everyone can meet up at before the show, this is the easiest way to find & meet the group! Meet at Jake's Saloon by 9pm and go into the comedy club all together!!

The show is 18+ & Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)

Hope to see you all at the show
results.name: Free Tickets! Gotham Comedy Club w/ SNL & Daily Show Cast Members + More!

results.description:
So we have a better idea of who is coming for what, we're separating the meeting from the 101 and trash tour. Feel free to come to both!

At 9pm, we end our organizational meeting (see previous event), and have a brief introductory discussion about freeganism. Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you just want an introduction to freeganism, you can come just for the Freeganism 101 discussion. After, we will explore the area’s wasted food and other goods. We give advice on how to salvage these goods and comment on the reasons for such waste. The meeting is not open to media, but the trash tour WILL welcome media that has contacted us in advance.

If you have trouble finding us, call Janet at (347) 724-6954.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the upstairs seating area.
results.name: Freeganism 101 and Trash Tour

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Wake up. Work out. DONE!


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4KKltxVko4w

This is a core strength workout. We do boot camp style exercises, so think pushups, situps, planks, squats, burpees, etc. And there's a lot of high fives, smiles, and laughing involved, too...

Not sure how to do burpees? Pike jumps? Dragon Pushups? That's fine! We'll teach you. This is an awesome way to rock your body and get fit fast.


We welcome all fitness levels! Even if you have not worked out in years we want you to join us. Working out with fun, encouraging people in a group setting is better than trying to do this all on your own. EVERYBODY IS WELCOME!

results.description:
Do you like getting up early and starting the day with inspiring conversations or even better: pair programming on your pet project? This is your meetup! :) 

Skip the morning run and instead meet us between 6:30 AM and 8:30 AM bi-weekly to chat, code and have the first coffee together to start the day off with developers or other software professionals who care about the quality of the code and passionately looking for ways to improve themselves. 

The venue: There is a Starbucks open from 5:30 am and behind it the lobby of The Lexington NYC hotel, which is a pretty cool space, they have free, fast wi-fi, plenty of seating and a lot of sockets in the wall :) I asked, and we are allowed to gather so don't be shy and have a look around. There are seats downstairs and on the mezzanine as well, upstairs, where the restrooms are too. See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: If you're unsure, comment on the meetup, but people with laptops downstairs at the big table is a good starting point.

results.name: BNI Chapter 56 Weekly Meeting

results.description:
Are you looking for a way to grow your business? Would building relationships with professionals in other industries help your career?

If the answer is yes, you may want to consider visiting BNI Platinum Chapter 14! We meet each week to discuss our businesses and ways we may be able to help one another. Our members work in a wide array of industries including: financial services, real estate, legal services and many more!

Our members are focused on fostering relationships with one another which naturally lead to business referrals over time.

We welcome visitors to come see what we are all about!

Where: Ruth's Chris Steakhouse
148 W 51st St, 2nd Floor
Between 6th and 7th Ave's

When: Wednesday mornings (7am-8:30am)

To see a list of our members and more about our chapter visit our web page at http://bit.ly/1MgHufC

*If you have been to a BNI chapter before, you know that we are only allowed to have one person per profession. If you see that no one fills that role, then you should be welcome to come! However, if you notice a potential conflict of interest our members will work with you to see if our chapter would be a good place to visit or if it would be better to visit another one of the BNI chapters.

If you are interested in visiting our chapter please reach out to one of our visitor hosts:
Brett Sigler - [masked]
Beverly Stacy - [masked]
Roger Rojas - [masked]
results.name: Network With Small Business Owners and Professionals Across Various Industries

results.description:
No one likes to think something bad will happen to them.  But each year more than four million people find themselves unable to work due to a serious illness or injury.  If you couldn’t work due to a serious illness, would you be able to manage?  Could you survive on savings or sick pay from work?  If not, you will need some other way to keep paying the bills.  Income protection might be the best option.  Join us as Chris Guterl, Regional Vice President of Primerica will explain what income protection is and how it works. Choosing between different policies can be a daunting task as well as confusing.  Mr. Guterl will explain the different types of policies and the advantages and disadvantages of each.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on March 23rd and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
Professionals Exchanging Ideas and Referrals (PEIR), is an independent networking group of business professionals dedicated to the business growth and success of each of our members.  We meet in Berkeley Heights, NJ; our members represent businesses from the surrounding 15 mile radius. 

We are currently seeking new affiliates in business categories not represented by our present membership.  Note - we are not about handing out business cards, but rather we are about building trusted business relationships and sharing business acumen.  Think networking PLUS a mastermind  group.  Please "opt-out" if not serious about a long-term professional relationship.

• We generally meet on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday mornings of the month (8:30am to 10:00am) with periodic evening networking and social events.

• We expect regular attendance at meetings, but understand that business (and life) will occasionally “trump” your attendance. 

• We seek legitimate business referrals and opportunities, and recognize these do not arise weekly.  Members should be “givers” as well as “takers”. 

• Our semi-annual dues are utilized for networking and member-only presentations and development. 

The following business areas are currently represented:

• Insurance – Property, Casualty & Life

• Mortgage Broker - Residential & Commercial

• Financial Advisor – Planning, Investments, Life, LTD, & LTC, Employee Benefits

• Residential Realtor

• Attorney – Business /  Real Estate / Estate Planning

• Web Design / e-Marketing / Graphic Design

• Title Insurance – Residential/Commercial

• Property Restoration -  Fire, Water, Smoke

• Interior Design -  residential & commercial

Examples of businesses we are seeking to join us (not all-inclusive):

Architect - Banking -  Business Consultant – Commercial Lender - Commercial Realtor - Contractor - CPA/Tax Practitioner - Florist – Handyman – Health & Fitness Professionals - Photographer – Printer - Recruiter

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

Dear all,


I've reserved tee times for two foursomes this coming Wednesday (3/23) for 18 holes

Here's the schedule: 

11:15 ... Meet at club house. Pay for your golf. Reservations are in my name (Rose)

11:30 ... First foursome tees off

11:39 ... 2nd foursome tees off

TELL ME SOON IF YOU’RE COMING. … Please be sure to let me know no later than the day before we play (by 10:00 AM on Tuesday, 3/22) if you’re coming! Let me know even earlier if you can. Ash Brook tells me they need 48 hours advance notice to cancel reserved spots. However, they also tell me they can normally handle cancellations if made 24 hours in advance.

COST. … Ash Brook’s web site lays out all of the costs (go to: www.ashbrookgolfcourse.com … click on the “Rates” tab). The key part is that you probably want to buy a discount card (called the County Card) you can use for the season. This discount card can also be used for the Galloping Hill Golf Course (since it’s part of the same Union County system). This discount card is a mere $35 if you live in Union County and are a senior. But if you’re outside of Union County the cost is $125 (again, the senior rate). Note: Chances are good we will play Ash Brook a number of times given its low cost, being a good course, and the fact that it’s level enough that people can walk the course).

COURSE CONDITIONS. All repairs/upgrades are done now. All holes are fully open.

ASH BROOK FACILITIES. They don’t have a practice range. But there’s a putting green next to the first hole. Ash Brook also has a food counter. But note that we aren’t planning lunch there. So eat beforehand or grab something quick on site.

WEATHER. The high next Wed. is forecasted to be a wonderful 66. That’s the high for the week! No rain either.

DRIVING. Unlike last summer, all the roads around Ash Brook are now fully open. Thus driving to Ash Brook should be easy.

Note: I normally will send out meetup notices a couple of days earlier than this. However, I was away this time. So my apologies for the somewhat short notice.

Looking forward to playing some golf with everyone!

Hill Rose

results.description:
Sponsored by: REMEMBER THE TRIANGLE FIRE COALITION


In March of 1911, the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire was the '9/11' event of that era. It claimed 146 victims, mostly young women and girls, many of them immigrants. Fire ladders could not reach the upper floors where workers were trapped. A fire escape collapsed. Appalled witnesses saw workers jumping to their deaths after escape was hindered by bosses having locked women into their workplaces to control abuse of bathroom breaks and petty theft of cloth scraps.

The tragedy was noted worldwide and in this country galvanized both the labor movement and the struggle for women's suffrage, in addition to creating a major overhaul of building code and fire regulations. One eye-witness, Frances Perkins, cited this event as pivotal when she went on to become the first woman Secretary of Labor under FDR, instituting many of the workplace reforms we now take for granted.


https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/12494971_10153773912351421_2205984628069754806_n.jpg?oh=3d19f8f71d1cd550781047e3862eae38&oe=574A88ED

Today, 105 years later, little has changed for women working in the garment industry. Global capital has simply shifted the work to other parts of the world where labor exploitation and the subjugation of women are commonplace. So we repeatedly bear witness to events like the 2013 Rana Plaza disaster in Bangladesh that killed over a thousand victims, once again mostly young women and girls trapped in grimly similar circumstances.

Yet we gather each year in solemn remembrance of these poor workers, and hope to draw attention to the plight of women still forced to labor under unsafe and inhumane conditions. Anyone wishing to forge a more personal connection w/ remembrance of these victims is encouraged to check out Ruth Sergel's CHALK PROJECT.

Chalk Project video HERE.
results.name: Remember the Triangle Fire Coalition, annual comemoration, 3/23

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
Microsoft Office Hours are a block of time set aside to allow Windows 10, mobile, cloud & IoT developers to work on their apps/games and get some help and guidance from on-site Microsoft Technical Evangelists. This is also a great opportunity to work on your own projects alongside like-minded developers, away from distractions and work interruptions.

Typical guidance offered during office hours includes:

 • Pre-vetting of your startup or indie activities for the Microsoft BizSpark program.

 • Technical guidance for mobile developers on Windows 10 & Windows Mobile, or using Xamarin.iOS, Xamarin.Android, Cordova/PhoneGap. This is a great opportunity to get help as you build new Universal apps now that Windows 10 is here.

 • Technical guidance for cross-platform developers on Windows, iOS or Android looking to leverage Microsoft Azure within their app or games. IoT makers are also welcome for guidance on Azure connectivity.

 • Promotional guidance for mobile developers looking to drive more downloads, market and monetize their app or game.

 • User testing of your latest app or game with Microsoft and other attendees.

 • On-Site device testing of your latest app or game on various Windows devices, such as Lumia phones or Surface tablets. Make sure to post a comment specifying which devices(s) you'd like to test on. Not all devices will be available every time.

 • Get functional feedback on how to improve the overall functionality of your app or game.

 • Get user experience (UX) and usability feedback on how to improve the overall aesthetics and workflow of your app or game.

Microsoft Office Hours are open to everyone looking for some time and help to finish their project before publishing, or work on driving more downloads for their apps and games. Formal presentations are not held during office hours and these events will remain unstructured. Office hours open at 2:00PM but feel free to arrive when you want. If you have any questions about office hours, feel free to ask below. We also recommend that you stick around for the monthly evening presentation.

Note to Makers: If you plan on working on IoT gadgets, just remember that this is a corporate office, not a maker space. Soldering and power tools are not allowed,

Your name must be added to the building security list so please RSVP and do not show-up unannounced. Since there is a limited number of seats, please keep your RSVP up-to-date. If you RSVP'd and cannot make it, change your RSVP to "no".

FINAL NOTE: Microsoft Office Hours are about guidance, learning, sharing & testing. This is not a premier-level technical support service. If you have some esoteric bug or technical issue for which you cannot find any help online, don't expect miracles during office hours. This is why StackOverflow exists :)
results.how_to_find_us: Please keep your RSVP up-to-date since seats are limited. If you RSVP and later realize you cannot make it, please cancel your spot as a courtesy to the event host and other attendees. Click here for a map and directions: http://binged.it/1gmMluQ.
results.name: Microsoft Office Hours for Windows 10, Mobile, Cloud & IoT Devs

results.description:
Do you often find yourself having little control over your emotions?

Do you experience anxiety and want to overcome it?

Do you act impulsively and later regret your actions?

If you answered "yes" to any of the questions above, this meditation is for YOU!

"Thoughts," according Buddhist monk Matthieu Ricard, "can be our best friends and our worst enemies."

Osho Says, "the mind can be a beautiful servant, or a dangerous master." 

In this guided meditation call, we will learn how to observe our own thoughts and cultivate the space between our thoughts. This space is often referred to as nirvana, ecstasy, and enlightenment.  When we enter this space we have total control over our emotions and actions. 


Until what is on the inside - that is, your mind - is corrected, the external world, that is, how you perceive and experience the world around you will be a mere reflection of it.

We will learn an ancient 5,000 year old Vedic technique taught by Indian enlightened master Paramahamsa Nithyananda, called "unclutching." In this technique we learn how to master our thoughts, and as a result control our emotions. 

Join me on this enlightening 45 minute experience! 

In love and abundance, 

Ayelet Shimron 

http://ayeletshimron.com/

www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron


[masked]-GOAL 

Testimonials from previous Life Transformers:

"Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. It's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I haven't come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

The meditation helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC
