-‘Must-know’ facts before you apply: the NYC non-profit job market culture, salary, trends

-What kind of people are non-profits looking for

-Possible career trajectories in Non-profit

-Career opportunities for fresh graduates

-How to transition into non-profit from the for-profit sector

-What experience and skills non-profits value and look for

-Best practices/strategies for your Non-Profit job search and marketing yourself as a candidate

-How to determine your cause and which non-profit/s to apply to

-Already in non-profit? How to increase your exposure to the key players at other non-profits?

And more

Click HERE to Buy Tickets


NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful non-profit recruiters and professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn the formula of finding a job at a non-profit.

*Complimentary snacks and beverages will be served*

Early bird online registration- $15

Online Discounted Registration - $20

Online Special: $25

Click HERE to Buy Tickets

Panelists:

June Choi, CEO & Founder, Serval Ventures / Co-Principal, CKcm Associates

June has worked with organizations ranging from startups to institutions as a consultant, coach, executive, advisor, funder, investor, board member, project manager, fundraiser and teacher. She is currently CEO & Founder of Serval Ventures, an organization that is evolving the venture investment and social impact models by focusing on data-driven strategies and honing human capital. 

She is also Co-Principal at CKcm Associates, a holistic collaborative change management practice focused on helping non-profit organizations hone, build, expand and clarify their social change visions by focusing on strengthening infrastructures, systems and processes to sustain change long-term. June has also been featured in the Chronicle of Philanthropy and has been invited to speak at numerous local, state and national conferences and workshops on topics such as nonprofit management, philanthropy, diversity issues, policy matters and career development. www.servalventures.com @servalventures @ckcmassociates 

Grace Beasley, Chair at HR/NY Not for Profit Special Interest Group (SIG)

Grace Beasley-Matthews, SPHR is the President, of GEB’s Enterprise Consulting, LLC. and the Director of Human Resources for a nonprofit housing development organization in Harlem, NY. For the past 20 years, Grace has directed the HR functions for corporations ranging in size from 100 to 500 employees covering the health, social services, higher education, and service industries, authored numerous employee handbooks, created HR programs, training and systems. Grace is a Board Member at the National Association of African Americas in Human Resources of Greater New York (NAAAHR-GNY) and the Human Resources Association of New York (HR/NY), as well as Chair of the Not for Profit Special Interest Group with HR/NY.

She is also an Adjunct Instructor, and currently working on a DBA in Business Administration with Walden University.

http://www.linkedin.com/in/gracebm

Purvi Shah, Non-Profit & Media Consultant

Known for her sparkly eyeshadow and raucous laughter, Purvi Shah inspires change as a non-profit consultant, anti-violence advocate, and writer. She has a 20-year track record promoting initiatives that further equity, safety, education, creativity, economic access, and opportunities for underserved communities. She won the inaugural SONY South Asian Social Service Excellence Award for her leadership fighting violence against women. During the 10th anniversary of 9/11, she directed Together We Are New York, a community-based poetry project to highlight Asian American voices.Terrain Tracks is her award-winning poetry book and Dark Lip of the Beloved: Sound Your Fiery God-Praise is her new chaplet. 

Recently she hosted A Woman’s World, a radio show for South Asian American women to speak to their community advocacy and creativity. As a social justice leader and arts activist, she continues to foster a legacy in action. You can discover more at http://purvipoets.netor @PurviPoets.

Yuliya Mazur, Resource Communications Manager, JCC’s of North America

Yuliya has over fifteen years of executive management experience in the business and non-for-profit world with specific emphasis on business analysis, program development, event management, travel management, strategic planning, customer service, Jewish education and community work. Born and raised in Russia, Yuliya immigrated to the USA in 1997, and since then has spent a majority of the past 2 decades in the Travel & Hospitality industry and Jewish Communal Affairs.  This past year has seen her formally transition to a full time Jewish nonprofit professional role in February 2013.

She has degrees in English & Literature, French, Computer Programming & Systems Design and Jewish Studies and Nonprofit Management.

Moderator:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin, The Rockin’ Career Coach


Vicki Aubin(aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a personal branding and career transition strategist based in New York City who helps career revolutionaries reinvent themselves. With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, over a decade in Human Resources and Recruiting at Fortune 500 companies and as a successful career transitioner herself, Vicki helps her clients to unleash their inner rockstar, crank up the volume on their most marketable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. 

A featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series, Vicki is a regular mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or at @rockincareer.

Click HERE to Buy Tickets

 About NY Career Meetup

NY Career Meetup connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events. The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions.

The group gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers. NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment.

 Join NY Career Meetup

http://www.meetup.com/NY-Career-Meetup/

With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, over a decade in Human Resources and Recruiting at Fortune 500 companies and as a successful career transitioner herself, Vicki helps her clients to unleash their inner rockstar, crank up the volume on their most marketable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. 

A featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series, Vicki is a regular mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or at @rockincareer.

Click HERE to Buy Tickets

 About NY Career Meetup 

NY Career Meetup connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events. The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions. 

The group gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers. NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment. 

 Join NY Career Meetup 

http://www.meetup.com/NY-Career-Meetup/

Jobs In Non-Profit - A Round table for Job Seekers

Are you passionate about Non-Profits and contributing to a good cause and want to work for one? 

Not sure how to get your “foot in the door” in this dynamic job market?

Click HERE to Buy Tickets 

NY Career Meetup will answer these tough questions and much more.

This exclusive, info-packed event will feature experienced non-profit recruiters and professionals, a career coach, lots of experience and one agenda: How to get a job in Non-Profit.

Who Should Attend? 

Those professionals looking for savvy, inside information on getting a career in the NYC Non-Profit community that you won’t hear elsewhere, including:

-‘Must-know’ facts before you apply: the NYC non-profit job market culture, salary, trends

-What kind of people are non-profits looking for

-Possible career trajectories in Non-profit

-Career opportunities for fresh graduates

-How to transition into non-profit from the for-profit sector

-What experience and skills non-profits value and look for

-Best practices/strategies for your Non-Profit job search and marketing yourself as a candidate

-How to determine your cause and which non-profit/s to apply to

-Already in non-profit? How to increase your exposure to the key players at other non-profits?

And more

Click HERE to Buy Tickets


NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful non-profit recruiters and professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn the formula of finding a job at a non-profit.

*Complimentary snacks and beverages will be served*

Early bird online registration- $15

Online Discounted Registration - $20

Online Special: $25

Click HERE to Buy Tickets 

Panelists:

June Choi, CEO & Founder, Serval Ventures / Co-Principal, CKcm Associates 

June has worked with organizations ranging from startups to institutions as a consultant, coach, executive, advisor, funder, investor, board member, project manager, fundraiser and teacher. She is currently CEO & Founder of Serval Ventures, an organization that is evolving the venture investment and social impact models by focusing on data-driven strategies and honing human capital. 

She is also Co-Principal at CKcm Associates, a holistic collaborative change management practice focused on helping non-profit organizations hone, build, expand and clarify their social change visions by focusing on strengthening infrastructures, systems and processes to sustain change long-term. June has also been featured in the Chronicle of Philanthropy and has been invited to speak at numerous local, state and national conferences and workshops on topics such as nonprofit management, philanthropy, diversity issues, policy matters and career development. www.servalventures.com@servalventures @ckcmassociates 

Grace Beasley, Chair at HR/NY Not for Profit Special Interest Group (SIG)

Grace Beasley-Matthews, SPHR is the President, of GEB’s Enterprise Consulting, LLC. and the Director of Human Resources for a nonprofit housing development organization in Harlem, NY. For the past 20 years, Grace has directed the HR functions for corporations ranging in size from 100 to 500 employees covering the health, social services, higher education, and service industries, authored numerous employee handbooks, created HR programs, training and systems. Grace is a Board Member at the National Association of African Americas in Human Resources of Greater New York (NAAAHR-GNY) and the Human Resources Association of New York (HR/NY), as well as Chair of the Not for Profit Special Interest Group with HR/NY.

She is also an Adjunct Instructor, and currently working on a DBA in Business Administration with Walden University. 

http://www.linkedin.com/in/gracebm

Purvi Shah, Non-Profit & Media Consultant

Known for her sparkly eyeshadow and raucous laughter, Purvi Shah inspires change as a non-profit consultant, anti-violence advocate, and writer. She has a 20-year track record promoting initiatives that further equity, safety, education, creativity, economic access, and opportunities for underserved communities. She won the inaugural SONY South Asian Social Service Excellence Award for her leadership fighting violence against women. During the 10th anniversary of 9/11, she directedTogether We Are New York, a community-based poetry project to highlight Asian American voices.Terrain Tracks is her award-winning poetry book and Dark Lip of the Beloved: Sound Your Fiery God-Praise is her new chaplet. 

Recently she hosted A Woman’s World, a radio show for South Asian American women to speak to their community advocacy and creativity. As a social justice leader and arts activist, she continues to foster a legacy in action. You can discover more athttp://purvipoets.netor @PurviPoets.

Yuliya Mazur, Resource Communications Manager, JCC’s of North America

Yuliya has over fifteen years of executive management experience in the business and non-for-profit world with specific emphasis on business analysis, program development, event management, travel management, strategic planning, customer service, Jewish education and community work. Born and raised in Russia, Yuliya immigrated to the USA in 1997, and since then has spent a majority of the past 2 decades in the Travel & Hospitality industry and Jewish Communal Affairs.  This past year has seen her formally transition to a full time Jewish nonprofit professional role in February 2013.

She has degrees in English & Literature, French, Computer Programming & Systems Design and Jewish Studies and Nonprofit Management.

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin, The Rockin’ Career Coach

A featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series, Vicki is a regular mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or at @rockincareer.

The group gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers. NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment.

results.description:
Tired of the rat race? We don't blame you...no need to worry!!! Come to our CashFlow in Jersey City and learn how to get out of the rat race while having fun.


During this game you will see how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for money to pay liabilities. You will also have the opportunity to network with local successful real estate investors and learn from their strategies.


Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. Cashflow is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. It makes learning fun and is recommended for adults and children age 10 and older.

We create a perfect environment to meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.

This meet up is by invitation only, so you need to answer the questions in the RSVP for us to be able to contact you with the details of this event.


http://www.youtube.com/v/uqZayPhdUJc?version=3

results.description:
This is a special event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase stylish tech products. While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope. Everyone is encouraged to BYOP (Bring Your Own Product).
• Technology displayed must be applicable to consumer technology
• Technology cannot already be commercially available
• The technology must be demonstrable as a prototype or software mockup; no paper/concept/slideshow entries.

The event will also be broadcasted online and will be live from where the event takes place in Manhattan. Please RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/byop-bring-your-own-productprototype-and-live-streaming-tickets-21102295534

results.description:
This is a special event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase stylish tech products. While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope. Everyone is encouraged to BYOP (Bring Your Own Product). Everyone is encouraged to bring their own product that that has a tangible, hardware, style component.
• Technology displayed must be applicable to consumer technology
• Technology cannot already be commercially available
• The technology must be demonstrable as a prototype or software mockup; no paper/concept/slideshow entries.
The moderator of the event will be Sandy Choi who is a former radio host in Hawaii, and a prominent live streamer on Periscope and headliner at the Periscope Summit.
The event will also be broadcasted online and will be live from where the event takes place in Manhattan. Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/byop-bring-your-own-productprototype-and-live-streaming-tickets-21102295534

Born and raised in Russia, Yuliya immigrated to the USA in 1997, and since then has spent a majority of the past 2 decades in the Travel & Hospitality industry and Jewish Communal Affairs.  This past year has seen her formally transition to a full time Jewish nonprofit professional role in February 2013.

She has degrees in English & Literature, French, Computer Programming & Systems Design and Jewish Studies and Nonprofit Management.

Moderator: 

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin, The Rockin’ Career Coach


Vicki Aubin(aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a personal branding and career transition strategist based in New York City who helps career revolutionaries reinvent themselves. With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, over a decade in Human Resources and Recruiting at Fortune 500 companies and as a successful career transitioner herself, Vicki helps her clients to unleash their inner rockstar, crank up the volume on their most marketable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. 

A featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series, Vicki is a regular mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or at @rockincareer.

Click HERE to Buy Tickets

 About NY Career Meetup 

NY Career Meetup connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events. The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions. 

The group gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers. NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment. 

 Join NY Career Meetup

Jobs In NonProfit - A Round table for Job Seekers

Are you passionate about Non-Profits and contributing to a good cause and want to work for one? 

Not sure how to get your “foot in the door” in this dynamic job market?

Click HERE to Buy Tickets 

NY Career Meetup will answer these tough questions and much more.

This exclusive, info-packed event will feature experienced non-profit recruiters and professionals, a career coach, lots of experience and one agenda: How to get a job in Non-Profit.

Who Should Attend? 

Those professionals looking for savvy, inside information on getting a career in the NYC Non-Profit community that you won’t hear elsewhere, including:

-‘Must-know’ facts before you apply: the NYC non-profit job market culture, salary, trends

-What kind of people are non-profits looking for

-Possible career trajectories in Non-profit

-Career opportunities for fresh graduates

-How to transition into non-profit from the for-profit sector

-What experience and skills non-profits value and look for

-Best practices/strategies for your Non-Profit job search and marketing yourself as a candidate

-How to determine your cause and which non-profit/s to apply to

-Already in non-profit? How to increase your exposure to the key players at other non-profits?

And more

Click HERE to Buy Tickets


NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful non-profit recruiters and professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn the formula of finding a job at a non-profit.

*Complimentary snacks and beverages will be served*

Early bird online registration- $15

Online Discounted Registration - $20

Online Special: $25

Click HERE to Buy Tickets 

Panelists:

June Choi, CEO & Founder, Serval Ventures / Co-Principal, CKcm Associates 

June has worked with organizations ranging from startups to institutions as a consultant, coach, executive, advisor, funder, investor, board member, project manager, fundraiser and teacher. She is currently CEO & Founder of Serval Ventures, an organization that is evolving the venture investment and social impact models by focusing on data-driven strategies and honing human capital. 

She is also Co-Principal at CKcm Associates, a holistic collaborative change management practice focused on helping non-profit organizations hone, build, expand and clarify their social change visions by focusing on strengthening infrastructures, systems and processes to sustain change long-term. June has also been featured in the Chronicle of Philanthropy and has been invited to speak at numerous local, state and national conferences and workshops on topics such as nonprofit management, philanthropy, diversity issues, policy matters and career development. www.servalventures.com@servalventures @ckcmassociates 

Grace Beasley, Chair at HR/NY Not for Profit Special Interest Group (SIG)

Grace Beasley-Matthews, SPHR is the President, of GEB’s Enterprise Consulting, LLC. and the Director of Human Resources for a nonprofit housing development organization in Harlem, NY. For the past 20 years, Grace has directed the HR functions for corporations ranging in size from 100 to 500 employees covering the health, social services, higher education, and service industries, authored numerous employee handbooks, created HR programs, training and systems. Grace is a Board Member at the National Association of African Americas in Human Resources of Greater New York (NAAAHR-GNY) and the Human Resources Association of New York (HR/NY), as well as Chair of the Not for Profit Special Interest Group with HR/NY.

She is also an Adjunct Instructor, and currently working on a DBA in Business Administration with Walden University. 

http://www.linkedin.com/in/gracebm

Purvi Shah, Non-Profit & Media Consultant

Known for her sparkly eyeshadow and raucous laughter, Purvi Shah inspires change as a non-profit consultant, anti-violence advocate, and writer. She has a 20-year track record promoting initiatives that further equity, safety, education, creativity, economic access, and opportunities for underserved communities. She won the inaugural SONY South Asian Social Service Excellence Award for her leadership fighting violence against women. During the 10th anniversary of 9/11, she directed Together We Are New York, a community-based poetry project to highlight Asian American voices.Terrain Tracks is her award-winning poetry book and Dark Lip of the Beloved: Sound Your Fiery God-Praise is her new chaplet. 

Recently she hosted A Woman’s World, a radio show for South Asian American women to speak to their community advocacy and creativity. As a social justice leader and arts activist, she continues to foster a legacy in action. You can discover more athttp://purvipoets.netor @PurviPoets.

Yuliya Mazur, Resource Communications Manager, JCC’s of North America

Yuliya has over fifteen years of executive management experience in the business and non-for-profit world with specific emphasis on business analysis, program development, event management, travel management, strategic planning, customer service, Jewish education and community work. Born and raised in Russia, Yuliya immigrated to the USA in 1997, and since then has spent a majority of the past 2 decades in the Travel & Hospitality industry and Jewish Communal Affairs.  This past year has seen her formally transition to a full time Jewish nonprofit professional role in February 2013.

She has degrees in English & Literature, French, Computer Programming & Systems Design and Jewish Studies and Nonprofit Management.

June has worked with organizations ranging from startups to institutions as a consultant, coach, executive, advisor, funder, investor, board member, project manager, fundraiser and teacher. She is currently CEO & Founder of Serval Ventures, an organization that is evolving the venture investment and social impact models by focusing on data-driven strategies and honing human capital. 

She is also Co-Principal at CKcm Associates, a holistic collaborative change management practice focused on helping non-profit organizations hone, build, expand and clarify their social change visions by focusing on strengthening infrastructures, systems and processes to sustain change long-term. June has also been featured in the Chronicle of Philanthropy and has been invited to speak at numerous local, state and national conferences and workshops on topics such as nonprofit management, philanthropy, diversity issues, policy matters and career development. www.servalventures.com@servalventures @ckcmassociates 

Grace Beasley, Chair at HR/NY Not for Profit Special Interest Group (SIG)

Grace Beasley-Matthews, SPHR is the President, of GEB’s Enterprise Consulting, LLC. and the Director of Human Resources for a nonprofit housing development organization in Harlem, NY. For the past 20 years, Grace has directed the HR functions for corporations ranging in size from 100 to 500 employees covering the health, social services, higher education, and service industries, authored numerous employee handbooks, created HR programs, training and systems. Grace is a Board Member at the National Association of African Americas in Human Resources of Greater New York (NAAAHR-GNY) and the Human Resources Association of New York (HR/NY), as well as Chair of the Not for Profit Special Interest Group with HR/NY.

She is also an Adjunct Instructor, and currently working on a DBA in Business Administration with Walden University. 

http://www.linkedin.com/in/gracebm

Purvi Shah, Non-Profit & Media Consultant

Known for her sparkly eyeshadow and raucous laughter, Purvi Shah inspires change as a non-profit consultant, anti-violence advocate, and writer. She has a 20-year track record promoting initiatives that further equity, safety, education, creativity, economic access, and opportunities for underserved communities. She won the inaugural SONY South Asian Social Service Excellence Award for her leadership fighting violence against women. During the 10th anniversary of 9/11, she directed Together We Are New York, a community-based poetry project to highlight Asian American voices.Terrain Tracks is her award-winning poetry book and Dark Lip of the Beloved: Sound Your Fiery God-Praise is her new chaplet. 

Recently she hosted A Woman’s World, a radio show for South Asian American women to speak to their community advocacy and creativity. As a social justice leader and arts activist, she continues to foster a legacy in action. You can discover more athttp://purvipoets.netor @PurviPoets.

Yuliya Mazur, Resource Communications Manager, JCC’s of North America

Yuliya has over fifteen years of executive management experience in the business and non-for-profit world with specific emphasis on business analysis, program development, event management, travel management, strategic planning, customer service, Jewish education and community work. Born and raised in Russia, Yuliya immigrated to the USA in 1997, and since then has spent a majority of the past 2 decades in the Travel & Hospitality industry and Jewish Communal Affairs.  This past year has seen her formally transition to a full time Jewish nonprofit professional role in February 2013.

She has degrees in English & Literature, French, Computer Programming & Systems Design and Jewish Studies and Nonprofit Management.

Moderator: 

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin, The Rockin’ Career Coach


Vicki Aubin(aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a personal branding and career transition strategist based in New York City who helps career revolutionaries reinvent themselves. With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, over a decade in Human Resources and Recruiting at Fortune 500 companies and as a successful career transitioner herself, Vicki helps her clients to unleash their inner rockstar, crank up the volume on their most marketable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. 

A featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series, Vicki is a regular mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or at @rockincareer.

Click HERE to Buy Tickets

 About NY Career Meetup 

NY Career Meetup connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events. The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions. 

The group gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers. NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment. 

 Join NY Career Meetup 

http://www.meetup.com/NY-Career-Meetup/ 

https://www.facebook.com/NyCareerGroup

results.description:
https://youtu.be/L7QJWFA2mLE

Jobs In NonProfit - A Round table for Job Seekers

Are you passionate about Non-Profits and contributing to a good cause and want to work for one?


Not sure how to get your “foot in the door” in this dynamic job market?

Click HERE to Buy Tickets

NY Career Meetup will answer these tough questions and much more.

This exclusive, info-packed event will feature experienced non-profit recruiters and professionals, a career coach, lots of experience and one agenda: How to get a job in Non-Profit.


Who Should Attend?

Those professionals looking for savvy, inside information on getting a career in the NYC Non-Profit community that you won’t hear elsewhere, including:

-‘Must-know’ facts before you apply: the NYC non-profit job market culture, salary, trends

-What kind of people are non-profits looking for

-Possible career trajectories in Non-profit

-Career opportunities for fresh graduates

-How to transition into non-profit from the for-profit sector

-What experience and skills non-profits value and look for

-Best practices/strategies for your Non-Profit job search and marketing yourself as a candidate

-How to determine your cause and which non-profit/s to apply to

-Already in non-profit? How to increase your exposure to the key players at other non-profits?


And more

Click HERE to Buy Tickets


NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful non-profit recruiters and professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn the formula of finding a job at a non-profit.


*Complimentary snacks and beverages will be served*

Early bird online registration- $15

Online Discounted Registration - $20

Online Special: $25

Click HERE to Buy Tickets

Panelists:

June Choi, CEO & Founder, Serval Ventures / Co-Principal, CKcm Associates


June has worked with organizations ranging from startups to institutions as a consultant, coach, executive, advisor, funder, investor, board member, project manager, fundraiser and teacher. She is currently CEO & Founder of Serval Ventures, an organization that is evolving the venture investment and social impact models by focusing on data-driven strategies and honing human capital. 

She is also Co-Principal at CKcm Associates, a holistic collaborative change management practice focused on helping non-profit organizations hone, build, expand and clarify their social change visions by focusing on strengthening infrastructures, systems and processes to sustain change long-term. June has also been featured in the Chronicle of Philanthropy and has been invited to speak at numerous local, state and national conferences and workshops on topics such as nonprofit management, philanthropy, diversity issues, policy matters and career development. www.servalventures.com @servalventures @ckcmassociates 

Grace Beasley, Chair at HR/NY Not for Profit Special Interest Group (SIG)

Grace Beasley-Matthews, SPHR is the President, of GEB’s Enterprise Consulting, LLC. and the Director of Human Resources for a nonprofit housing development organization in Harlem, NY. For the past 20 years, Grace has directed the HR functions for corporations ranging in size from 100 to 500 employees covering the health, social services, higher education, and service industries, authored numerous employee handbooks, created HR programs, training and systems. Grace is a Board Member at the National Association of African Americas in Human Resources of Greater New York (NAAAHR-GNY) and the Human Resources Association of New York (HR/NY), as well as Chair of the Not for Profit Special Interest Group with HR/NY.

She is also an Adjunct Instructor, and currently working on a DBA in Business Administration with Walden University.


http://www.linkedin.com/in/gracebm

Purvi Shah, Non-Profit & Media Consultant

Known for her sparkly eyeshadow and raucous laughter, Purvi Shah inspires change as a non-profit consultant, anti-violence advocate, and writer. She has a 20-year track record promoting initiatives that further equity, safety, education, creativity, economic access, and opportunities for underserved communities. She won the inaugural SONY South Asian Social Service Excellence Award for her leadership fighting violence against women. During the 10th anniversary of 9/11, she directed Together We Are New York, a community-based poetry project to highlight Asian American voices.Terrain Tracks is her award-winning poetry book and Dark Lip of the Beloved: Sound Your Fiery God-Praise is her new chaplet. 

Recently she hosted A Woman’s World, a radio show for South Asian American women to speak to their community advocacy and creativity. As a social justice leader and arts activist, she continues to foster a legacy in action. You can discover more at http://purvipoets.netor @PurviPoets.

Yuliya Mazur, Resource Communications Manager, JCC’s of North America

Yuliya has over fifteen years of executive management experience in the business and non-for-profit world with specific emphasis on business analysis, program development, event management, travel management, strategic planning, customer service, Jewish education and community work. Born and raised in Russia, Yuliya immigrated to the USA in 1997, and since then has spent a majority of the past 2 decades in the Travel & Hospitality industry and Jewish Communal Affairs.  This past year has seen her formally transition to a full time Jewish nonprofit professional role in February 2013.

She has degrees in English & Literature, French, Computer Programming & Systems Design and Jewish Studies and Nonprofit Management.

Moderator:


Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin, The Rockin’ Career Coach


Vicki Aubin(aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a personal branding and career transition strategist based in New York City who helps career revolutionaries reinvent themselves. With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, over a decade in Human Resources and Recruiting at Fortune 500 companies and as a successful career transitioner herself, Vicki helps her clients to unleash their inner rockstar, crank up the volume on their most marketable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. 

A featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series, Vicki is a regular mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or at @rockincareer.

results.description:
Why are you still single? You have value.  You are smart, funny, creative, thoughtful.  Anyone would be lucky to know you, let alone date you.  So ... What's missing?  Why ARE you still single? 

Register HERE!

Welcome to SPARK: a dating workshop not for the faint of heart, where you get constructive feedback from a group of your peers - your very own singles focus group. Energizeyourvoice.net founder, Minna Taylor, will facilitate a guided discussion to get to the root of what's holding you back. 

How do you percieve yourself? How do others perceive you? Are they the same? If not, what can we do to bridge the gap? You will learn about your first impression and what you're communicating that perhaps you're not aware that you're communicating.  Learn the fundamentals of how to reveal your essense so it is undeniable and magnetic. Let others discover how amazing you already are.

Are you insecure, but read as arrogant? Do you smile with openness, but use a shy voice? Align your intention and your presentation.  Empower yourself with knowledge on how to be your most authentic self and finally land the one you love.  Find the SPARK you've been waiting for.  

Register HERE!

Hear what others had to say ...

"Awesome session.  That's worth saying again, awesome.  SPARK helped me see that overcoming the comfortable is a good way to start growing!" - Roger M.

"Why is no one else doing this? This workshop is exactly what I never knew I needed." - Kira C.

"Very well run! The organization and professionalism went a long way to making it very constructive." - Brett A.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask to be directed to the SPARK workshop.  Minna will be eagerly waiting to greet you as you arrive.

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING 

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

https://vimeo.com/90287327

https://vimeo.com/82163219

https://vimeo.com/87729077

https://vimeo.com/77569204

https://vimeo.com/89375819

Cost:

Your first sample meetup is $15 prepaid only: (choose 'new student' to get a discount) https://getdance.ticketleap.com/semi-private-dance-class/dates

Regular single meetup is $20 or you can get a package of 6 classes for $90 (each class comes up to $15)*

*new students only, available at link above

Cancellation policy: If you need to cancel please do so before 12pm on Tue to avoid being charged in full. No shows will be charged in full. Please plan accordingly


Please note that there is at least 4 guys/girls every meetup even though they don't RSVP here, this is a multi-meetup event - join us!

Rewards Cards available - get your card and start earning free classes!

See you on the dance floor! :-)

Monika

www.MonikaMatys.com

results.description:
A casino? In Manhattan? How could that be???

There is indeed a one-of-a-kind "casino" in Manhattan, hiding in an office building on 28th Street, with full-size craps, roulette and blackjack tables! You normally can only rent this unique venue for private parties and organizational fundraisers. But by special arrangement, they are opening their doors to our meetup group!

You have all the excitement of playing real casino games at real casino tables, with real chips and dressed-up, professional casino croupiers (who the casino brings in and pays), all without leaving Manhattan.

One fantastic thing is that you can do all this without risking any gambling money! When you arrive, you are given $2,000 in free chips. These chips should last you all night. Also, the professional croupiers will be giving lessons on how to gamble at all the tables. Your "money" should last you all night long.

The fact that you don't have to travel, and you can't risk any of your own money gambling here, are huge advantages for anyone visiting this one-of-a-kind, beautiful Manhattan venue.

There is a $20 cover charge, payable when you arrive. Since the venue brings in professional croupiers, and of course they have to pay their rent in this Manhattan office building, they do have to cover their costs.

There will be a full bar. There is no drink minimum. 

This event starts at 6:30pm and officially runs till 9:30pm. (You may arrive anytime.) The venue will stay open after 9:30 for us, and drinks will still be available.

Important Directions (Must Read): Big Deal Casino, at 1 East 28th Street, is located near the corner of 5th Avenue, and is on East 28th Street between 5th Ave. and Madison Ave. The actual small doorway is between Nader Food Mart and Yogo Zone. Ring Bell # 10, then take the elevator to the 6th Floor.


I am delighted that our meetup group has been able to arrange this one-of-a-kind evening, in the one-and-only "casino" that exists in Manhattan. Whether you are an experienced casino gambler, or you are a newbie who would like to learn the games without having to travel, this is sure to be an unparalleled evening. It really is a great opportunity to have a casino experience, without having to put gambling money at risk, and without having to travel.

P.S. Here is one more photo. It is casino owner Wendy Rubin, in a photo from a news article about her casino.
results.how_to_find_us: Directions: 1 East 28th Street is located near the corner of 5th Avenue, and is on East 28th Street between 5th Ave. and Madison Ave. The actual small doorway is between Nader Food Mart and Yogo Zone. Ring Bell # 10, then take elevator to 6th Floor.
results.name: Casino Night at Manhattan's Only "Casino"!­­!

results.description:
The next Pints 'n' Purls Meetup will be at The Bar at Whole Foods in Columbus Circle from 6:30-9:30 p.m., so drop in anytime you like. Bring your knitting, crocheting, cross-stitching, or whatever else you're working on and prepare for a blast!

I am not sure if this is up to date, but here is the beer <a>menu: http://www.beermenus.com/places/1868-whole-foods-market-columbus-circle</a>;

The bar is on the right past the registers.  Lots of food options!

Feel free to call Deborah (914/[masked])  or Amy (980/[masked]) with any questions. Hope to see you there!

Feel free to come earlier and grab a table.  With our schedules, we can't guarantee an organizer can make it there earlier than 6:30.

We hope that you will consider becoming or renewing your status as a "Pints 'n' Purls Contributor."  These voluntary dues help cover the costs of running the group, which include dues to Meetup.com, prizes for events, thank yous for hosts, etc.   ALL the money goes back into the group.  We are just hoping that you will share in some of the expenses that come out of organizing these fun and friendly events.  You can pay online or in person ($24/year We organize over 70 meetups a year.)
results.how_to_find_us: We are generally at a large table in the back of the restaurant section. Ask the staff if you don't see us- they know where to find us.

results.description:
This is a special event geared for startups, makers, designers, and inventors to showcase tech products which will be live streamed on Sandy Choi's Periscope cast which gets an average of 350 visitors per steam. While also being able to have it broadcasted and streamed via Periscope.

One of our confirmed main presenters is Mike Dearborn and Veronica Owens, presenting TiM. TiM is currently raising money on Kickstarter and is a software aimed at eliminating the need for paper in the entertainment industry.

In addition, their will be a presentation from Paul Rothbein about using 360 cameras for creating virtual reality video content. The cameras being demonstrated will be Kodak PixPro and 360Fly.

More presenters are pending.

Everyone is encouraged to BYOP (Bring Your Own Prototype/Product). Everyone is allowed to attend. If you would like to make a formal presentation about your product it must meet following criteria

• Technology displayed must be applicable to consumer technology
• Technology cannot already be commercially available on the mass market. If you can find the product at Best Buy or Walmart it cannot be presented.
• The technology must be demonstrable as a prototype or software mockup; no paper/concept/slideshow entries.

• The product DOES NOT need to be related to entertainment tech. The event will also be broadcasted online and will be live from where the event takes place in Manhattan. http://www.eventbrite.com/e/byop-bring-your-own-productprototype-and-live-streaming-tickets-21102162135

results.description:
A casino? In Manhattan? How could that be???

There is indeed a one-of-a-kind "casino" in Manhattan, hiding in an office building on 28th Street, with full-size craps, roulette and blackjack tables! You normally can only rent this unique venue for private parties and organizational fundraisers. But by special arrangement, they are opening their doors to our Vegetarian & Vegan Meetup group!

You have all the excitement of playing real casino games at real casino tables, with real chips and dressed-up, professional casino croupiers (who the casino brings in and pays), all without leaving Manhattan.

One fantastic thing is that you can do all this without risking any gambling money! When you arrive, you are given $2,000 in free chips. These chips should last you all night. Also, I will give you lessons on how to have a blast gambling, and how to make smart bets. And the professional croupiers will give lessons as well. Your "money" should last you all night long.

The fact that you don't have to travel, and you can't risk any of your own money gambling here, are huge advantages for anyone visiting this one-of-a-kind, beautiful Manhattan venue.

There is a $20 cover charge, payable when you arrive. Since the venue brings in professional croupiers, and of course they have to pay their rent in this Manhattan office building, they do have to cover their costs.

This evening is being sponsored by one of my very favorite vegan restaurants, the delectable VBurger which recently opened. The four people from our group who have won the most chips at the end of the night, at 9:30pm (the four "chip leaders") will each receive a $25 gift certificate from VBurger! VBurger is a new, very popular all-vegan restaurant with amazing burgers (black bean, cauliflower, "classic"), out-of-this-world onion rings, fantastic fries, portobello sandwiches, sloppy joes, un-chicken sandwiches, great salads (caesar, quinoa, arugula), kombucha, vegan milk shakes, delicious desserts, and more! Check out their menu.


There will be a full bar stocked with both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks for those that want them. There is no drink minimum. 


There will be gourmet vegan food for sale, including veggie burgers (kale, black bean and lentil, with garlic aioli), felafel burgers (dressed with tomatoes, lettuce and tahini sauce), fire roasted vegetable skewers, and homemade potato chips (with optional hot sauce, aioli and tahini dressings). Food purchase is entirely optional, just letting you know this will be available.


For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. Come to our meetup and make new friends.

This event starts at 6:30pm and officially runs till 9:30pm. (You may arrive anytime.) The venue will stay open after 9:30 for us, and drinks will still be available.

Important Directions (Must Read): Big Deal Casino, at 1 East 28th Street, is located near the corner of 5th Avenue, and is on East 28th Street between 5th Ave. and Madison Ave. The actual small doorway is between Nader Food Mart and Yogo Zone. Ring Bell # 10, then take the elevator to the 6th Floor.

I am delighted that our Vegetarian & Vegan Meetup group has been able to arrange this one-of-a-kind evening, in the one-and-only "casino" that exists in Manhattan. Whether you are an experienced casino gambler, or you are a newbie who would like to learn the games without having to travel, this is sure to be an unparalleled evening. It really is a great opportunity to have a casino experience, without having to put gambling money at risk, and without having to travel. All while in the wonderful company of our fantastic group of vegetarians and vegans!

David

P.S. Here is one more photo. It is casino owner Wendy Rubin, in a photo from a news article about her casino.
results.how_to_find_us: Directions: 1 East 28th Street is located near the corner of 5th Avenue, and is on East 28th Street between 5th Ave. and Madison Ave. The actual small doorway is between Nader Food Mart and Yogo Zone. Ring Bell # 10, then take elevator to 6th Floor.
results.name: Vegetarian/Vegan Casino Night at Manhattan's Only "Casino"!!

results.description:
Topic

This presentation will include:


-What is included in the start kit for Windows 10 and Rasberry Pi by AdaFruit (https://ms-iot.github.io/content/en-US/AdafruitMakerKit.htm)


-Available Projects Out of the Box

-System Requirements

-Project Templates Available in Visual Studio

-How to build the "What Color is It?" Project

-Demonstration of the "What Color is It?" Project

-Pitfalls involved in building the "What Color is It?" Project

Speaker

Becky Isserman has been a SharePoint developer and consultant since 2005, architecting out-of-the-box and custom-developed solutions for multiple clients in federal and commercial verticals. Her love of technology began at the St Louis Science Center, which she would visit just to use the Kid Pix, Eliza, and Hangman programs on their computers. At age 15, she started building websites in AOLPress and then Notepad. She is active in the New York City Developer Community and is a frequent speaker at events and user groups, from the Microsoft SharePoint Conference to SharePoint Saturdays to Code Camps. She was named a Microsoft SharePoint Server MVP in 2011 and 2012. She is a former organizer of SharePoint Saturday NYC and currently helps assist Code Camp NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: Central Park East Conference Room (6th Floor, Room 6501a)
results.name: Building Your First IoT Project for Windows 10

results.description:
Do you have a great idea for a technical talk but don't know where to begin?

Nicole Johnson, Solutions Architect for devops toolset and automation platform Chef and former president of her local Toastmasters chapter, will be sharing tips from her years of experience creating and giving technical talks.

Bring a talk idea and your laptop, or a pen and paper, and leave with an outline and some individualized feedback on how to do your best!

6:30-7: Food & socializing
7-8:  Nicole - A Talk on How to Give Talks:     
- What makes for a good tech talk topic?   
- How to structure your talk    
- Make your talk memorable - engaging the audience, handling objections, etc.   
7:300-8:00: Work on an idea for your very own talk
8:00-9:00: Present your talk idea and get feedback

Please note: this is an event intended for software developers who identify as women. 

We define "software developer" as anyone who has written a line of code (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, Java, whatever) and can explain what it does. Write/Speak/Code is for women, cis and trans, and is emphatically trans and queer friendly.
results.name: How to put together a tech talk

results.description:
TO RSVP YOU MUST REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE AS WELL!


</a><a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-code-nyc-workshop-javascript-101-tickets-23955911777?aff=meetup">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-code-nyc-workshop-javascript-101-tickets-21896284376


Coming via Subway? Here's some directions to our classroom:

http://www.nycseminarcenter.com/visiting/subway.cfm


Goal: Write your first lines of JavaScript code. 

Whether you want to build your own websites or just want to communicate better with developers, this class will get you started! 

You'll leave knowing:

• What the JavaScript language is, why it was created and how it's used today

• How JavaScript works with web browsers to create interactivity

• Fundamental JavaScript: syntax, types, variables, keywords and functions

Meet your instructor: 

Tyler Lambe was a professional developer across all platforms for over 6 years, before he made the transition into teaching full-stack web development. Having crafted full-fledged software engineers who previously had no experience, his passion lies in helping people accelerate their lives through education.

Note: Students will need to bring their own laptops! Windows, Mac or Linux will do it! Our preferred web browser is Google Chrome.
results.name: Learn to Code Workshop: JavaScript 101

results.description:
Don't let some of the best four years go by without upping your earning potential on a practical level this summer.  No matter what major is chosen, some background in programming will ensure that rent can be paid and mom and dad can relax.  You'll also have a great time as part of our coding bootcamp and member of community.

During the evening we'll discuss our special programs and payment options for students; you'll also learn the in's and outs of our industry-oriented fulltime Python Fullstack coding bootcamp. We will discuss our curriculum, application process and other aspects of Byte's coding bootcamp, an education form generating buzz recently.

Did you know that Python is the highest paid programming language for recent bootcamp graduates?  We also are the first ever to offer a FinTech (financial technology) program and also offer Data Science and MedTech (medical technology).

There will be networking with instructors, students, staff, FinTech and tech community members.  There will be a presentation and refreshments will be served.

results.name: Summer Special Career & Coding Info Session

Are you looking to create community with other single parents? We're inviting single parents and intended single parents to share their journeys to parenthood. results.description:
Book Description:
”I was born in a harem in 1940 in Fez, Morocco...” So begins Fatima Mernissi in this exotic and rich narrative of a childhood behind the iron gates of a domestic harem. In Dreams of Trespass, Mernissi weaves her own memories with the dreams and memories of the women who surrounded her in the courtyard of her youth—women who, deprived of access to the world outside, recreated it from sheer imagination. Dreams of Trespass is the provocative story of a girl confronting the mysteries of time and place, gender and sex in the recent Muslim world.
results.name: Dreams of Trespass: Tales of a Harem Girlhood by Fatema Mernissi

The game of Cashflow simulates real-life financial management and features realistic Real Estate investing scenarios designed to show you how these types of transactions work in real life and both helps you learn how to effectively utilize them in their investing strategies. It also helps to find out your investing style, whether you are aggressive in your strategies or conservative so we can see in which of these you are most comfortable. meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
